QIx8Nb2-SNnqWKNbnM20vg.text: The only good that came from eating here was that the bill was comped.  Went for dinner 22 April. Everything was fine up until the part where people actually eat, which is a major issue being a restaurant. Two distinctly different dishes were ordered; yellow curry with tofu and Seafood Delight. Hers came out in a reasonable amount of time. I told her to not wait for me and eat, believing my order would be coming out shortly.  Meanwhile, a table of two came in, and was seated at a table that was in my line of sight. They got their drinks, ordered and started to eat  Every so often, staff would peek around to see me, sitting there not eating. Eventually, one of the waitresses comes over.  "Is everything okay? Everything except I haven't received my order."  Minutes later...  "Is everything okay? Is there something wrong in the kitchen? I'm still waiting for my food."  Her response was that the order slipped through the cracks because of a larger party's (20+) order, which doesn't sound right. The party she was talking about was already seated and eating when we walked in, and the table that was seated in my line of sight came in after us and was already eating. Additionally, our order was taken on one ticket, not two (2) separate orders, so both orders should have been started at the same time  My plate finally shows up, but I'm so upset that I don't eat. For five minutes, I debate whether or not to ask for the manager. And again, every so often the staff would peek around to see me, sitting there and not eating. Was finally persuaded to just eat so we can leave.  We had finished our meals. The male waiter shows up, and asks how things are going. She had asked for a to go container, which was brought promptly. She filled the container with her leftovers, and the dishes were taken away.  We sat around for another 15 minutes. No one bothered to ask if we were ready for our check. That table of two? Already out the door. While we were waiting, we had a talk about her talking with management, because I knew she would be calmer than I would be. We go to the front and had to ask the hostess we would like to pay, but we never received a bill.  "What table was yours? The table that had to wait over fifteen minutes for my dinner."  At that point, I pulled $25 out of my pocket, and handed it to her while taking her take out container. Was so livid that I told the hostess that she had something to say to management and I had to leave  She finally came out, and I got the lowdown.  - A lot of apologies were given, but no real action to correct the situation (Which I take as, no one cares enough to follow up) - Of the three wait staff (2 F, 1 M) who came to our table, not once did the male member mention he was the manager - Lots of finger pointing going around: waitress(es) believed since the manager came over, he would take care of us; manager believed waitress(es) was still serving us.

0lhwu8nN-nu5WwbDOBkxWA.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant everytime I come they treat like family! Plus the food is amazing! !

4VUvy--IWwlUP24iiusB_A.text: Came on a Sunday night after work to find myself greeted by a friendly you g lady and a nicely unobtrusive singer with a guitar. Had the Tom Kha and a satay chicken and they were both pretty great. It wasn't overwhelmingly outstanding, but it was certainly worth me stopping in.  Pleasant atmosphere and a friendly staff, not a bad night out.

ldALm5nDvlqj7QepWyfPXw.text: Great food. Calm atmosphere. Lunch special prices are good but if you venture off the lunch specials you tab will go up considerably. Same with items from the bar. Overall I like place

Ev7CUeQ_n3fOloOaCNYvBg.text: I was driving around in Chinatown looking for something to eat. Then the Krung Siam Thai catering truck caught my eye. If they do catering, they have to be good right? Yet again confirming my thoughts are the Yelp and Urbanspoon stickers on the door.   Lunch special from 11a-3p? Yes please! Beef drunken noodle + thai ice tea = $7.56. Yes thank you!  The thai ice tea is super sweet so I love it. The drunken noodle was a bit on the oily side but still pretty tasty. The portion seemed a little on the small side but I guess that means I can eat again in another hour.   This place is A-ok.

F_wSnOUXwM8yMngmqQ873Q.text: I think this used to be a Malaysian joint. In any case, what a wonderful restaurant! I love their Lunch $1 Thai tea & coffee and of course happy hours!  The food is really quite good and cheap! The panang was just perfect, careful with your spicy level. I am normally an 8.5, but don't do an 8 here or you will be crying for more $1 ice drink! I find authentic places do their spicy levels quite well.  I'd opt for a 6 here to enjoy your food.  Service was so-so. It was not busy but the servers just don't seem to be around much after the food arrives.   Restroom is kinda dirty i think. But who cares...just come here for food!

s1vxU3VnsSIq5SLpIhwNAg.text: it's was so-so for me. the food was good, but not great.   The chicken pad thai was too sweet and could have used a little bit more fish sauce. panang red curry was also too sweet for my taste. I asked for 8/10 on the spicy scale. But the sauce was a solid 5. Not until I ate a piece of red chili pepper then it really turn to a True 8.   May visit again to try some other dishes.

cjhuZC4xHHJVyrlHYCp4tw.text: Very Americanized thai food! I would recommend: Weera Thai or Thai Style Noodle House. I had the panang curry and it was very bland... if you are not used to spicy food or if you don't really like authentic Thai then this place is probably best for you. If you are used to eating a lot of asian food and like a little spice, try somewhere else.

r2eqOEtpUVOSrSrbmAqNOA.text: Absolutely delicious food, fresh, and fun atmosphere. Really enjoyed the soda and Bulgogi!

g9KlmcvMDTfBmZuuIRR3mQ.text: Best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Good prices and wonderful staff. Casual environment with a nice stage for bands to play. All good comes in levels of spiciness. 5 is a good level to begin with if you enjoy spicy food; their levels run on the spicy side so 6 will be what is a normal 8. I highly recommend the panang curry and the Thais beef salad.

Xxi5co2CboQhWNMNleagiA.text: Crispy fish is soggy but the drunken noodle is good. The Tom yum came out not cooked.. The worse of all is the bathroom. It is so grossed! Worse than Walmart. For this I am not coming back

6VM5ul2URV3ti2cJFCCvfA.text: I only give this place 2 stars because the staff was great.  The food looks amazing but that's all. The flavor just wasn't there.  My husband's pork looked like over cooked bacon slabs. I paid extra for shrimp and scallops which were both rubbery in texture and totally tasteless.  Save your money and try someplace else if you're wanting Thai food in Vegas.

VSqohaqP4C1SQhheLsEiOA.text: it's fun to come here at 2 am when other asian restaurants nearby are closed. Food was so so, some hit, some missed. A bit loud with with club music they're playing in the background. The waitresses were very nice and friendly, if it wasn't for them, i would have giving 1 less star.

05ftc535npxICERfyFoGvw.text: Horrible service! Waiting for table to be cleaned and wait 15 min to find out table was given to another couple! Order food and waiter doesn't speak any English and leaves are table and doesn't send another waiter until I find someone myself..then doesn't bring drinks out while everyone in place is screaming drunk to the lame karaoke..after waiting forever to get food I have to take my drink to bar to ask for anther because no one will come back to out table then I ask why we haven't even gotten out appetizers to find out their going to be serving everything we ordered at once..this is crazy I've never had such horrible service with them before and have been here serval times and this will most definitely be the last time I come.

J61pobKrrn7kE7ZUHLbhaw.text: Great service, good ambiance, good service. Not much to rave about since I tried familiar dishes.   Ambiance:  I dined during the evening, so it was quite dim during this service. The decor seemed nice, as I did see some traditional Thai statues. There are TVs around for your viewing pleasure...however I believe infomercials are for viewing at home. During the entire service, Shaun T's new workout DVD was playing. Can this guy get any more greedy?!   Service: Very nice and pleasant. The server I think didn't quite understand what vegan meant or maybe the kitchen just heard "vegetarian" and assumed no meat but egg is fine. Though I did request no fish or oyster sauce and no egg, the dish came out with egg.   Food:  I ordered the papaya salad with no fish sauce. It was really good. I love spicy, and after reading a review before dining about how spicy spicy is, I went with a level 3 on the salad. That was still spicy for me. I think I'll order a 2 next time. I can't imaging what a 10 is.  The pad Thai was ok. Sadly this one didn't please. I was hoping to find something wow about it but instead it was a bit sweet and oily.   Presentation: The papaya salad is good to share. It was huge and very pretty looking... The pad Thai...well I don't think you can make it look pretty, but you can make it look tasty!   Overall: Loved that I was able to find a new Thai dining option. Would I come here often? Not so much, but if I were in the area, sure. I'll be sure to try other dishes too. I do find pad Thai and papaya salad to be on the safe side.   As a vegan, be sure to be very specific with your server and check the food before you eat it. I learned that lesson hard after eating in San Diego. Here at Krung Siam, I had to send back the pad Thai because it had egg in it.   Happy dining!

UBSlWvJueGT6jDEf3FEfBg.text: This place is really good. Every time I'm in Vegas I try and stop in. The food is great and the staff is friendly. I have tried multiple dishes here and it's all good from the pad thai to the curry. What really makes this place great is the hours. When you are done partying on the strip you can take a quick cab over to Krungs and have amazing food until 5:30 in the morning. Best place to eat Thai food at any hour of the day. If you love Thai food you need to pay a visit to Krungs Siam.

mL7XLr3DUb7tkHGd1Szb6w.text: This place is over priced for what you get! I ordered shrimp fried rice and shrimp Tom yum. The fried rice wasn't fried and looked like one and a half cups of rice with too much garnish and few shrimp, no taste what so ever!!! 14$?!! The soup was ok maybe ten shrimp in the pot. And way too much garnish mostly bamboo chutes, 19$!!! But the worst part about this place is the waitresses who care more about the music they are blasting and they took my order then played on the stage looking for music. Then she shouted out drink order to another girl who got it wrong and calls green tea water. Service sucks!!! First time I never tipped and I strongly believe in tips, I'm sure they got a tip from the two entrees and two tea being over forty bucks. Here is a tip don't go here if your hungry and want good service and a place to relax!!!! The music is annoying so loud, the waitresses don't speaka any enggwish lol and are rude!

LlI1j5DFr74Ssx9pBcfpYA.text: What a nice place. Driven by for a while and decided to try. Priced well and the thai tea was excellent. I ordered my lunch spicy 7 out of 10 and it was on par for flavor. New lunch place for me! Very clean and staff was very nice. If you like Thai food, give it a try!

iuHZjRPejZrUABe6j0wNiQ.text: This is the most beautiful Thai restaurant I have ever been to in Las Vegas. The interior is so chic and literally looks like a 5 star restaurant. I gave 4 stars for the service, and their terrible alcohol! Probably the strongest, worst tasting cocktails I have ever tasted. Their food is incredible though and I have never had a bad food experience here! Highly recommend their dishes :)

3WzXkMBsCIlgf45XY30Rrw.text: Went here for late night dinner.  Restaurant was very dim lit so hard to see menu.  Food was incredible if you know what to order.  I suggest trying something besides everyone's usual pad thai and fried rice.  We had tom saap beef, thai style papaya salad, combination boat noodle soup and chinese broccoli with crispy pork belly.  Server was super attentive.

7uhWSusAWD3QNh73gKHvLQ.text: A solid Thai restaurant. Heed my words: They make their dishes %#$@& spicy, I mean hot daaamn spicy. I'm usually a 7 or 8 at other Thai restaurants so naturally I ordered an 8 for my pad thai here - big mistake. Next time I ordered a 7 for my pad-si-yu and still tears were dripping out of my eyes *-*  I don't know what it is, but I can't go higher than a 4 at this place. The food however, is very solid. I love the interior and sometimes they have live music. It's one of the few Thai restaurants in the area that is open late so I love coming here when I'm up for a late night dish.

z0Ph_GWQGr6uTmSpvjlzeQ.text: The food was absolutely amazing!!! The only thing stopping this place from a 5 star rating is the volume of the live music. The music was fantastic as was the live artist, we loved him! The only complaint is that the volume was so loud, we couldn't hear our friends or the server which complicated everything. We asked for it to be turned down a bit, but were told they couldn't until after his performance. What a shame! The volume was the only in enjoyable part of the whole night! Seriously, I have heard friends better in a night club!

dL1Jb_8pVCYDAgDuwEP9HQ.text: When I went there was a live band on stage or more like (employee) singers doing karaoke on a stage. It was entertaining to say at best, but a large group there was going wild for it! The place is very big and can accommodate late groups. I saw a full bar, but didn't have pleasure of ordering from it this time, maybe next! The servers are nice, but not alotta small talk. The food is up to par compared to my favorite Thai restaurants in town, but this places' prices were higher. I'd go back on special occasions or if invited to a large gathering, but this place didn't  wow me enough to stray from my usual favorite spot. But still...can expect authentic Thai taste here.

mNodGD8C3vkOlVI8npL4Lg.text: My favorite thai restaurant In town. Atmosphere in nice and the food is excellent.  If your a fan of thai food and know the real thing versus just okay thai food then you will appreciate this place like I do!

iH2XGn7sFydK9jmKkQG9Qg.text: I love this Thai Restaurant!  Amazing quality dishes, great service, a live band and a full bar, what more can one ask for?!?!  Arrived here with two other friends at around 6:45pm on a Thursday evening. We were seated immediately and was at a booth next to the stage where the live band played. (When we arrived the live band was still setting up)  The three of us ordered to share 1.) Thom Yum Seafood (I highly rate this dish and recommend it) it was perfectly zesty, hot and sour. The mixture of seafood was also impressive. There were scallops, fish, shrimp, scallops, crab meat, mussels and squid. I loved it! 2.) Beef Salad- Thai Style (I also highly rate and recommend the dish). The beef was tender and the spices were extremely tasty. This beef salad is probably one of the best that I have had in Vegas! 3.) Chicken padt Siew (I've had better but was decent).  The service was incredibly good. The waiters were very nice, attentive and courteous.   *be sure to ask for the chili tray*

K1wvQGhsaqbEm8-Xe4VhVA.text: They serve up a mean spice! The restaurant is quite large so you can accommodate larger groups or just a table for 2. I've gone for lunch multiple times and during the very late night hour for a sober up meal. They have a great priced lunch menu that comes with soup, salad, egg roll and your entree in a bento box tray. It's not the most amazing thai food but it is decently authentic. I recommend the yellow curry, pad prik king and the sweet sticky rice with mango dessert is really good. *On the mango sticky rice dessert however mine had this chunk of rice that had a green tint to it. I asked if that was supposed to be that way and the server was unable to translate what it was that caused it. I just chose not to eat that part just in case.

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Rice Mango dessert. Tasty but had a mystery green tint to it.

uuPfmLM6i9R37z9GKn-W1Q.text: This place really knows how to satisfy with their moist and flavorful pad thai! The noodles are soaked with delicious flavor, perfectly cooked, with lots of moist chicken, and I especially loved their fried soft tofu. The tofu adds a wonderfully luscious texture.   My boyfriend and I have eaten a lot of pad thai in Vegas since we've moved here and this one takes the crown. There is nothing better than juicy, moist, and flavorful pad thai noodles. Comfort food for sure. Major plus that they are open way late!   They are not afraid to use spices here, which is great for spice lovers like ourselves. Their spicy #8 had a great kick to it! (((True to spice))) Even their chili tray had everything you need: thai chilies in fish sauce, Serrano chilies in vinegar, sugar, and dry powdered chilies. The chilies were very spicy and flavorful (not for the faint of heart.)  We've also tried their other dishes and they aren't half bad - I just found minor annoyances with them.   Panang beef curry - Their version was watery, I prefer my curry thick. But the overall curry was actually flavorful. 3/5  Beef pad see ew - great flavor and very generous on the beef, I just wish they offered more noodles to balance the dish out. 4/5  Big plus that they are open late! The service here was quick at 2am on a Saturday. The ambiance was dark and the live Thai karaoke was entertaining. We've eaten here twice in a week already because that pad thai keeps calling my name. I just might become the duchess here because this is my new regular spot of pad thai!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m a sucker for juicy moist and flavorful pad Thai! They make the best one in Vegas I&#39;ve had yet. Big portion as well.
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They had Thai Karaoke after 2am when we arrived. It was definitely entertaining
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef panang curry. It had some good flavor, but we thought the consistency was too watery. Also a big portion.

iVL2L2AVVmoiYDZAWyxCwA.text: The food here is okay with all the other Thai restaurants in Vegas you can skip this one. The only reason I came here is because Chada Thai was booked. Go there if you have the chance it's the best. When I came to this restaurant however I went with a service animal and because I didn't have the papers they kicked me out. I don't carry the papers with me every where I go because it can be a hassle and I've never gone to a restaurant before that kicked me out because I had a service animal. Never going here again for the rude way they handled the situation with me.

urQiwbDy9-adOVr2idUvow.text: We often go here cause it closes late and I like their pad thai,  but our recent visit was not good. I know they are a little bit busy so we had to be patient, it took them 25mins to serve our food. we only ordered 2 dishes that's why I wasn't expecting to wait that long. Then during the meal nobody even checked on us. The food was kinda spicy so we needed some water and it took 10mins just to get the servers attention despite of us calling them they looked so busy with the big group. I just hope next time they would pay attention to other guests too. The food is good and some days the service is okaybut expect to wait long on you order.

0YH51slQeYq2MpoWwr9IQQ.text: Amazing thai food. We ordered the Penang curry,  Pad thai and drunken noodles. All of these were simply amazing. The best thai food we have had so far.

uBG4-BEvP4q3m0b1W3HXHA.text: Krung has a variety of flavor packed dishes.  So far I have tried their Pad-Thai, Duck Tammarind, and Drunken noodles.  The Duck Tammarind is a can't miss dish and one I would recommend to start, but I haven't found a dish I haven't cleaned yet.

h6EDWjLychTUilFrrCgaug.text: Love the artwork in this place!  Love the Lychee martinis even more!!!! Haha! Omg I just love them!  The rad nar was very good and so was that grilled squid! I liked the pad Thai but I've had better..... my bf said their noodles were too slippery and not normal noodles lol. They were ok. Just not the type of noodles were used to. The prices are perfect. r1t90f5w4KdrZjTLpPTfmA.text: The food is good but not necessarily fantastic. It is very reasonable. One thing though that stands out is Teri the musician who serenades you with the classics... For an old soul who just wants to relax and unwind away from  the hustle and bustle of Vegas life, this  is the place to hang out...

tsb1w4yvL620H7jeQwAaWA.text: Beware; ordering a dish with a spicy factor of five means that you will be attempting to ingest the first few circles of hell.   No really. I'm actually afraid of the idea of ordering a ten.  After my first failed venture I was a little hesitant about returning, but where else can you get decently priced Thai food at 3:30 in the morning?  My second go went much better - I decided on the appetizer combo dish along with a Thai Beef Salad (level three spice this time). The beef was a little heavy on the lime, but other than that it was amazing. I can't recall having a mint and lime leaf salad before this... But I would definitely have it again.   Add in the very modern, upscale decor and you've got a winner on your hands.

_QUrPugHOEUfC5rPS_-Muw.text: In the mood for some Thai, like spicy wtf is this made with hot sauce spicy? Then this is the place. I order the shrimp red curry with the spiciest they can make; which is a ten. Well damn every office or my body was leaking water, my sinus cleared up and I drunk more water in 45minutes than I had in the last weak. It was oh so worth it and it washes down great with Thai tea. The perfect sweet to spicy combination that can never do you wrong. They have a huge variety of food choices; I have to come back again to try them all but this place is a must try!  The service is pretty decent but sometimes the server can forget you if you are in a both or a corner and if it's not to busy. Otherwise night spot for date night.

hwYw_2GAnI5eTIZolpC3yw.text: Excellent food.......the best Tom yum soup ever. The flavours where fantastic and extremely fresh. Will be coming back next time in Vegas.

LfXrdrvDGQcT_siKxeeN_Q.text: We came on a Monday evening after a long day and ordered  1. Tom Yum (pot) Seafood - Spicy 5: 16.99 2. Pad Thai chicken: 9.99 3. Seafood Delight - Spicy 3: 14.99 4. 3 Steamed rice: 4.50  5. Garlic Pepper chicken: 9.99 6. Red Curry Beef: 10.99 for $85.05 (automatic 18% tip charge AFTER tax)    - Easy to spot, but hard to get to! Coming from the strip, off of Spring Mtn, and to this place, does everyone have to make an illegal u-turn off Valley View?! haha - Great looking bar and dine for a Thai restaurant, but bathrooms don't match! - Ambiance doesn't match service.  - Lame and lazy service. On a slow evening, we have to hunt down Takky to tell her we're ready to order, get drink refills, remove empty plates, organize our own table. No ass kissers here. Fail. - Tom yum had great flavor, strong sour and spicy taste. hot! Loved it, but a bit expensive for tom yum. Too much cilantro. - Pad Thai chicken was delicious! Just how I want my Pad Thai to taste.  - Seafood Delight was a dry and spicy. I couldn't imagine how it would taste if it were a 5! Yikes! Mussels are tiny but packed with flavor. Too much onions.  - Garlic Pepper chicken packed a punch of garlic! A Vampire's nightmare. Good with the broccoli.  - Red Curry beef was pretty good, but I should have just gotten the Panang. Ugh.. - Automatic gratuity = 6 or more in party. - SNEAKS! Charging tip after tax.

GwV1Nq-N84Nvep6uO65QdQ.text: This place is a nice upscale, decently authentic Thai restaurant in Chinatown.  I had the Crab Rangoon, the duck curry, and some Thai Iced tea.   Overall I wasn't overly impressed, but I could see bringing friends or a date to this place.    The Crab Rangoon was very sweet.  The sauce reminded me of pomegranate jelly. Not bad, but definitely not the best.  Way too sweet in my book.  The Thai tea was alright, but it tasted a little cheap or perhaps with artificial sweeteners.  The duck curry (red curry) was the best part of the meal.  It was actually quite tasty.  This dish had a surprising mixture of green and red peppers, tiny chopped carrots, peas, fresh pineapple chunks, and raisins.  The red curry itself was satisfactory in taste, and had a watery texture that soaked well into the white rice.  It was served with the perfect level of spice (I asked for medium), and it was not too sweet.  Not a bad dish at all.  I didn't have any problems with the service, which I've noticed in a few reviews.  The place was mostly staffed by younger Asians, and they were having a good time while working, so maybe there are nights when the staff get carried away... I dunno.  The atmosphere was very classy though, with jazz music in the background.  I probably won't go back on my own again, but like I said earlier, this would be a nice place to take a date.

YJ1C45sVZNATMOKi3VWYpA.text: Awesome! Ask for 10 for spicy! The $15 Thai beer special is godly and helps cut the heat. Very refreshing. This service is great. I had no problem tipping 20%

kvTk6OsE4w0sgTPNoxk95w.text: I've given this place enough chances because they're on my way home and open late.  They're customer service is not great, the restroom is dirty, their menu is not updated there are several things that they no longer have and the pricing is different. Food is not the best but definitely not the worst.   This last time takes the biscuit. I ordered food to go and upon arriving home, found a dead baby cockroach smashed on the side of the box of fried rice.  I called and spoke to the manager and they offered to make me a new fried rice- that's it.  Never again.

kyJCeNrPCfD66MuLDI47qQ.text: Most items are very good. Having eaten in the home country, I think my idea of how it should be is pretty accurate. The staff is all Thai which is a good sign, obviously, that you'll get authentic food. Karaoke and live music on different nights. Great for dates but be prepared to pay a little extra. Can become pricey. A couple things that I've never heard of before I tried and was not impressed. But everything else is really good. Stick with what you know and you should be fine. 9Gj4flKvO28UXHkWA1jq-g.text: I have ate there at least 8 times before this visit and had a decent experience every time. But consistency is really the key, I prefer a place that is always C than a place that is 98% A+ and 2% F.   I used to order the tom yum soup with shrimp, which I always liked with spicy level 6. Not too spicy, not too mild for my taste. This last time, I'm ordering for the table, so I ask for less spicy than normal at 5, it's comes so ridiculously spicy that is not possible to eat it. I think okay, maybe only the mistake is in the soup, but when the food came with spicy levels of 4-6, same thing. MUCH MUCH hotter than my previous experiences (the previous time, maybe the prior week)  As the result, my friends have stomach pain all morning today.     In addition to that, our waitress was very very rude - showing us lots of attitude. They bring one of our plates 15 minutes before the other ones. I handed her my plate, and asked her if she could bring it with the rest of the food, and she literally rolled her eyes and left the plate down. Later on, she pours the soup on a friend, and doesn't even apologize. Unbelievable.   You might ask, why didn't you ask them to take the spicy food back to the kitchen. Because the waitress was so unaccommodating that we didn't feel like that is an option.  It really sounds I'm making this up or exaggerating, right? This many bad things can't happen all on the same day, you'd say. There might have been something wrong with this dude and his friends. Trust me, it was worse than I explained. I have eaten out most nights last 7-8 years, and this was the very first time I left $0 tip, and that was before hearing of stomach problem of my friends this morning.  To be fair and give benefit of the doubt, this was the night before Christmas, and they might have been out of their usual staff.

8ChP54dejAfXG8jNZ6aT2w.text: Worst food poisoning ever on 3/29/19. Pad z u did me wrong. Spent a day in the hospital

-7_Ar6txJTuFmq2YOgNbfw.text: This place is how you do business. Located in China town this place stands out the most. Bear in mind there are a million other Thai spots on the street. So choosing this one was strictly based of Yelp reviews. Man am I glad we listened.  Walked in and first thing you see is a gorgeous stream of water running down a mirrored wall. At night it's beautiful and adds flair as you walk in. We were immediately greeted and sat. Restaurant wasn't too busy but again it was early dinner. I don't mind when it's slower because my food is faster and always tastes better.   We ordered our drinks and appetizers off the bat. We got and order of crab rangoons and a platter which consisted of chicken satay, spring rolls, crab Rangoons and pork dumplings. Each having their own sauce to dip in such as sweet and sour and peanut sauce. Best satay I have had in a LONG time. Spring rolls weren't my favorite but everything else was good for an app.  Our server came to take our order. He didn't write it down but spoke it back to us perfectly. Food came out staggered with entrees. I think they thought we were doing family style which we were not. So my meal came about 5 minutes later.  The staff seems to work as a team because I had about 4 different people waiting on us from order taking, to bussing, to drink refills. Team work makes it work better. I didn't sit there waiting for anything because someone was always around.  I obviously ordered Pad Thai. As we all know on here that's like all I get. Their spice meter is all over the place. I can handle spice and the 2 was a lot. For me it tasted great. For some at the table it was TOOOO hot and that was just a 2 out of 10. Pad Thai was great. Didn't have too many peanuts which I like an abundance of. I actually added pineapple to it and it made it even better. Try it next time you get pad Thai. All meals were large and can be split for two or good for take home left overs.  We all saw fried bananas on the menu so you KNEW that was happening. Came out at a good time. Not overly battered and very warm. The bananas were very tasty. I thought it was a caramel sauce on it but it was honey and I hate honey so I had to eat around it :( we had ours served with mango and coconut ice cream.  Other than that this place is great! Defiantly check it out if you are in China town. I know there is a lot to choose from but you won't regret this place.

5-I_jZLvdUbloNVu98tIJA.text: When it's late and your hungry and you have a taste for Thai, Krung Siam is a perfect choice. We had the crab fried rice, panang curry chicken, rad nar with beef and the sweet sticky rice with lychee. The crab rice was very good, not overly greasy, not mind blowing but very nice on the palate. The rad nar was like an Asian version of an American beef stew but not as rich and heavy. It was warming on a cold winter night and the thick flat noodles were a delightful change of pace.  The panang curry chicken was loaded with flavor and I love the fact that they use white meat chicken which was very tender and cooked just right... they serve a bowl of white rice on the side which is great for absorbing all the delicious panang sauce, personally I think they need to make the side of rice a little larger. Finally, for dessert we had the sticky rice with lychee, it was served warm and had a mildly sweet flavor.  The lychee fruit added a nice touch with its combination of sweet and tart... we all agreed that we prefer the sticky rice with mango at Archie's best! I have been to this location a few times, originally at the recommendation of one of my poker dealer friends from a Strip hotel.  It is a high-quality, fantastic option for those people getting off of work late, just wrapping up from a night of partying or celebrating or like me - a mom with her daughter and her daughter's friend starving after a night of ice-skating at the Cosmo:-)

3o3nMVIkYTgQCni31OvgqA.text: Went here expecting a great experience due to many of the good reviews about this place. The restaurant was clean and looked appealing, but you can't judge a book by its cover right? It all started with the drinks. A couple of my buddies came to eat and have a few drinks, but they didn't even have a bartender to make drinks that night. What restaurant has a bar with no bartender. I ordered a mojito and the person who made it crushed the mint leaves leaving a taste of chlorophyll in the drink. Then came the time to order the food. Ordering was easy and the waiter came by to check on us at a good time, but after ordering we waited for nearly over an hour for the food to come. The restaurant wasn't all too busy and during that wait the waiter did not come to check on us once and I had to flag down the waiter just to ask when the food will be ready. After an hour the food came and by that time we weren't all that hungry anymore. When the check came our waiter said sorry for the wait we have applied a discount to your check and walked away. They gave us a 10% discount and it wasn't applied to the drinks and didn't even cover the tax. When we asked for the manager to plead our case he said "we applied a discount and that's all we can do" and then proceeded to walk away. Now I'm not the type to complain, but that was the worst experience I've had eating at a restaurant. Won't be coming back again. Would give zero stars if I can.

7oUldEopnvUgmEuIV2D-UQ.text: Referred by a casino dealer to visit this Thai restaurant as well as Kung Fu over Lotus of Siam. I've been to Lotus of Siam and it's awesome, but I also like to explore around of all the good eats in Vegas.  Food: - Grilled Squid ($10): BOMB. Must order. It's serve with two sauces, the green cilantro is my FAV (wish I can learn their recipe) and it's a FULL SQUID.  - Tom Yum with Shrimp ($13 bowl): this was delicious. We ordered level 6 spicy and that was pretty spicy. I recommend to order 4-5 to enjoy it (that's btw mild and med). Amazing flavor and comes with 5 shrimp if you choose shrimp. A Bowl only only feed 2-3 ppl.   - Thai Basil Beef Rice ($12): AMAZING. One thing it's missing is a sunny side up egg. This is probably one of the best basil rice I had. I come from 626 with restaurants such as Noodle World, President Thai, Daisy Mint, Saladang, etc.   Overall: We came here on a Saturday about 8pm. Got seated immediately. Service was spectacular. They were very attentive and not once did we have to ask to refill our drinks. I highly recommend to check out this place if you are in town. This has shorter wait time and great tasting food.

NcozaYVv1xv-snItG30byw.text: The food was delicious,  and the service was excellent.  Of course we had a waitress who was great,  but there were three other folks helping our table too.  We always had our drinks topped off by one of the wait staff.  They also have a picture menu,  which was pretty cool.  I would absolutely eat here again.

InZWvvl8d5V8NSt7uSPwWQ.text: Yelp 100 Challenge * 59/100  Landed here with the parentals during another of our foodie ventures.   Spotlight goes to their $5.99 lunch specials.   Frankly, I was skeptical about trying this place out at first, especially after hearing mixed reviews. Alright, maybe the servers were not as homey or warm as I would've expected them to be - but I will give them the benefit of the doubt and take it that I do get groggy myself at that time of day (2pm). Nonetheless, they got our orders down like lightning and our food arrived in less than 10 minutes.  Papa had the sweet and sour shrimp, mommy had garlic and pepper chicken and I got the yellow curry beef. I must've been the most satisfied out of the three of us. Curry was extra mild, as requested and the coconut milk brought out a rich overall flavor to the dish. I'd say it was sweet with a touch of spiciness - not eye-watering hot, but enough to keep the spoonfuls coming in.  Mommy liked her chicken. Didn't last too long. Papa wasn't too keen on his order because he said that it tasted like pre-cooked, pre-packaged and refrigerated shrimp tossed into a plate of sweet and sour sauce. To put it simply, I guess he meant that the flavor did not soak in too well.   Oh and how could I forget? We absolutely loved the soup! (it came with the lunch specials) Would've liked it too if there were side servings of egg roll and fried wonton for every order like the krung siam website said. Salmon was crossed out the menu for some reason (that was going to be my first option) so it's best to not rely on their site to be in the know how about what they currently have.   We'll be back here again for lunch soon. Enjoyed the peaceful ambiance and papa had a great time keeping score of the NBA playoffs thanks to the tellies lined up along the walls. They each had a different sport playing. At some point, he needed to know a team's score so I sifted through my phone to check it and hola, there was wi-fi! Could've been jacked from the starbucks right beside (very very possible) but still, you get to access it and that's the best part.

v_A4F6ze9Pwa0cIe_M-wcw.text: First off my girl and I have eaten here multiple times.. And every time it was mediocre service. This visit- at around 3:30am was our final due to the exceptionally shitty service.  We are both greeted and asked if we want either a booth or a table.. Then we are walked to our spot.  The host dude leaves us the menu.. Walks away. When he comes back we're ready to order so we do. We ask for the Tom Kha, no spicy no mushrooms with chicken, sticky rice and the drunken noodles no spicy no tomatoes with shrimp. Water an coke to drink.  There are 3 other groups of people besides us. So we wait... Our drinks come- then the server takes our order of soup to another table and theirs to us. We tell her, no thank you--wrong. Mean while this server is scrambling around trying to take care of all of us while the host kid has tape on all of his fingers dancing, no really.. Dancing around the restaurant trying to do closing work.. An hour and a half before they close. Since I've been here before I know this kids a server, I've had him.  We get our soup... It's warm............... Asked for the sticky rice, she brings it over. Then she brings the drunken noodles---- it has damn tomato quarters in it! I asked specifically for no tomatoes.. You're a server, you have 1 job, serve me and get my order correct. This is why you check it when it's in the window still. However, being as picky as I am.. I pick the tomatoes out. My girl starts waving at the waitress as she is talking to a co worker who's eating... Then she says heeeeeeey!!! So the waitress walks over and we ask for the check and some boxes to take our meal home.. The waitress takes our plates away and boxes every thing up for us- DOPE! Brings us our boxed food and the check.  Meanwhile host kid is still dancing around with strands of tape on his fingers.. Stop.  When we get home I pull the to go box out of the bag and there's a mfkin HAIR on the outside of the box... That leads inside the box onto my drunken noodles. That's why I'm changing my what was 2 star to a 1 star(right now). Needless to say I won't be eating my noodles   Okay. Rant over.

vREduWXVsiuQjbo7kARelw.text: Thai restaurant that delivers. So happy that there was a thai place near by Gold Coast. The food here is pretty good. Portion is reasonable. The spiciness is prefect. The only thing I really don't agree on is the price. $11 for pad thai with chicken. And $14 for pad thai with shrimp is a bit much for the portion. I ordered the basil chicken, I might be expecting much since I'm thai but still, the basil chicken doesn't really taste that great to me. But the pad thai and pad see ew and I guess everyone said that it was good. Another thing I liked is that they got my orders right. It a bit complicated but the orders came all correct. And the deliver was super fast.

mcHZPvifsBLTjXEJq9VoEQ.text: Larb Gai is on point! Tom Kha Gai is awesome. I've had better Pineapple Fried Rice, but I've also had worse. Service was prompt, polite, and not overbearing. I can't believe I haven't eaten here before!

26Qvxk0eu590KJ7bPK8kaA.text: Sat late night with a large party.  Ordered yellow chicken curry.  I enjoyed my food.  The server remembered who ordered what. Service was very smooth.  Tip was included on the tab, as we were a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ULcFjr_EJ_v2McayyWOxLA.text: Came here with a party of 5 and was seated immediately around 6 pm. We sat down and then a line started forming, haha!   I eat a lot of thai food, Asian in general. So I know what I'm saying when I say this place was great! We were a bit iffy to come here b/c of the ratings...but I'm happy we did!   We got seated next to the little stage and speakers. First thought, damn, we're right next to the speakers! A young guy came on and started singing Ed Sheeran, Sam Smith and stuff! He was playing the guitar while singing and he was realllly good! And no, sitting next to the speakers weren't bad at all. The sound system was well balanced.   My brother and I ordered the beef and chicken pad thai, that was prob one of the best I've had! My other bro just ordered the rib appetizers and it came out in a pan roast thingy in flames! So my 10 yr old bro thought he was tight lol. My parents ordered some chicken sour soup and fish and that was good too....idk if we just came on the right day or what, but all of our foods to be delicious! Would def come back again.   Also...try the Thai tea!!!

RWMyoCeYng4_-5hcQuboFQ.text: So not good. What a waste of my time and money.  My friend and I are from NYC and we were looking for a place to have thai food and listen to thai music or thai karaoke. Before we went to the restaurant we called and asked them if they had any sort of entertainment and they said yes, they start at 12:30-1am. We arrived at 2 am and there was no entertainment at all, just regular music on the radio. That was the first disappointment.  The food was horrible. I'm Thai and this place does not do Thai food justice. Not authentic, even if you're going for Americanized thai food it still wasn't good. The grilled beef was so dry and the sauce was just not right. The papaya was too sweet, I like my food to be on the sweet side so if I say it was too sweet you know it was. Everything else was just bland. My friend also ordered a soup which we never got. The waitstaff was friendly but they were coordinated with each other. Service was kind of all over the place.   In a nutshell just don't go. Kung fu across the street is a much better option for thai food.

21y7d-kTGurgMaWEv-GatQ.text: Came here on a Sunday after a fun Vegas trip! They have very authentic dishes! You have to try their papaya salad!! Amazing!!!! It wasn't as spicy as I would like, but the flavor was on point!   The best thing to do is order family style, so you can taste a bit of everything! Portions are not that big.   This will definitely be a spot I go to whenever I'm in Las Vegas!   Xo, Naomi

5-WS3bf8YEPbxXGfpXzppw.text: While there's nothing wrong with the stereotypical 'dive' type Thai place with photos of Thailand & the King on the walls, it's nice to know of at least one upscale Thai place -- especially one that's not overly expensive-- and Krung Siam is it for me!   I was solo & sat at the bar.  Waitstaff was very friendly, and my drink & appetizer arrived quickly, with my entree showing-up a suitable amount of time later.       Ambience is kind of like a bar/lounge (which is I think how the place markets itself).  They had music up somewhat loud.  Not uncomfortably so, but if you're there on a date or with a group of people, it might be hard to carry on much of a conversation.   I was there on a Thursday evening at about 6PM.   The place wasn't crowded at all.  For this type of place plus being in Vegas, I was probably there at least an hour or two before it might start to get busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls, seated at the bar.

J_7H2yIgvFx530HhJKcNEA.text: Come here regularly for late night Thai food when in Vegas. It's open super late which is convenient for my schedule when I'm here, the food doesn't really take a hit on quality like restaurants usually do when they're open such long hours. I came here with a huge group of ppl from Thailand and I think it was a good sign that they chose this place over other close by Thai restaurants including the famous lotus!  Honestly don't see why this place is 3.5, it should be rated much higher IMO. The ingredients in the dishes are all very fresh and blasted with flavor. Another plus with this place is the portions are very generous.   When I came with the large group we were celebrating so we ended up ordering essentially one of everything on the menu. If I were to highlight a few dishes I would choose the coconut chicken soup, beef slices, and the pineapple rice.   Been here 3x during my Vegas stay so far and I'm sure I'll be back!

GzkoLTediSYBIsTcDFTb5A.text: Before my husband and I ate here, we went to a place across the street first. We were seated, given menus and water. We were then ignored for 20 minutes so we walked out and came here. I am SO glad we did! Everything about this place is great! Atmosphere, staff, food, entertainment, presentation were fantastic. Our server, Sam, was great. Very informative and friendly. He asked me how spicy I wanted my food on a scale of 1-10 and I'm glad I said 3. It was the perfect spice that it wasn't so overpowering that I couldn't taste all the other flavors. Neither of us had an empty glass on the table, and my husband had at least 4 refills. He never had to ask for one. We are definitely going back and recommending them to everyone we know.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

At0DsG4Td3w1krzudsgrsw.text: I been here 3 times now, this time for pick-up. I am very impressed with the friendliness and hospitality of the staff. I was served ice cold water with orange as soon as I came in. The restaurant looks super clean and well decorated. The food is really good and I am going to end this review so I can continue munching. I can't wait to come back with friends! Server was Ville.

Fo4Tboo1kF7fclYYGyhytw.text: I'm not into anything that's brag worthy spicy... but this place has that. This is pretty darn authentic Thai. I try to go at lunch time so I don't have to listen to the band.

mjIIG4zRjcDpbSabCgnYOg.text: Great food with a good atmosphere - but beware of the spice!  My girlfriend and I went last night for a 3am - shit we forgot to eat dinner - thai food extravaganza and had a great time.  The atmosphere was very lively and the waiting staff was friendly and quick.  I ordered the Pad Thai (Chicken) which was good, but maybe not great?  My girlfriends yellow curry on the other hand was pretty spectacular.  The one down side to the yellow curry though is that our 5 out of 10 spice choice was pretty dang spicy.  The waiters were laughing a little at her each time they filled her water cup that she kept having to retreat to.  Unless you are certain that you love spicy hot challenges, I would recommend getting a 3 and asking for some chili paste on the side to kick it up a notch.  Overall, really good experience and look forward to going back.  Will update the review if the spiciness is a more tamable level next time.

HatwW8D2gkjgPowS2EkIoQ.text: The Tom Yum Soup is soooooo amazing! Best ever! Also tried the Drunken Noodles the portion was not very generous but it was very tasty! Thai Tea is small. Comes in a very skinny glass and no refills. Better off ordering drinks that come with a free refill. Two sips Thai Tea is gone. Lol

PsaIRsJn5_YAWg9OXSJhgQ.text: Service= Good Food= Very Good.  Ambiance = Good  We went here for dinner and ordered Satay,  drunken noodles and Fried Rice.   All very good.   Rice was really good.   Pair it with some dry chicken and you will love it.

gXx4CjC6GF0OsQBLQI0cKQ.text: We enjoyed three different lunch specials.  I only gave them three stars because the mango sticky rice was $8 and the rice portion was really small.  Overall service was fast and good.  Just don't buy the expensive desert.

r6i7U-2KsU9FSwb-cRTNzQ.text: Was very good and was delivered in a timely manner! Price were good! Would eat here again. Thanks !

I5-5WqkdeJjmYHc20TaxTg.text: Drove 25 minutes for yellow curry, they got my order wrong, it was too spicy to eat it and it was extremely over priced! I ordered Yellow Curry no chicken add shrimp and bamboo. Cost $20.56. They did not give me shrimp, they gave me chicken. It was so spicy that I could not even eat more than 4 bites. It did not even taste like yellow curry. Called to complain and the man expected me to drive 25 minutes back. I will never return or recommend this place to anyone.

6tParMvyAvGs0w3TRBj1wg.text: Pretty good! The lunch special is a great deal but it's not my favorite Thai place in town.  I had the Panang Curry and it was a nice array of different things (soup, salad, spring roll etc).  However the curry itself was a little thin for my taste and it was missing the slight sweetness I normally like.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang Curry Lunch Special

qC_FlPsS_flay7SfuRK-wg.text: I used to be a weekly customer of this place, but the last two times that I've been has been horrible. There must be some new cooks, because everything I ordered was sweet when it shouldn't be at all. I most likely will find a new spot to enjoy Thai since this place has gone down hill. Music is good, but even the service has dropped off.  There are far too many other places in China town that are way above this place.  My recommendation is to go somewhere else.

d9AqAfFWWw16eGcZz46Liw.text: We love this place! The chicken spicy basil is amazing & so is the chicken curry! Wether you are eating here or taking to go you will not be disappointed. The prices are great as well :)

JubsLGUhuAmEonTOAME8jw.text: AGGRAVATING!!!  This place is the WORST service ever!!!!  The waitress took my friends orders then completely ignored me and my BF because we took an extra second. So they get their food and we have flag someone down to take our order. I order Thom Kha because it's a classic favorite of mine. Theirs was sour and had barely any coconut taste. Then we had to STAND up to get our check!! We were ignored by the staff laughing and texting in the corner. I love Thai food but I will NEVER come back here!

N3CCqFMf1UWUcYDMu7dJiQ.text: Wow! This place has changed a lot since I was last here. Food has improved and the customer service is excellent,  I am very impressed no joke!  Surprised the crap outta me  how these waitresses were so friendly and very attentive !!Love the Saturday entertainment as well.

2TcQ-gR82zqWKEKphAO5RQ.text: Food was ok... not the best. Service is probably the worst I've had in a while.  Maybe it's due to EDC and them being overwhelmed with the number of people to service?  Either way we will not return to this place.

SruMcZCxYwdInIGz426WOw.text: Pretty good Pad Thai. Lunch special was $6.99  ***********PLEASE READ************:: Their spicy level is NO JOKE. They have a 1-10 scale with 10 being the most spicy. Now, I love spicy foods and can handle spiciness. When I go to Thai places and order my pad thai spicy, I usually request my spiciness in the B grading scale range. Soooo....I ordered my chicken pad thai with a level 8. HOLY SHIT.....this was wayyyyy tooo spicy for me. I couldn't even eat my dish because my entire mouth was burning. Even with a small bite, I had to gulp down water. I got full off water. So if you plan on making any of the dishes spicy, take it down a notch or two.....or three.

ZNB4tHZWNGH3DSW4iKiGfw.text: wonderful presentation, amazing food :) clean restaurant and reasonable prices. servers are friendly and accommodating.

IO4VRyuhsazdsdgzZgvCVA.text: Awesome for late night Thai food or just dinner in general. Just a plus that they are open late. Their garlic shrimp and basil shrimp are my go to. It's also close to the strip in chinatown which makes it easy to get to. They also deliver!

LS_tV2tdd79fx3n2UT3ICQ.text: Beef crying tiger lunch special was well worth it. The steak was tender and the service was great. Definitely coming back

_31-OkWwIOyydvjtkLyorw.text: This is great Thai & they're open super LATE... Like 5-6 am! My hubby LOVES the duck & chorizo; I always get the fresh spring rolls & either curry tofu or soup... I've never had any issues... The people are nice and the food is good and they are almost always open... What's not to love?

R96YFcuYPd0xI47w7qWsAw.text: A poor experience.  The decor and ambiance were promising. Everything was soft, soothing, and clean. Unfortunately, I'm more concerned with the food. I had been here once before, and I ordered a lackluster drunken noodle dish. Giving this place another chance (because I really like Thai), I ordered a lunch special Chicken Panang extra spicy with an appetizer of fresh spring rolls. To drink I ordered Thai Tea.  The Thai Tea came out with a glass of water. The water was clearly tap water. It had an odd aftertaste. One sip and I was done. The Thai Tea was meh.  The spring rolls were interesting. The menu indicated lettuce, bean sprouts, mint, sweet basil, cilantro, carrot and tofu. I received 4 rolls standing on one end. The top end overflowed with ingredients. The mint and basil were delicious. There was actually very little sprouts, and a lot more lettuce than in normal spring rolls. I prefer shrimp; however, I suspect they used Vietnamese pork sausage rather than tofu. Two rolls fell apart while trying to separate them from one another. While the actual spring rolls were lack luster, the peanut sauce included was actually quite good.  The soup included with the lunch special was a vegetable soup. I'm glad I asked, because they actually forgot to serve it to me. The Panang was not well done. Heat level was probably about a 3 (I asked for 15 on a scale of 1-10). The Panang was also very watery.  I was disappointed. I don't think that I'll return to this restaurant again.

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Spring Rolls

19PCJ00dZOVFT5M9zDopMQ.text: Been here twice so far and ordered the Pad Thai chicken and Spicy Basil fried rice with chicken. Both were delicious but I feel like the portions can be a little bigger for the price. I always order Thai tea which is great here just like the food. Open till 5am so thats always a plus. Overall service is great and they play live music sometimes as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil fried rice with chicken and a fried egg on top. A must add on

kKP8tq7zuY3G5gC0NI2X7g.text: I really did not want to write a negative review about this spot, but after so many negative experiences during late hour service, I have to at least admit that there is consistency in one aspect. This place is notoriously terrible for customer service and the food is always inconsistent. The first few times I came here with friends after work, the food was alright. I have tried the papaya salad, the pad thai, the pad "z-u," drunken noodles, chicken wings, tom yum, and the thai bbq chicken.   Best dish here is hands down the chicken wings because they are the only things that are consistently good. It is insane how that statement can even be said about a thai spot especially since they are just frozen wings that are deep fried with a little sweet thai chili sauce with cilantro.   The pad thai here is overly sweet and sometimes drenched in sauce. The pad see ew inconsistently comes with flat noodles that are broken up and it almost does not even feel like a noodle dish because there is so much inconsistency with the way the noodles are in this bowl. Same principle goes for the drunken noodles.   The tom yum soup is ok at best, unless you come at a time where they serve it to you at "room temperature," and it is super sour at other times. I stopped ordering it altogether because it came out super salty the last time and the salt kick was disheartening more so than the times it was at a wrong temperature or when it was sour. There is zero flavor balance.   Thai bbq was good when I ordered it, but the portion was very small for what I had grown used to at other thai spots around town like PinKaow.   So, after review of all the food I have had over the dozen times I have been there, I can say the food is a close  2-3 star experience for your money. However, with the service also having consistency in being awful every time I am there, I give that a solid 1/2-1 star experience.   This spot is open late night, so it limits options for thai for all hours, but honestly, I won't be recommending going back here for anyone. Last night I went with a few of my best friends and service was terrible yet again. I asked for thai bbq chicken and the waiter completely forgot about the order and by the time we were done eating, I had to ask another waiter to make sure to take that off the check because it was an oversight. There was no apology at all on their end and if anything, the guy looked annoyed for their mistake? I thought that was pretty hilarious.  The same waiter refilled my iced tea with water and when I pointed that out, he snapped at me and said, "I'll get you another one." Wow for sincerity? You messed up, & couldn't at least apologize?   Last week when I brought a couple of my friends here after work, the waiter gave us the check after our appetizer order. I asked him why he gave it to us preliminarily, and he had no idea we hadn't received our food! Yay!-for paying attention! We waited over 35 minutes for dinner and this guy handed us the check after chicken wings LOL. Unbelievable.  Myself, & my connections in hospitality won't be coming back to this place ever. Service is gawd-awful and food is not worth the trip. I recommend going to Pin Kaow on eastern near BJ's and Crepe Expectations. There are other good thai spots like Lucky Thai that are mountains better than this rude, salty spot.   Let me just advise you guys that this location has been closed down in the past and with service etiquette and inconsistent food quality, you will be on that same road for the future. This is not the best way to run a restaurant. This place needs to incorporate some training for the staff to be better and not so terrible to guests. Tips are earned, & it says a lot when all of us food & beverage industry people feel like we've wasted our money on shit service. Maybe management needs to notice.

B1RHCoaI9V92ZhuKN_3Rrw.text: Open late night awesome friendly staff and food is perfect will make your taste buds happy  MUST TRY RESTUARANT THEY ALSO DO CUSTOM ORDERS especially with squid instead of plain grilled squid they have another version of grilled squid with nice spices and a blend of green veggies. Ask the servers they will help you out

i2TNkVEH1vKFtsK4vmxGSg.text: Love, love, LOVED! The food I had here. Drunken chicken noodles, fried garlic shrimp with rice. And really enjoyed the delicious mango sticky rice with cut up mango and strawberries. Definitely try the Lychee Martini and ask for extra lychee fruit in it, you won't regret it! I can't wait to come back and explore the menu more! The service was wonderful and attentive and extremely helpful, our waiter was patient and showed us his favorites and explained each item we had questions about. It was such good service that he even remembered and stayed on top of all our special requests that we all had the whole time during our stay.

bK9rqjt-Td_yCS-7Dckefg.text: Krung Siam Thai makes delicious thai food. Their pad thai was spot on; a perfect balance of spicy, sweet and umami. We also had the basil stir fry with shrimp which was delicious too. Washed down with a nice thai beer and you have a perfect lunch. Located off the strip, Krung Siam is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle and relax. Free parking. Recommend.

q9FsSyQqvFfUilxAmLoSpw.text: Nice little restaurant by the strip. Good atmosphere and good food. They have live band I believe Thur-Sat till midnight. Will definitely be back!

eiHyzhNxAZyiwTZxJfeI1A.text: Have been here a few times and sampled a lot of the menu items and overall it's all really good! Portions are big and the food is pretty spicy compared to other restaurants. Will be back to have more delicious Thai. Yum yum

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck &amp; Rice

e7CUI6amnETEKtUUjbkOww.text: This place was great! Definitely gonna come back more often. If there was anything I had to nitpick about it would be that the food took a little long to come out but it was delicious in the end. I think they should be a little more attentive when it comes to cleaning tables. They were a little bit sticky but. Don't let that drive you away though. The service was good and the waiter Alan was very nice and returned frequently to check on us. Give this guy a raise! Last but not least, the vibes in this place man! I think apart from the food, the vibes in a restaurant are very important. Everyone was having a good time and enjoying their night. I'd say this is a pretty "Hot Spot."

tmHJXbMnGi4yiY8ovwiNhA.text: One of my fav getaway spots in Vegas :)  it's super big and chill and everyone here is incredibly friendly.  It's across from China town so away from the strip when you need a breather or two.  But only like $5-7 when you uber from the strip.  (Yes please don't drink and drive!!!  Uber is so cheap, better safe then sorry especially the way I drink in vegas lol)  So far everything I've tried here is good.  Soup, crab fried rice, yellow curry, pad thai, BBQ chicken...  The only thing I don't enjoy that much is (I'm not sure exactly the schedules) but on weekends I think I've encountered live music which since I'm not thai I do not enjoy.  But rest of time they either play hip hop or EDM   perfect for drinking w friends...our preparty spot before we head out for a crazy night   Overall:  I've been here over six times now and I haven't had any issues here what so ever which to me is awesome!!!  Love the consistency

MpcEqh3FrGcWLKCA2erPMA.text: You'll often catch live music or some type of festivities going on inside Krung Siam. In a bright and occupied strip of shops very close to the center of Chinatown.   Full Bar inside serves a full array of liquors and beers plus additional Asian beers and beverages.   I've dined-in in past visits and always receive fresh traditional choices.   This trip I ordered take out. Please excuse my photos as we had been drinking and could hardly wait to dig in. This is actually how the food was presented using opening minus the forks and spoons.   Shrimps with Spicy Garlic Lime Sauce (Raw) or shrimp sashimi-  Very Spicy!!!!  Raw shrimp marinated in delicious vinegary and sweet brine, and bright red Szechuan pepper on each bite.   Chicken Friend Rice- Very delicious tender cuts of chicken. Good amount of chicken. Not too greasy! Served with cucumbers.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top Shrimps Spicy Garlic Lime (Raw) Bottom Chicken Fried Rice  To Go Order

pO2Y0DnKISmVjevpJuWi3Q.text: Excellent food and AWESOME SERVICE. Employees are very welcoming and humble to all ethnic including Thai. Traditional taste. Highly recommend.

Y7c2Ifd4gghalvBliYXgtQ.text: Been here dozens of times but never left really happy. Just always a consistent 3-4 star. Service is lacking at least half the visits. Food is spendy and the prices have really went up recently, less specials or deals. Greedy. Most things have small servings too. Food is decent but I've had a lot of just average quality dishes.   Getting refills is hard, tonight I had an empty ice tea for 15 minutes and was little rude when I said to take it off my bill. Not the first time this has happened.  I asked for a larger salad with my skewers, just ignored the request. For $11 it should come with a bigger portion but I didn't mind spendy extra but he didn't even try to help me.   Curry is just okay, veggies little too big and hard, little watery, and small. Tried all of them here.   Cucumber salad is good but little spendy now at $5 Coconut was good but $6 each.    Mentioned yelp for 10% off but didn't apply the discount. Ignored so many things, didn't even speak to us hardly at all, just weird looks and nods. This happens to often here, gets old.   The owners sure know how to take a 4-5 star place and make it an overpriced 2-3 star at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken satay could use more char, more peanut sauce, and bigger cucumber salad.
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut! Open so you can scoop the chunks :-) Good ice tea and lemon is cut right to squeeze.

zwA2bDpF-L6kj-6F5gn7jw.text: One of two Thai places i actually enjoy, the other being the 5 star Le Thai. This one is 4 stars because the sevice is lacking. I suppose it comes with the territory being in Chinatown. The music and live singing are always top notch and really create an atmosphere that is hard to find in other restaurants on the Strip.     About the food...at this point i always order the same because I dont have time to be dissappointed. I stick to what i know when coming to Chinatown but on this occasion i tried the chicken satay and it was good but it tasted like the coated the chicken in egg and water.   The deep dried cornish hen is always fantastic and the thai basil fried rice is legendary in my book. The items look better eating in than getting it to go.   Ill be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken satay

wi6VjRIpkKcoT9mLoDAD-Q.text: Went here with my girlfriend for the first time while on Thanksgiving weekend and really like what we ate and would definitely go back and try more items like the Garlic Shrimp and the beef noodle We heard that these two items are a must try! We had the Basil Stir Fry w/ beef and the Crab Fried Rice. Both excellent the night we went Friday night they had entertainment which was nice. Parking ample, open late which is nice for the night owls.
