mbL7fbSinLr5o1hfxf2Ffw.text: I visited this location many times and I love the food so much, specially the Grilled Jumbo Squid. However, I cannot give 5 stars because some dishes are served too long until we finish our meal.

3sjVFfUvc6FjpO68b3_B-Q.text: They have the best laos style papaya salad. But be careful they make it really spicy here I ask for level 3 and boy it was super spicy. I suggest get the Thai chilly on the side and you can mix it to however you want it.

oyn3bs2LwBHcVdvLqnr9mA.text: I love the curries and basil here. Really attentive service and love that it's open til 4am! My favorite Thai dish is pad woon sen that isn't in the menu but they always whip it up for me.

YtkhFUN04PyUBMF8OGq3ug.text: Soooooo bomb! If your in Vegas go here!! This place is bananas! Loved all of the food, pad Thai noodles, curry, and bananas with coconut ice cream, sooooo good!! I would eat here every week if I lived in Vegas! Excellent prices, excellent music, even though off the strip, it's super close!! The staff is all so friendly and helpful with the menu.

fTqyKYNJl8020kjvoR-7nA.text: I'm so thankful I live in 2017, a day in age where a random stranger will pick up and deliver food to your doorstep over a few small strokes of an iPhone app. Yes I'm talking about UberEATS and all it's glory.   I placed a delivery order on Saturday since I was obviously stuck to my couch and it was pouring rain. The order arrived within 20 mins, hot and fresh. I had the Tofu Pad Thai with medium spice. Let me tell you that medium spice did not play, it was definitely on the spicier side of things but still very good. The portion size was large too, enough for two meals.   Overall the food was delicious and I'd definitely order again. Thanks for keeping my weekend vibes real!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai with tofu - UberEATS ftw

HFGwAEeciyx6qt0zV1KKSA.text: I came here with my coworkers for dinner at 7:30 pm. I was skeptical because It was not to busy on sunday night but after for a while I was there, without I realized it they had a full house one of my coworker came here not to long ago and she liked it, that's why she took us here. They do have a good food, good service and good atmosphere.  I like they way they have plenty space on their dinning place, it's not to crowded with tables and chairs so it's easy to walk arround.  They have a place in the middle with a small band, I think they have a live music but I don't know when. When I was there, They put a nice soft music, it's not to loud so we still can talk normal without screaming. All the server had a good attitude..So nice,their smile, polite, kept refill our water.   Their spiciness level from 1 (not spicy) - 10 ( spicy). I love spicy food so I ordered spicy #8, even thou I can feel the heat but I add their thai chili vinegar + dry chili + chili sauce. I ordered beef pad see(z) ew ($ 10.99)..Flat noodle stir with soy sauce + scramble eggs + chinese broccoli + beef.  My co workers had chicken drunken noodle ( $ 10.99), beef pad thai ($10.99), chicken yellow curry ( $ 10.99), fried rice ( $ 10.99) also we shared crispy spring roll (egg roll $ 9.99), Garlic shrimp ( $17.99). For me their fried rice to much black pepper but my coworker like it like that. Their garlic shrimp had a good flavour but I wish the shells have more crunch so easy to eat, a little bit to hard. But overall I love my pad z-ew We all really enjoy it, yummy We'll be back soon Ps: forgot to take a picture of chicken yellow curry

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pad Thai $10.99
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pad z - ew $10.99

9NLUwHkDvuEMK45UtfLgqw.text: Wanted some late night Thai and this place was a surprise with flavor.   BF and I got    Basil Scallops - for $12, they are generous with the scallops and the flavor of the basil was great on this with fresh, properly cooked scallops. Loved this.   Tofu Pad See You (their spelling, which is cute) - this was good as far as noodles go. Slightly sweeter than usual places and more heavy on the egg. I didn't mind it only because no matter what I always put a little bit of chili vinegar on mine to be tangy sweet but it may be a bit saccharine for some.   No karaoke that night being done, but had music playing that sounded almost like a recording of karaoke which was funny and odd.   It left a good enough impression that the BF wanted to get scallops there again so we went back a week later.   This time we got scallops with ginger which was good, but bit too gingery for the BF and he preferred the basil style instead.   We also got tofu garlic pepper which was in a garlicky gravy like sauce. The garnish was generous with lettuce which I thought was kinda odd, but somehow worked well into being part of the dish when it was slightly wilted.   This time there was a guy with a guitar singing which was alright since the level wasn't too loud in there. It seems a lot of the complaints is because of the provided entertainment. I don't get it, I don't prefer it, but if I have to I won't mind so long as I can still have a conversation and be able to tune it out to background noise.   Service was alright both times...you may have to flag people down here if you need something but nothing too terrible of a wait for things.   Overall, I like the food I've had here so I'll definitely come back. Maybe not for day, but late night choices are very important for night owls like us.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepper garlic tofu
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger scallop

kiAAAZbYcLs33PKYl6dQwA.text: Good for lunch! Staff was nice and very attentive. Basil chicken was a good choice. Want to go back to try dinner.

QS_n_BUnJZzAVFcGJ1_Ifw.text: Facing west. don't arrive in late afternoon, sunset can be glaring. PAD THAI and Panang beef dishes were tasty. Excellent service. LIVE one man singer with guitar tried hard but the excess echo setting made him sound far away, sadly, he won't get tips. Hope he'll adjust. With less noise, I'll give better rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corner restaurant

EQUz-AJS18Ctjr_Aq902wQ.text: Ordered the eggplant with tofu and papaya salad for takeout. Both were requested to be a medium spicy however it was pretty bland. If ordering for delivery, know that they are good about their time. I would've enjoyed the experience if the food was more flavorful.

b8cVhVpkhNYUhzLq0GN8cQ.text: One of the better thai food place in las vegas, super fast and friendly service, food taste just right. Serving is on the small side and pricey for a thai reataurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbecue chicken
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad see ew
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled jumbo squid

sP0iLaBqgGq1vMbmVeXmPw.text: This Thai restaurant was good. The food was yummy and they sure can manage a group of 30+ :) we showed up there after work with tons of our coworkers from downtown casino The D. Bunch of hungry dancing dealers and supervisors and security guards. At 4:30am ready to eat! They got our drinks orders out quickly and the food was surprisingly quick as well considering how big our group was. I had pork drunken noodles :) spicy level 5 out of 10. It was perfect. Spicy enough to enjoy. I had my sticky rice as well and Thai tea :) and a Thai beer :( they didn't have beer Lao but I think I got Sappora (sp?) It was like a club there with good music and a good variation. They played pop and country it was awesome :)  Open 24 hours a day. Good place to go if you work swing and like Thai food :)

sUGqv7JXCRNhMtuqRGPLIg.text: This used to be our fav Thai restaurant but today was disappointing. Ordered hot tea that was luke warm when asked about it waitresses seemed like she didn't care and have me the excuse that's the way it comes out of the machine. Grilled beef was cold when it got to our table. Lunch portions are smaller compared to what they used to be. Very disappointed. Will not be back again.

Z8j2ACBpslRxVoFtCz3fgQ.text: This is what you'd expect from Thai food.. that's just it.  It's pricey and there was nothing special about it, otherwise I wouldn't notice the first part.  I got pork yellow curry and thai iced tea.  It didn't come out hot. I can't even remember what my coworkers got and I felt kind of bad suggesting this place for lunch.  The food isn't bad, it's just not memorable.  I also had some weird pseudo staring contest with one of the servers cause she kept looking over at us and they were kind of rushing us to leave when we were trying to relax in the middle of a tech convention.  If I didn't find it highly entertaining at the time I probably would have been angry.

KlP2-evMnZlctztcofPm_Q.text: Ordered food online,  because no one would answer their phone. When I got there to pay and pick my food up, I stood at the hostess stand for 15 minutes. Workers would glance at me and not say anything. They were busy, so I took a seat and waited another 10 minutes. I wasn't greeted, and just sat there. Got fed up and left.

EaHRxzY1f3DkFGRQ7yJr8g.text: My husband and I can both agree that this was the best restaurant we ate at during our entire trip.   The waiter was very friendly, quick, and came to check on us frequently.   We ordered the deep fried Cornish Hen which came on a huge platter. It was seriously a meal for two. If you love cilantro which we do, you must order this dish. We also ordered the Garlic shrimp which was so very good. The garlic bits were so delicious. I've never had garlic prepared like that before and wish I knew how they did it. The Sticky rice with Mango was very good also.   This will probably be one of the first restaurants I will return to the next Ike I am in Vegas.

sst-XWrtNfD6yDm9osEfNw.text: Not bad, never try Thai legitimately before. I liked the atmosphere, very chill. They have full bar too, tonight we're eyeballing the wines menu. They are very friendly here.

VKm2LG0l8d3h6md0ZflCJw.text: I did not dine in. I ordered takeout, off the lunch menu ($8-10). Be forewarned - only the entree and rice and eggroll will be given, not the soup and salad. After I see what was given, I wish I had dined in, to get my money's worth... and I'm still hungry haha! I ordered the spicy eggplant entree, with tofu. Was great. But I wouldn't recommend taking out. If you do, make sure you don't let the container fall on the side. The container is like a bento box with two sections -- entree on one side, eggroll in the other. The sauces from the entree will flow over and soak the eggroll. The server that took my order was very knowledgable and friendly. Restaurant was not at capacity, but then again, 1pm on a Wednesday afternoon. I keep hearing about a live band, but I guess that's only a evening thing.

PR7GMd8Zc9q1OEzF_0ICGg.text: Let's just say I dreamt about their yellow curry last night. GREAT SERVICE & FOOD!!! Also live music on select evenings definitely creates an enjoyable atmosphere...

Fl7wQZ9gey7o9qpwJ44KpQ.text: What a surprise this place was! We walked in and there was a LIVE BAND.  Open Til 6am so we didnt have to worry about the 10pm arrival.  The waitor was great. Very thurough with the Menu.  The ambiance was great for a couble.  Candle Light And all.  My Girl Ordered the Shrimp Patay and made it 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 Scallops... NEXT TIME GO ALL SCALLOPS, they were great.  The Fresh Spring Rolls was our appetizer, lots of lettace and only a little Tofu but the Peanut Sauce was much better than Pho Kim Long.  I Got the Thai BBQ Chicken... DO IT JUST FOR THE PRESENTATION! 6ft FLAME!  Final Bill around $50, I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai BBQ Chicken.  Order it to see a 6ft Flame!

_xL3BdekWZbu7QDZ0J_Tow.text: Great. Much better food than places like Lemongrass at Aria for half the price. Quick service, happy hour we didn't even know about, and again, the food was good which is all that really matters.

CuFOxcjooR9hcU-AWjhw8w.text: Really good food and atmosphere.  We had yellow curry and a chicken stir fry dish.  Both were delish.  When they say spicy, they mean  it.  Service was subpar.  We both finished our water and had to ask for more.   Then, finished our food for a solid 5-10 mins before we were finally successful in flagging someone down for our check.

940APnp033KcFe-aERlvbA.text: I knocked a star down simply because of service. I thought I should mention that because their food is actually really good! My friends and I love Thai food, and Krung Siam offers some of the best in LV Chinatown. I am a huge fan of their Pad Thai, which is a perfect balance of spice, peanuts, and flavorful noodles. I have also tried, and enjoyed, both their Pad See Ew and Boat Noodle Soup. The soup is particularly good when I'm feeling under the weather.  My problem really comes down to the service. I guess it seems like they don't care. I ordered Pad See Ew with beef once, and it came out with chicken. I told them that it was fine since I'm not one to make a fuss, but like most people, I expect to get what I order. Whenever we come here, I just feel as if our table is getting ignored. I have to look around before anyone comes to check up on us. We usually come late night when it isn't super busy, too. They do have a karaoke stage, which is apparently pretty popular. I don't care too much for hearing random people sing in Thai, but that's probably just me. You should definitely still come for the food, and maybe you will have a better experience with the service.

aPZ-J5my_SWEvBoUFJOtzg.text: I hate to write this because Krug Siam used to be our go to Thai place.  But...  The live entertainment is always way too loud, so much so that it takes away from the meal.  (At least on New Year's Eve he was on tune...)  Our food order was messed up.  The Thai Spicy 8 was barely spicier than the no spicy.  And the one dish I specifically said no spicy (for my young son) was spicier than the two level two spicy dishes.  The waitress filled my son's Sprite with water.  The Cashew Nut was almost entirely celery and the Pad Thai was made with glass noodles...  But my bigger problem is that the food was just okay.  I used to drive across the valley to eat here but my neighborhood Thai places are much better.    So they aren't bad.  If I'm on this side of town I may even stop in again, but with all the other choices of places to eat, I don't think so.  And I'm definitely not driving across town for them.

TMug3GIID8QrAjzQjTf3_Q.text: I'm sorry, they don't even deserve one star. We used to come here often because the food was good and prices were 'OK'. A few months ago we had ordered some pad Thai and the sauce came out tasting like BBQ sauce. We asked for a new dish and they said NO THATS HOW IT IS SUPPOSED TO BE. Wow, they couldn't even offer anything else.  They charge over $12 for a main dinner entree which doesn't even amount to a lunch PORTION. They skimp you on everything. We went back last week and I ordered drunken noodles lunch special. They now charge $8.99 for it and its a BENTO BOX. I literally got 3 pieces of broken up noodles with 4 pieces of shrimp and a side of rice. Its not supposed to come with rice but they did it to make up for the noodles...so why even call it a noodle dish? It ended up being mostly veggies too. We send it back and they just took off the rice portion and added maybe a spoonful of noodles! It was a WTF moment.  I highly suggest you stay away if you've had real Thai food and don't want to pay $12+ for a tiny dish! Their service and food has gone downhill. They are robbing customers for $$!

iJYXaJpq7WOPQWbZiM0Ing.text: Our favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. This place gives you large portions of delicious food for a very good price! We go anytime we are in the mood for Thai!

gbXr94mQ5XSPUDcjOVQu4Q.text: What an experience, truly.  I came to Krung Siam after receiving just awful attitude from a nearby restaurant (ahem DJK) and I am very pleasantly surprised. We had the garlic shrimp, the chicken wings, pad Thai and Tom Yum hot pot to share for our party of 6 (we had double orders of every dish). Everything tasted fantastic but the True winner of the night was the pad Thai. This was hands down the best pad Thai I've ever had in the States, so congratulations KS! I'm very excited to come back to this restaurant with friends when I'm in town and I'm happy to recommend it to anyone visiting the LV area.   Service was great, prices were decent and the decor and mood was inviting.

QOJGWcUxSHacq81W9ulodA.text: Great food, good service, and nice quiet atmosphere. I'm lucky it's so close to home, sometimes I feel like take out and when I walk in it just makes me want to sit down and eat. One of my favorite things is that they always get the spice levels just right. The grilled squid appetizer is the best in town. Drunken noodles, Panang curry, Pad Thai... no matter what you order, you're thing to get authentic Thai flavor in every bite.

WzW3_6Hfl9-HYf9b7P0kjg.text: This restaurant was a pleasant surprise.  My friend and I originally planned on going to the Tofu Hut but they had a 45 wait.  We went here instead and what a great decision that turned out to be.  Its very spacious with high ceilings so you never feel crowded in.  The staff is friendly, efficient. All the food was freshly prepared with a prep time of about 15 minutes.  I don't know the correct names of all the dishes we tried but I will describe them.   We started with the Crab Fried Rice. It's a moist rice dish that has a mild flavor but an abundance of lump crab meat throughout.  The next one was  Red Curry Chicken in a coconut milk broth.  It's well balanced between spicy, sweet,and savory.  Next the combination sea food Pad Thai.  It has crab, muscles, and shrimp served over noodles. Another well balanced dish.  A must try for seafood lovers.  Now my favorite dish was the crispy pork belly served over greens.  This shows that a dish doesn't have to be overly complicated to taste great.  The pork is somehow crispy and tender at the same time.  While the greens were cooked with a quick stir fry.  Its a simple dish that is simply delicious! For dessert we had Ice cream with strawberries, chocolate served with flat bread triangles.  It was not overly sweet and a nice finish to our meal.  We spent $60.00 in all.  The price was right for what we received.  I'm adding Krung Siam to my favorite restuarant list.

IWrmyNphUVLmhY3WMgIQLA.text: mixed seafood pad thai was dish to get!!! they are super generous with the amount of seafood they give you. we also ordered the randang curry and that was also really good.

ARiZWTkSyq5g9SCHKR2xOg.text: I use to come here all the time. They have a sign it the door that they're updating their lunch menu and aren't offering the lunch specials. We are regulars and love the food but we're very disappointed once we saw the new menu. These prices are outrageous with little to know food. Nothing comes with steamed rice I bought an order of rice and it's like a scoop for 3.00$! This is Asian food rice should come automatically on the side with EACH meal or at least  bring a pot of rice. For each table. I won't be coming here anymore they lost a good customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gg45PkZLv98upD65CtNlBA.text: This is the best thai restaurant in Las Vegas. The foods are excellent Tom yum sea food is super. Especially DJ Dum is wonderful. He can sing whatever songs we requested . We went in Christmas. We will go back again after New Year.

bXMorpc2-3nYmW2RZbnbsw.text: I had the worst service from this restaurant.It's too bad that the people working here do not have a proper training.Their food is good but their service is really really bad.So disappointed

Pleze7xMQyFo7P4QdklelA.text: Besides the food being pretty good, we had ordered it To Go and they literally took almost half an hour to get us our food. No apologies whatsoever.

EoYaUwTqgiYaiDpHKxcyVQ.text: This place is divey, loud and they place good music and sometimes they'll have live singing too! The ONLY problem is they're slow, they take kinda long bringing out your food so don't take a long time ordering if you're hungry. They have a very good salmon plate from the chefs special that comes with veggies and rice. They also have very good Tom yum noodle soup and I love how they can go to REALLY spicy levels. Level 3 is already very spicy and it goes to 10! The service is okay. The place seems clean and sometimes the music is so loud you can't really talk to your friends but other than that the food is great and price point is good just slow

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai barbecue chicken literally on Fire
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Thai pond 10/10
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai pond chicken soup

wSV-CX7HeEbY48OGx-fHVA.text: Ordered delivery while in Vegas for Labor Day weekend. This place rox for Thai food!  Spicy basil fried rice w/over easy egg - egg came fried which sucked hard cause there was no yolk to spread over the rice. The rice was amazing! Lots of basil flavor. No spicy though so not sure why it's called "spicy basil fried rice"  Pad Thai - they were good. Got the combo and the meat was not overcooked which was great! Huge portion!  Panyang curry - very delicious and sweet and smooth.   Will try more food next time.  Downside is the delivery guy took an hour to come even though they were 5 min away from us... And then the delivery guy couldn't figure out how to get into the building cause he went to the wrong entrance... Had to come down from my room to find him ... Also when I called to order they told me to order online cause It's hard to communicate with their language barrier... So they lose a star for poor customer service skills.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil fried rice - egg did not come over easy. Delicious none the less
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panyang curry - worth getting. Sweet and smooth
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai. Big portion and decent

ES-7GIRHtQlFFk5NyCjNZw.text: Waiter was nice about it. 100 degree n was so hot inside. Air was so low. Food is meh at best. portion so tiny.. combination pai thai gave 1 shrimp in plenty of tofu. Thai beef salad beef was not fresh. regret coming here. Should have drove the distance in went to Archis.

lp885QkBwnIVi1iQb6kv6Q.text: Service was prompt with no issues veganizing - we only tried one dish, so YMMV - but the food (Pad Thai) was really flavorless. I mean, it needed salt, it needed tanginess, just everything. Hours were great, though, so just maybe we would try something else in the future in a pinch.

rUpmOjek741-E1unVUkHfQ.text: They should make their chicken wing s dish more tender and off the bone. But all the other foods are excellent and excellent service

C7p_w_FzOYJbJOnZekX-pg.text: Some of the BEST Thai foood you can find in Las Vegas. It doesn't get much better than this unless you're in Thailand.

vRZ-c5vwwDR6NUPhiL_VIw.text: This is one of my favorite Thai lunch locations. Parking is never an issue since they share private parking lot with other businesses.    My order was the boat noodle soup and a Thai ice tea. The soup arrived quickly and contained hot and spicy rice noodle soup with rare steak, beef stew, beef balls, liver and tendon. The broth was so yummy and tasty! I thought I was back in Phuket Thailand.   This place is underrated compared to some other popular Thai restaurants in L.V. They offer live entertainment in the evenings. They also accept credit cards and the service here is exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boat noodle soup  &amp; Thai ice tea

W-Cu4yLvncgEjaD5TnPyBQ.text: This place offered average Thai food. I did not think it was worth the trip off the strip. We shared multiple noodle dishes and the spicy basil fried rice. The spicy basil fried rice was better with an added fried egg on top. It was nice that they ask for the spiciness level on a scale of 1-10. As someone who likes moderate, 7 was just fine. My friend who likes mild, thought 5 was a little too spicy. Service is friendly, and we were never without our lemony water. Music was top hits but not too loud. It was great for a group of 9 of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil fried rice - chicken; spicy 7 moderate

z5muREjgCx5fgxYVq7LdEg.text: This is not your typical Thai restaurant. They have a person who sings radio hits while you're eating. Lots of customers come there to have drinks after work and order Thai food. It's very poorly lit and it's not a place where you can have a conversation while eating your food because the waiters and waitresses keep coming back and forth asking if everything's okay. They did that to me for a total of 28 times. It was insane! I've never been asked that sooo many times in my life during a visit to a restaurant. Okay enough about my experience and on to the food.  I ordered boat noodles which is a favorite for me at other Thai spots.. I told them no tendon and what do I see when I first get my bowl of soup? TENDON.. No Bueno! So I don't say anything because I always think to myself that they can do something to my food if I complain so I take the tendon out myself like champ. Then the broth was just overpowering and salty. Unfortunately I have a bad experience here and won't be coming back ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boat noodles

2sAgt6eCGNqLzUck_tlz7A.text: What a amazing place! Such great n friendly service! When I stop by I always get the curry, pad z u and pad Thai which are AMAZING ! If you guys want some crazy good Thai food check out this place

4or9wBIgcrtAhL4WN-Ocog.text: Just had lunch here with my sister and we were surprised how good it was. The price was fair for the amount of food that was given in the meals we ordered. We started with one Thai coffee and one Thai yes. The coffee was out favorite and the Thai tea was good. We liked how they came in tall cups, but there was a little too much ice in both drinks. We got the chicken Pad Thai lunch special and salmon lunch special. An egg drop soup was served to start which was good and an egg roll was served as well. The egg roll was good when dipped into v the sauce. The salmon was great. It had a garlicky flavor to it and there were vegetables that it came with that were lightly sauteed in that garlicky sauce which made it really yummy. The Pad Thai was okay and we actually took most of it home because we were full. We did get the mango and sticky rice for dessert which the rice had a green tint but was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch menu

A2G5lxv6aE0w-GGL6m4qqQ.text: Finally tried something besides my usual Tofu Pad Thai and SO glad I did.  The Silk Thai Salad is incredible!!!  Service is always good.

Mewq-BNEwNHvSuWqGXknlQ.text: I've drove by this place many times on my way home and today I finally decided to stop here and try their food.   I ordered my thai favorite tom yum soup and the seafood delight. The soup wasn't the best I've ever had and the sad part is that I've had better tom yum soup at my own kitchen, the soup was too sweet for my taste. The seafood delight was kind of good, some kind a mixture of fruit of the sea mixed with Asian vegetables served on a sizzling plate and a side of steamed rice, not bad food but nothing that would make me make that illegal u turn on valley view again.  The price you pay for the food should come with better than fast food restaurant service but that's just what we got. Waitress took our order delivered the food and we were left on our own for the rest of the meal, not even checked on us once. By the end of the meal I was chewing on ice to help me swallow the rest of my food. I even had to do that embarrassing signature on the air to get the check and signed it while the dirty plates were still on the table. I started to wonder if I had to pick the plates up on my way out.  As we left no one said thank you........is it asking for too much after leaving 20% tip for no service? If I ever go back I'll make sure I go there during karaoke time and sing gangnam style as their punishment!

Hrb-N-4kfSjKyUD4b6YRAQ.text: I went to las vegas on a mission to find a good Thai restaurant there. we had dinner here on Monday's night. I ordered water prawn in red curry sauce, the presentation is nice BUT 2 small water prawns for $19.99,SERIOUSLY?????? Come on now, the size of their water praws is a liltle bit bigger than cocktail shrimp from costco!   one star for good pad see ew + the server(small Thai woman) who didn't take our order but came back to check on us asking me why I didn't finish my Thai iced tea. She's sweet. Thanks!  minus 2 stars for 2 small prawns for $20!!!!!!!!!  minus 2 stars for a server who had a nose job working on monday's night who gave me a bit of the attitude when she knew that I am Thai. She took our order and disappeared and never came back to check on us. All the reviews that said bad service, probably got her as a server,I'm sure!  Probably,never again

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 2 water prawns in red curry sauce $20!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

7bpHmQZFrj66ti1SHszSnw.text: I am a fan of Thai food and have been frequenting competitors in the area for years. My girlfriend and I have been to krung a few times for lunch.  I thought the food was great! I decided to return for dinner and introduce my husband to this place. To my surprise their was a live one man band.. He sang beautiful music the entire time we were seated enjoying our dinner. We loved the food and thought the amazing voice of the entertainment really took a small place with great food to another level. After finishing dinner we moved to the bar continued listing and watched as some of the other patrons began dancing.. this food is great! The food is fresh, it's priced just right and the service was perfect. We will be returning soon!!!

5mEbajC9o7kT3-ng9XPoyA.text: We were here after 10 pm on 12/30/13 First of all, how can they remodel the restaurant looking nice and cool and forgot the restroom?  The faucet requires push down on one hand while washing the other. I can't imagine how one can wash/clean hand that way. I don't want to think how the chef and server do after using the restroom.  Pad Thai was ok, the noodle stuck together. The beef and basil was not good as I didn't expect they used ground beef. This is not a restaurant dish in my opinion. I can make better. Tum yum soup in the hot pot was actually better than I expected. Green and red curry was ok. Not enough chicken and veggies in there.

1J10cuOHxMTJRVFyDABZng.text: My parents recently moved to Las Vegas and I've never been anywhere outside of the strip, so was excited to check out Chinatown area where the locals thrive.  We came here on a Friday night and there was a decent crowd there.  They had a live musician singing classic songs with some accompaniment and on guitar.  It added to a nice family vibe.  We decided to split some entrees among the three of us.  The portions were good and the food was a bit more spicy than we hoped (even though we asked for less than medium), but still yummy.  The prices are reasonable, but actually not much different from what I would expect to see in NYC.  Was hoping for a little bit more of a bargain, but not bad.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again with my family.

JZO73oPFA7s8TmlghRGp2A.text: I am a fan!! Awesome lunch specials! The Drunken noodles are SOOOO good! Lots of flavor.   The Pad Thai is sweeter than I am used to, but, it was still good.   I don't like a lot of heat in my food, so I loved that I could get everything on a scale of 1-10 in heat.   I was in and out in 40 mins, perfect for my lunch hour.  The decor was modern and the servers were prompt and friendly. The place appeared to be very clean.   The music was a tad too loud.

f4IkoVPc17ZHMD_dcck_Zg.text: The food was awesome, the service was so 100 percent with Lemon, Milk, Vic, and Mary. Had famiky from Orange County visit and they are happy and pkeased.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Its worth it..

Scws7aYKPKMP-AszKZhiJQ.text: Flavors are spot on. Beautiful decor. A tad bit note expensive but worth every penny! Have had the papaya salad, pad Thai, duck curry, green curry with chicken, beef laab, crying tiger. All excellent.

MzJjQTkIS0BvT5x2irL-ZA.text: A girlfriend and I went here for lunch since she had mentioned it was here favorite place. I was stuck on Archie's but decided to give it a try. We ordered the tofu with garlic eggplabt, papaya salad and thier version of the pan ki maow from archis.  I have to mention that my friend  is vegetarian so we ordered everything with no fish sauce or oyster sauce.  I thought this definitely take out all the flavors but surprisingly, everything  tasted perfectly satusfying and fresh!  Even without he usual traditional ingredients.  We also ordered thierThai iced tea an since it was a hot day it was refreshing!  Average and not too bad.  The service was ok and the prices are decent even though we missed the lunch special.  They also seem to have a band or drum set in stage where someone performs? Not a bad place for quick grub.

Kv4-5ZXS_Isc53a9P3R4kg.text: It was close to the strip, and had a big sign so we all decided to eat Thai food, place looks pretty modern, they have like posters of movie stars on the wall. Service was nice, food was decent, portion was ok, spicy rating from 1 - 10, I went with 7 on my Basil Fried Rice, it was pretty spicy and good, but very few chicken cooked in my rice though, not much Thai dishes to choose from with what I am used to.

Yz7L4Q-IkFxmzsiyhxQWkg.text: I love this restaurant, the food and the service was great. My favorite dishes are Thai Chorizo, Papaya Salad. I heard that the restaurant had closed for almost two weeks  with some issue. However, i went there today and the restaurant seemed to be very clean and i checked on the health food sign, they got grade A. That made me feel good. I still trust them and will absolutely come back again!!!

R2ScWOEYv3oU5319YuzoBw.text: came here after a night out and was pleasantly surprised to find this thai restaurant open.   i didn't want to dine in so we walked in and ordered to go.  - drunken noodles: my favorite! delicious! - pad thai: yummy!  - tom yum soup: love!  we ordered all of them with spice level 7 and i would probably get 8 next time but for a late night meal...7 was perfect.   i love that this place is open late and there were quite a few people dining in while we were waiting. i am definitely coming back here and i highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tom yum &amp; drunken noodles.

ix33Al8uelPNujkWqpOJ4A.text: Why say Thai twice? Who knows, maybe because you have to look twice to believe there is actually a decent Thai restaurant hiding amongst the tiny village of Las Vegas. Good food! No complaints - nor any great superlatives. Reasonable prices for VEGAS. Nice people running the place.

Wkbn85c5WYVwd7S6NJecdA.text: Holy deliciousness batman! I'm a huge fan of Thai food and this place does not disappoint. The crab rangoon and fresh spring rolls are great. Loved the pad se ew with beef and the pad thai with chicken. Be sure to ask for a low spicy level if you're not into spice...I like spicy and some of their stuff was hot for me at what I thought was a medium. But if you get nothing else, you have to get the sticky rice with mango and a side of coconut ice cream...it's like heaven. (It's also seasonal, so check with the server if they have it.)

DRevb0S_oM0uc10bliitMg.text: The taste if food is slightly too sweet, but I'm fine as I like thing a bit sweeter than other people. It's not foe most my friends on the table though. One tip of advice is DONT order crispy pork! I felt like my teeth were broken and one of my friend needed to take Tylenol afterward. It tasted like stone. The thing that earns this place a 3-star is purely the service and ambience.

3p9StNMSrp9KzVWHy81p_Q.text: I love Thai Food and always try and seek it out when I come to a bigger city. I don't agree with some of the other reviewers that the service was bad. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful.  Food had huge portions and was delicious. I'm jealous that I didn't get the yellow curry like my husband did.

ebKJjclsxLPEN1hz3vhl_w.text: Such an amazing place. I had the red curry with chicken. I had a choice of 1-10 for the spiciness and picked number 6. The dish was very tasteful with the perfect amount of spiciness. The live music was great as well and made dinner more entertaining.

BAL0P4ggXVl8ZRR2uWGNjQ.text: Really accommodating.  They seating our large group of about 16 with ease.  They took 5 minutes to pull some tables together and quickly served us.  Lunch menu is a great deal.  $8.99 with soup and rice. The food was great dispite some of the reviews I read on Yelp.  No one in our party complained about their food.  I ordered their chicken pad thai, the portion size was very generous and I requested spicy, and the spice kicked my butt!  I really liked the restaurant setting and decor, everything is very classy.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut juice

Xv_FkpNFx9wMSylkQGAmNg.text: Tommie the bartender was super welcoming and he gave my friend and I free shots on the house while we waited for our food togo! Thank you so much for the entertaiment and the delicious drink! We will definitely come back to visit for a couple more drinks! :)

5wmeGhpi4YVejFAyky4xow.text: Love how late the hours are since I don't get off til late. Food is on point and delish!!!

hZD0_PgGDqmfnTErkl4QBg.text: I love this place. Whenever me and my boyfriend go they have karaoke, which is entertaining. We've tried all their curries and while they are all really good, we decided last night that the yellow curry with vegetables is our favorite. We usually get around a 3 on the spicy level just because I feel like the spicier it is the more it takes away from the actual flavor. And this place is definitely full of flavor when it comes to their curry and noodles. The drunken noodles are definitely my go to. I went about a month ago and they had run out of the drunken noodles which I was bummed about, but I can't blame them because they are amazing! I ended up getting the pad Thai and it was almost equally as good. The only thing I wouldn't recommend on the menu was the fresh spring rolls. The peanut sauce it came with was good but the overall roll lacked flavor and tasted like lettuce. We decided we should have just gotten the fried spring rolls. Maybe next time! But I do highly recommend the Thai Siam tea on the drink menu, best spiked Thai tea ever!

fRdYQxuC3RZ8XAAPGTJGkw.text: Good food & horrible service. And i hated the laud music they play. I felt like I am in the night club.

KFlA6_3x8E8y-sM-m-Swjw.text: Came here for lunch, expecting this place to be busy but it wasn't. It was just us and like 4-6 other patrons.  This place is really nice on the inside. It is very lounge-like and has a karaoke set up with instruments for bands.  The service was fast.  I ordered the beef pad-see-you. The food came out fairly quick and when I saw the meal, it wasn't much. My cousin wanted to try some of it so I gave him some and there goes half my plate... Other places, they give a very good portion but this one was a little greedy. Other than the portion, the food was good, not bad. Can't say much. Nothing really stood out.

whFakuREywuj0RfQDXhqcw.text: We stopped by one night for dinner because it looked nice. We got the booth by the door. Everything was great until the food came out. The food itself was fine, nothing to write home about but what happened during our meal is unforgivable. Cockroaches came out every few minutes. They'd come out, we'd try to kill them with a napkin and miss. They'd go back and come back out after a few minutes. We had to squeeze into one side of the booth to keep an eye out for them. We told the waitress, who saw one still browsing around and she got the manager, who then tried to kill it using a napkin and a cell phone flash light. He missed and walked away without saying anything. No apology or anything! I was so disgusted that I didn't finish eating. We left and won't be going back.

RI5sDNfvLtot3bAbRGZysg.text: A friend took us out here and it is truly some of the BEST thai food i've ever had. Every dish was so flavorful and authentic tasting. Now, i'm not thai, but you could really taste the complex flavors and cooking style were not watered down for americanized taste buds.  I ordered the Thai Basil with steamed tofu and the sauce was just to die for! perfect balance of sweet, salty, basil flavor. The eggplant basil dish was also mind blowing. The eggplant was slightly caramelized and meaty. The drunken noodles had soft, succulent noodles. the Pad thai was so different from the overly-peanutted(is that a word?) dishes I've had elsewhere. Lots of great flavor & texture everywhere.  We also orderd a pot of tom yum soup for the table which was fantastic. However, please be warned, those are not green beans in there! it was a 5 alarm fire in my mouth for a minute when i took a bite into one of those chiles!  The prices are great - $4.99 lunch specials during the week and $8-$15 entrees otherwise. Everything was out of this world delicious. Don't miss this place if you are in Vegas and have a hankering for Thai food! I wish I had a place like this near home.  oh, also, it's in the Chinatown area off the strip so you can also go get foot massages at sketchy places across the street. ;-)

kayzahiwuDiw64oD2F8EMA.text: This place was great. The hours were great, the service was great, and the spice range was perfect accommodating the need of someone how doesn't eat spicy and of someone who does. I really loved the food and the live music was great. If I ever come back to Vegas then I'm definitely going back.

XB38Lc43-YHXwsckNsOd2Q.text: The food was too sweet, it doesn't taste like Thai food, service was bad, and there was a cockroach in the bathroom.

IC5jvKJ_AtuKfnOl7MtqnA.text: I wanted to update this review because Krung Siam has made some changes and has really brought down my thoughts of this place. The main thing is they have changed the Lunch Menu that my coworkers and I loved so much. They increased the price two dollars and turned them into bento boxes. The added a side (crab rangoon or spring roll) and a salad. They also increased the price of the drinks to $2. I personally did not experience a difference in quality in the food but two of my coworkers complained that the dishes they normally get had changed in flavor and were not as good. They also dropped a couple favorites. I enjoyed the addition of the crab rangoon and would have been okay with the salad but the dressing is not very good. The main difference is that where my coworkers and I would visit this place for lunch once and maybe twice per week, we have begun looking for other options.  I hate it but it looks like we won't be visiting as much in the future.

NXpYMdRRSCb4tqbXMoZS8Q.text: Brown rice? Check. Solid Thai flavors? Check! After dining at Krung twice, the food does not disappoint, but I am not sure it will become one of our repeat eats. We have sampled tom kha gai and tom yum soups, red curry and the dish simply called "Broccoli." A bowl of soup is quite generous, and both soups had a rich, pleasing flavor. However, they also come served with lots of the herbs and roots that contribute to this flavor, which is mildly frustrating if you're not one to chew down on lemongrass and galanga. I admit this may be a white girl thing, but I end up putting all those things on the side because they seem too tough to chew. Am I wrong? (I decided to Google and thanks to Kasma Loha-unchit and her article here thaifoodandtravel.com/in... learned: "In soups, lemongrass serves as a stock ingredient to flavor the broth; the tough pieces are not meant to be chewed and eaten. Thai people usually do not strain them out before serving; they know what can be eaten and what cannot, and some like to suck on the lemongrass pieces for a delightful hit of flavor.") So, it is more authentic way to serve the soups, and I am just being a baby. The curry was good. The "Broccoli" had a great wok flavor, but the sauce was a little light, and their steamed tofu isn't my favorite. So, why won't we repeat eat? It was most likely a late night destination for us given its hours, and the fact that during the day we have some fave go-to spots. And, late night they have live entertainment which created a less than ideal dining environment. It is simply one gentleman with a guitar and a semi-karaoke set up, but it is a little loud and prone to drunk hijinx. If you are also drunk, wildly entertaining, but if you are just hungry, a boozy lady sitting on stage doing her best to belt out Bob Dylan and other songs that the guitar man simply just doesn't know for close to 20 minutes is simply frustrating. I don't even know if it was supposed to be karaoke, or if she just decided she had the right to sing. I can appreciate a well done, Thai karaoke throw down, but that is not what was happening here. I suppose the restaurant isn't completely to blame for their patron's less than ideal manners, but I kept hoping someone would kindly escort her back to her table with the lure of some free delicious item. If we walk up to the door and see the man on the stage, we will probably decide it's not the meal for us given the opportunity for microphone takeovers. However, I don't think you'll be disappointed in the food, and our service was acceptable. Definitely worth it at a late hour when you're running out of options, and, hey, perhaps the danger of late night karaoke is your thang! Maybe we will return for lunch.

ryvlK4za3V7-6Wo_VoOJig.text: had Thai for the first time!  good stuff had the basil..although I thought it would be a chicken breast lol ..very good thou

W123zX-AWnS_Rwavvxyt9A.text: This is the first Thai restaurant I've visited that provide live music  entertainment.  It's very nice inside, very polished, nicely decor and the tables and both weren't all crammed in together. They also have a bar and plenty of flat screen TVs all around the room. We (my fiance and I) decided to order their Pad Thai. I believe it was like 10.99 and you get to pick your choice of meat. For $3 more you can have shrimp and you get 3 or 4 pieces of shrimp. If you wanted to add seafood combination that's also another $3. I wasn't happy with the Pad Thai because it was way too soggy and sweet. Service was okay. The waitress quickly came around and asked is everything alright after we got our food. We waited a good 10 minutes before I got frustrated and told my guy to flag down our waitress for our bill. The waitress said something my guy didn't understand. Minutes later I was able to get one of the other waitress attention and she went to give get us our bill. If I saw a designated station where you can pay after waiting 10 plus minutes I would have already pay my bill and went on my happy way. This is the first restaurant I've ever been to that you just don't know where you can take your bill. This restaurant is not very organized. There were more than 4 employees standing around behind the bar talking and just 2 waitress on the floor and it was almost a full house. The price is pretty high but you're paying for the entertainment. This restaurant does not have the best location. It's located in China Town. The parking is alright. If it had not been for the entertainment I would give this restaurant 1 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The live entertainment Karaoke singer that helped this restaurant get a 2 star and not a 1.
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TV for your entertainment

UamDkso0dj7jZ0d92L6qrA.text: Avoid this place like plague. Overpriced but low quality food and there was this one waiter who kind of behaved like a gangster. After placing an order for a coconut I got a call about a medical emergency, so I cancelled the order (within 2 minutes) and was about to leave but this guy says he would not let me leave until I paid for a coconut (which was not even brought to the table). Really?!!  The Krung Chai Thai on Decatur is far more professional and better value for money.

T3MXMvz7qWR4c9vFR3c2AA.text: I was running late to meet up friends for lunch here at Krung Siam. It was recommended from a friend of a friend. When I step through the door, no one greeted me at all. I scoped the place out looking for my friends. after a few rounds of head turning, I saw my friend waving me down into this separate room.  This place looks pretty upscale due to the decor, however, the service is a far cry from being upscale. We constantly had to flag down a waitstaff (Even though the place seemed pretty empty) since they were just standing around doing nothing.  When we asked for something, they looked irritated as to not wanting to be bothered or that they weren't our waiter/waitress. It's just BULL!!! If their waitstaff were attentive, we wouldn't have to flag someone down to get some service.   So to the food. It was mediocre at best. The yellow and green curry were bleh. It was more like a soup. The pad thai wasn't as flavorful as I had wanted it to be. It was more on the bland side of the spectrum. The only dish that blew my mind was the Jun Pad Poo. The crab meat was fresh and big chunks at that.  This was the really bummer here. When you are done eating, you're setting yourself up for a dessert that you expect that a Thai Restaurant should have. SERIOUSLY! NO MANGO WITH STICKY RICE? wait wait . . . NO FRIED BANANA WITH ICE CREAM? WTFH!!! The server's response was " We don't have mango with sticky rice. Oh we don't have fried banana with ice cream either. It's not in season right now so we don't have it." Everyone at our table thought . . . "ARE YOU F-ing SERIOUS?" So we decided to go even further and asked "So what do you have?" The response was, "Oh we have just plain ice cream and roti". To our disappointment, we just asked for the check so we can leave.   Overall, since they had a cheap lunch special. It was a cheap bargain. I'll be a little on the positive side and give them a 2 star. 1 got the nice decor of the place. 2 for the cheap lunch deal.  My advice is to test this place out during the lunch hour so you don't get charged more for something that you would've gotten for less. Who is to say, right? They might have something super good that will blow your mind, but so far for me, nothing stood out for me.

sXOGOBq74pq9KBB6px14fw.text: I had dinner here with friends last Saturday night for my husband's birthday dinner.  Another great experience.  Besides the Tom Yum soup, we had plenty of food to go around for our entire party of 12.  The guy singing karaoke on stage did really good with all the Elvis songs; I was impressed that he had no accent!  He was generous enough to sing "Happy Birthday" to my husband, who apparently had turned red as we all joined in to sing to him.  Our american friends who we brang with us for the first time here definitely LOVED this place.

cYzghEGrsesrD8fBpRAT9w.text: Hit or miss dishes. Some are pretty bad, some are really good.  *Service isn't very prompt or knowledgeable. They are friendly, but can't describe any dish, this was not helpful when I wanted to see what ducks they had and how it was prepared other than "red curry style" on the menu.*  I recommend the padt thai here, it is really good with chicken. Stay away from the soups, they are too bland. Their house special thai style crispy chicken is very tasty and works well with spices. Meat larb is only ok, but then again I don't care for larb. Drunken noodles are only average here. Satay chicken avg as well.

HBs2zmMgBEUwsXFd_sOOfw.text: I think this place is mostly a bar, because the food quality is really not that great. Ordered a fried rice, and there were shells in it. Its not a great feeling to chow down on your food and then all of a sudden you feel the shell crunching against your teeth...the fried rice also had no flavor. We've had the beef jerky as well and every time it comes out super fatty. Like you can't even chew it. Sad. Last but not least, the only reason I kept ordering from here is because I crave fried bananas and everywhere else makes them hard on the outside (like egg rolls) while I like them to be fluffy. This is the only place I've found that makes them fluffy! The first time they tasted great, second time they tasted like rotten bananas were used, third time they were okay, and the last time not only did the bananas taste super nasty but the bread on the outside (or whatever it is) didn't even cover up the banana all the way. Very sloppy. Maybe one day I'll dine in or something..cuz I'm so tired of thai restaurants losing consistency!

n69xUEE5u-fy3j6308c16w.text: The food here was all great.  The flavors were excellent.  Everything was served fairly quickly once we were able to order.   And that is where they lose a star.  We were a party of two and the restaurant was fairly empty when we arrived.  We were seated in one of their tall backed booths near the stage they had setup for a guitar/vocalist (pretty decent).  There was a party of 12 in the middle of service and three other tables of three-four customers.   We waited at least 10 minutes after being seated as we saw three different servers working with the other tables.  I finally leaned out of the booth and waved to the manager.  He came to the table and became our server.  He even put on the black apron.  He was dressed in business attire while the servers all had their uniform on.    So the food was great.  We had the pork jerky that you dip in this great chili spiced dressing.  Chicken Larb (hot level 3) which was super tasty of citrus and heat and onions.  A really great pad thai with chicken.  There was a lot of flavor in this.  Some pad thai dishes are kind of bland.  Not this one.  Great green curry...sweet and spicy and creamy.  Again it was rich and flavorful.  The beef itself was pretty ick though.  It was overcooked.  Two for one SingHa beers made up for some of what was lacking.   Let's hope that no one else has as much trouble getting a server's attention, though.

6uJlCBOzhVlbuUK1M_LsSg.text: This is where I take out of town guests when they're craving Thai food. It's conveniently close to the strip. The atmosphere is really nice, not your typical Asian kitchen. The food is really good! It's definitely in my top 3 Thai restaurants in Vegas. We ordered the combination pad Thai, yellow chicken curry, and tom yum shrimp.   On a scale from 1-10 on the spicy level, we got a 3. But WOWWWW, the tom yum tasted like a 7 or 8! It is so spicy, and be careful... there's lots of chilies floating around! One bite into it by accident will set your mouth on fire! (Yes, it happened to me twice! )   A bit pricier than the other Thai restaurants around town, but its definitely worth it!

UAdKg1LKXOZceuMlzsHx5A.text: Me and my family actually tried this place by accident, but it was the best accidental choice ever. We usually eat at  Pho Little Saigon across the parking lot but was drawn in by the Thai food (both in a plaza near China Town). Krung Siam's decor was mostly wood and it was very dim at night, I couldn't see much but who's looking at each other when we're nose to plate w/ such good food?  We ordered satay, chicken krapow, crispy pork w/ chinese broccoli, and spicy catfish (pad ped pla dook). There wasn't one dish that I didn't fully enjoy. Everything on our table (except the glasses of water) was spicy, full of flavor, and just darn right satisfying. Every heaping spoonful of food that went into my mouth was a buddha-sent heaven, or hell since it's spicy, you know.  If you're asking if this place serves authentic Thai food, YES. Very authentic, so not everyone will be accustomed to the unusual and potent flavors. Is it affordable? YES. Will  I drive you there? Believe me, if I could I would haul every single reader into a giant container truck and drive there right now. Convinced yet?

lJmKdfdisOnMbkKtAk2SoA.text: $4.99 lunch specials! which include the thai curries, pad thai, drunken noodles, and a couple of other items.  Definitely worth it for $5.  Drunken noodles were ok, not that great.  Everything else is delicious.  They also have $1 Thai tea's and thai iced coffees. very good value.

gAdKDTIvoOwIw2H0xEDbHA.text: Why is our eyes larger than our stomachs when we drink? We came here to snack and have more drinks but ended up ordering up a storm. While having shots and chasing them with beers, we managed to snack on some of the food we ordered. I recall the food being flavorful and tasty. It allowed us to all drink more with food in our stomachs.   The staff was friendly and fun. Some of the staff actually remembered the people I was with from a previous visit there. The restaurant is large and has a full bar. They even have karaoke if you're brave enough to sing in front of strangers. Apparently from what the server told us, my friends were just extremely drunk last time and they couldn't pry them off the mics lol. Good drinks, tasty food and lasting memories. Fun spot!

Xun79xYKgXsv2E7BKlXDcA.text: Very high quality delicious food.  Makes me feel like I'm back home in Thailand. very fresh tom yum goong was perfect som tum poo bala delicious

_42NqX-1X6wKyk6CKoC3PA.text: I used to come to this place a lot because they had good food, generous portions, very polite employees and were open late night so I could order after work.  Unfortunately i won't be coming here anymore. Food is okay now, portions are MUCH smaller and they Falsely advertise prices online lower than what they charge you.  Tonight's order will be the last.  When I told the guy who gave me my food that the prices were different online he said something in Thai to another guy.  He then tells me, "I told Mgr what you said and he says okay".  How about sorry for mistake, or even we'll charge what is listed?? Nope.  Well it may seem trivial, but little things like what I've mentioned tick me off.  We are in a hospitality town and it baffles me how places act this way.  Oh well, it's probably better for my waistline that I don't order noodles at 2 am !!

nuaS-XR6LSKJH7tKSQTc0g.text: This place is the BOMBBBBB!!!!!!! Go here! You want bomb Thai food with great service and an amazing atmosphere, go here !!!!    From the great service, amazing food and live music I fell in love. This place is the bomb. We always have to come to Chinatown when we want Thai food at night cause they are the only spots open late. But we found this place to try out and were so happy! The food was super tasty, fast and flavorful. We got pad Thai and Tom ka soup. We also got the spring rolls that were super yummy. We didn't have to wait more than 10-12 minutes for our foods. Which was awesome. The food was very filling and satisfying, it may not look like a lot but we didn't even finish our food.   Our server hands down was the best, like constantly refilling our drinks and checking up on us. Even other servers gave us refills. Like the service is of a 5 star restaurant, perfection. Best service I've had probably. We literally didn't have to ask for a refill or anything not one time. 10 stars for this place if could. We will definitely be back for sure. They even pack up your food for you if you want it togo instead of having you pack it which I love.  There's so many details that they do that just make it a great experience. MM is what his name said on the receipt but I didn't catch his full name.   They also had these really cool I pads that you can view pictures of all the items they had which we thought was really cool. It's nice being able to see pictures of items on the menu vs just a description. They also had live music playing, possibly  cause it's a Saturday night. He was singing in a different language I'm not sure what it was but it was very soothing and he was very talented. We loved the whole vibe of the place. This place is great for dates and such too. It's so nice.   Great place , 10 STARS !!! Go here lol

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom ka soup and rice super yummy !!

nfeqHO64M_pBEBu4i8jEDw.text: The good thing about this place is that it's open late! And I also like they have someone usually singing and some kind of entertainment with a dance floor. I have to say the duck curry is amazing here. Their Tom yum soup is good as well. The soup and the roast duck curry was my favorite. Their Lao style papaya salad as ok for me. It could be a little better. Also tried their crab fried rice and they give you a lot of crab in it which is awesome. Our server was friendly and took good care of us. I have tried their drunken noodle to go here as well and it was decent. I highly recommend their roast duck curry. Loved it.

This is gangsters bullshit!  My advice to you don't go there! They don't worth your money! And if you decide to go be careful from the waitress.

--yuoZ2g7gxJQf1iwJJxQg.text: So disappointed that I had to write another review after my last 5-star one. Hoping it's just an off night & cook was tired from a busy Valentine's crowd. Otherwise I have learned my lesson that I will come back during the afternoon and not late night because the taste was so different that I could have been at another restaurant instead of 50 feet from where I sat my last visit here. Obviously being a different shift was another cook but tastes were nothing similar. The Tom khan soup had a fishy flavor, mushrooms were raw & they even took it back to the kitchen to add more coconut because the first serving had very little coconut milk in it. Even when it came back, it was not comparable to our last visit. The Penang curry was also less creamy than usual. Pad Thai was flavorless other than the scallions. Tonight earns 2 stars for food, but gave the extra star for the service.  So sorry for tonight's visit because this has been my late-night go to Thai place. Not sure if I will give their late night eats another try in the near future because I didn't enjoy one dish of the 3 we ordered.  I will return here during early afternoons but will be searching for another late-night restaurant.

vA_1zRW5Oot81bnHIWYbyg.text: It seems like this place has undergone a remodel recently. It's lost it's authentic appeal and looks kind of like an SF coffee house now. Food is not as good as I remember. Prompted to leave this updated review because of a rude seating host. Won't be returning.

tVb1CCmyGfWfCj_utsRkIw.text: Super good food! Went here on a Sunday night. They had a live musician. My friend and I had the crab fried rice, chicken lettuce wrap, and soft shell crab salad. Everything was delicious!  Update: My friend and I went to the bathroom. She noticed an employee who didn't wash her hands after using the restroom and she was one of their servers!!! Ugh. So sad coz I did enjoy the food, entertainment, and service.

NgKqAJGZXlZuTk78XZocGA.text: This has become one of my favorite Thai spots in China town. It's open late, I've never had to wait to be seated, the atmosphere is very clean and put together, the staff is always friendly (sometimes there is a language barrier but never had a mix up with my order), and the food is DELICIOUS!! The prices are a bit high but you get a lot of food and I've never been disappointed with the taste or presentation.  The ambiance is great for a little date night or hanging out with friends. If there is live music sometimes it can be a little loud but not too overpowering.   I used to go to a well known spot in the plaza next door but Krung Siam is a more intimate experience without the hassle.   P.s. try the pad Thai..your taste buds will thank me later!  Oh, and a shout out to my favorite sever Tom for always being the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Justin about to enjoy his first bite!

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These lettuce wraps are the bomb dot com. The shrimp and the dipping sauce give it a little bit of a sweet flavor. Filling and tasty!
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xiXcQn7ZkNYXNrB7l-QOLA.text: Food was slow to come out. But when it did it was great . Service was excellent. Late night R&B. Definitely a good place to go with friends. Must try Cocktails and Thai ice tea!

bsapNehdTSSVoHEDb09udg.text: Wake Up People!  This restaurant is WAY over-rated!  I've been enjoying great, authentic Thai food for over 30 years and my experience at Krung Siam was a huge disappointment.  I had 3 common items on which I grade the quality and accuracy of a Thai food kitchen, as follows;  Appetizer) Chicken Satay - Tender, yes, because it's steamed, NOT grilled, therefore flavorless. Grade: 2 of 5  Soup) Tom Kah w/chicken - WOAH!! SOUR!! How do you make a coconut milk/Tom Kah paste based soup come out WAY TOO SOUR??  Also, highly over-seasoned. Grade: 1 of 5  Entree) Chicken Pad Thai - ROUND EGG Noodles cut to 2-3 inches long!  This is supposed to be PAD THAI, NOT LO MEIN! Flat, uncut rice noodles were absent from the party, making this dish a complete failure. Grade: 0  Service was friendly.

vkorQItlMiXucHTkzdv2Gg.text: Back again! This place is so yummy. Took the level down to a 3 on my green curry and tried a shrimp pad tai. Very yummy!   I like to keep it family style so we all try a little of everything.    Enjoyed a pitcher of beer with the table. Good times here.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wwKk4ID42xrE3VoGBjOsoQ.text: This place is legit.. I always bring people from Cali that's visiting me to this spot because it tastes almost like Cali's Thai food.. I order here all the time Togo or dine in.. they are friendly.   Must try!

V2sm80omp2lB55HJ5QiiFg.text: I always have to come here when I'm in Vegas! Love the staff, decor and food!  Spice levels: 0-10 but beware because I got a 2 and I was crying lol! Then again, I'm only a mild spice eater but someone that got a 4 said mine tasted like a 4. Maybe they just got it mixed up this time? But they felt so bad for me that they made me a whole new one free of charge. It was so insanely nice!!!!  Favorite things to eat: all are freaking delicious!! Combination pad Thai, seafood lad na, tom yum soup, tom ka soup, pad see yew! Always consistent with great taste! Thai tea is always a classic and so perfectly made.  Portions: decent sized. If you have an appetite like me, you can eat until you're full and still have some take home to save and eat later.  Music: they mostly play covers of other songs but they are sooo good! Top 40s all the way to 90s. Great music taste. I'm also sure they have a live band and karaoke nights because there's a stage set up.  Space: the restaurant is huge! Great for intimate dates or large groups.  Parking: LOTS!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oGx8rE0fPlf6ez04EPHdVg.text: This is one of my goto late night spots.  The service is ok. It really depends on how good the English is of the server   Most nights they have an off key karaoke singer which can be entertaining.   Food is fairly cheap for quality and portion size   One of my favorite dishes especially when it's cold out is the Tom yum soup. Get the pot and it will feed several   They have a roasted chicken dish that they flame up table side. It's impressive looking but kinda boring flavor wise.   Be careful when tell them how hot you want your food. Spicy is not all the same and in this establishment can vary on cook. I tend to rate on the lower side knowing i can always add more.

usTnhVo7UmiZd724nMwGeA.text: Is service flexibility a thing? They are very amenable to customizing your dishes the way you want. It seems like they have a sliding scale not only for spice levels but also for how "ethnic" a dish can be. We ordered garlic beef, duck fried rice, roast duck curry, and I ordered (because no one else wanted to try this) the papaya salad with raw blue grab and raw shrimp Laotian style with sticky rice and with a spice level of 3 (pro tip: always tone down the spice level when you get something Laotian style versus Thai style because Laotian style tends be for more dry than sweet like Thai so it usually will taste spicier Lao style). I liked everything but my party did complain that the food came out warm and wasn't hot enough. This didn't bother me since it complemented my cold papaya salad well.  But the service towards then end was lacking. It seemed like they forgot about us all together and took a really long time to get us dessert or bring our check. They were getting busy so I understand from a "tipping" standpoint, but from a review stand point just be more proactive about asking for dessert and the check.

paPbAsJ-Nwg0Da7Au8ELEw.text: This place is nice & clean. The food was ok. I had seafood tom yum & a side of rice for $15.15. I could get a better tom yum soup for pretty much the same price elsewhere.  1 star was deducted because the food wasn't that good. Another star was deducted because I was sitting there & saw a customer sitting in front of me dropped his jacket. Literally, 4 servers walked by & saw the jacket on the floor. None of them said anything to him & just walked by.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $15.15
