Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tom yum soup with a side of rice

iK8k82czw54cCWYWG5CTWg.text: We had an awesome meal here consisting of Tom Sum soup, Crying Dragon, Drunken Noodles, and Pad Thai with shrimp. Every thing tastes amazing and the service a presentation deserves 5 stars. The atmosphere is pleasant, clean, and comfortable. I would highly recommend this Thai restaurant! What a great find!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pas Thai with shrimp and the Tom Yum soup in the background.

eaG9qm94_n0VpknXpfmB-w.text: Very cool ambience from the time you walk through the door... very open and inviting. Food is fantastic and authentic. Service is courteous and friendly. Will definitely return

_2k9gw58Bkp4Rj1O6biGHw.text: Excellent food based on both presentation and taste.  Great service. Great atmosphere. Looking forward to returning.

EnZq2zhX3dP18Qst1vqqqQ.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review about this place yet since it is the best! This was one of the first restaurants my boyfriend and I tried when we moved to Las Vegas in 2011, and let me tell you it did not disappoint!   When we arrived (with a party of 7) for his 24th birthday, we were greeted and seated almost immediately. Earlier in the day I came by to drop off a birthday cake and some decorations and they waitress had them set up when our party arrived.  First thing ordered was Thai Ice Teas for the table. Which were amazing. Not too sweet, and not too strong, just perfect.  For appetizers we order 3 servings of the Thai beef Jerky. Very tender with just the right amount of spice.  My dinner selection was the shaved papaya salad (I ordered a 4 in spiciness) and it was crazy hot, but I washed it down with the tea ( the next time we visited I ordered a 3 and it was perfect).  The waitress brought a round of martinis to the table to commemorate the birthday celebration, and the person doing karaoke at the time joined us in singing happy birthday. It was an awesome night.  Pros:  atmosphere service food  cons: Parking lighting (it was a little on the dark side)  This review is from my first visit in 2012 and we have been back 8 times since. Definitely recommend!

ev8ZyorlGO27HcZLbimGXg.text: Best Thai food in town. Crispy pad Thai, duck tamarind, crispy garlic shrimp, papaya salad with grilled shrimp, good wine and sake selections, draft beer -- happy hour 2:30-8pm. Good service and live music Thurs-Sunday

K8wDgSYAIVmcR2rj-mgVFQ.text: Always quick and delicious! Lots of options on the food and drink menu with varying levels of spice. I like to get the Panang Curry here, but also enjoy the drunken noodles and the pad Thai. The sticky rice with mango is a slammin dessert option... Atmosphere is energetic regardless of what time you go in.

YYsbzfKbRQWSq8uYs-W_Vw.text: The reason I keep going back is simple. Service, they deliver to just about any where. They never get my order wrong and the food is always hot and fresh. Sometimes it is not about mind blowing food. Krung Siam is just fine as far as Thai food goes. Sometimes it is about reliable service and the comfort in knowing your favorite Thai place will always be there for you.

NniWKAeheWdNzZdbAS-L8g.text: Amazing place. I love when they have music. Great staff! Their pad Thai is slammin and the Penang curry is heaven!

FPg2lHsaRPnAycgmKiZjPA.text: If you go there when it is empty you will get good service.  If you go there when it is full ....the service is among the worst I've ever seen.  The food is solid but nothing to brag home about. Small portion sizes.  I know about thai town los angeles, and so i am a bit spoiled on my thai taste buds.  The best thing about this place is it's open late and it's simple. Ive eaten here 10x.   The worst thing about this place is that they play very loud music and pretend they are a cool bar, when no one else is inside. Which sucks because its late and I just want to eat and relax sometimes.  I will keep going here cause i eat laaaate... But i would never even consider coming here at any other time. There ARE 100%  many, many better thai spots around chinatown.

cznCPbYmexR4evouARkJVQ.text: The food was great! Smaller portions for the price, but oh well. Not too many choices for Thai food rather late at night. I didn't like the 1.5 hours wait time on a Tuesday. And they did mess up on our order. They gave us the wrong fried fish, and we STILL had to pay for it (almost $30!!!). Will definitely reconsider when craving Thai food.

CPYSxh-3o3OEmAi9w2sLZQ.text: We had our company party here they did amazing and it was beautiful! The Staff and bartenders were very helpful!

luHjelP3XpSXWlHOJyfPWA.text: Seriously one of the best thai food spots ive ever ate in my life curry is to die for ... This place is truly ine of my all time vegas faves !!!

noXd1gSSnHVRYLtW2xtqvw.text: This is a nice place that has a cozy atmosphere and polite servers. The food is good but if yep allows only 5 stars and I were to give this place 5 stars for their food what would I give to other competing places that have much better food in my opinion ?

9mW2kf3nBKG2iBTOp3r_sw.text: Hands down one of the best thai food I have eaten. We ordered the panang curry spice level at a medium, the pineaplle fried rice, pad see yeu, pad thai and the drunken noodles. Everything was delicious! The food came out super fast and theyre conveniently open til 6 am. The booth we got for 5 was also big and spacious so we didnt have to bump elbows while eating. The curry was so flavorful and had a hint of spice to it (not too spicy but just enough) combined with the side of white rice ouweeeeeee. Definitely have to come back for.more whenever im in vegas

OZ8fRusCNLl0xollqRsoLw.text: So i went to Krung Siam Thai at a random Wednesday night. We were planing to go to another Thai restaurant but it was already around 10pm, the one we planed to go close at 11pm. So we decided to go this Thai restaurant instead since it opens until 5 in the morning.   The restaurant has a wall of wine in front of the bar seat, and as i walk in more, there is a stage with a guitar. The atmosphere is good and the only bad thing is it is too dark. The table next to us used their phone's flashlight to see the menu.   We started with a Tom Yum soup with shrimp. We order 2 level of spicy out of 10, but it was not as spicy as we thought. Some thai restaurant's level two could possibly kill me... The Tom Yum soup comes in a metal pot. It has a bright orange color, the soup is clear and watery. They use cocktail shrimp, which is moist and tender. I like it better than those skinny shrimp that is usually used. The soup is a little spicy and sour with a kind of scent strong of lemongrass.  For appetizer, we had a raw shrimp and papaya salad. The raw slimy shrimp is one of my favorite thai dish. It is like a Thai sashimi but with a little piece of garlic and a green spicy chili sauce which makes it a high note dish. The shrimp is gummy, moist and rubbery. The shrimp itself is bland, but it goes well with the garlic and the sauce. The sauce is a little sour but very spicy. Next one is the papaya salad, the salad is made with green papaya, peanuts, tomatoes and carrots. The salad is very fresh and crunchy with a sweet, sour and spicy lime sauce. However, it is too spicy that i only had one bite of it.   For entree, we had a basil fried rice with pork. It has a very strong basil smell with a colorful appearance. The rice is soggy, grainy and a little oily. The pork is tender and smooth.  For a good ending, we ordered a mango sticky rice. Its bottom has a layer of sticky rice and top with a whole mango with some coconut sauce. Is rice is very gummy, soggy and creamy. The mango is not sour at all, which is quite sweet with the sweet coconut sauce. The coconut flavor is just right as it will not cover the taste of mango but goes well with it.   In conclusion, the food is tasty and the service is wonderful. As the salad is too spicy to eat, i drank a lot of water and they refill the water very quickly. And as we were ready to order, I looked at one of the server and he came immediately to take our order. In the middle of our meal, a performer went onto the stage and started to perform some nice song which makes our whole experience even better!

KusCIAB9JN_TTQhZC5DiVg.text: A friend and I ended up eating here since my iPhone needed repaired and the store was pretty much right next door, and we were in the mood for Thai, anyway.  This place has a cool vibe, and the bar/wine rack provide some nice touches, as well.  The food itself came pretty quickly, and was very delicious.  The servers were quite courteous.  I never got to the bottom of my water glass!  We didn't get to experience the live musician other reviewers mention, but we'll be back at some point to this venue...

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy pad thai!

4XqvVrPL4pU_KNNK_etD5Q.text: Good food. Restaurant is big. Prices are reasonable. Close to strip and China town. Easy parking on a Friday night great service. Will be back .

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying tiger must order

ms0_ew5d17egbdcLaRUzZg.text: We ordered thai iced tea to go and it was one of the best places.  We have to go back and try food next time!

ZYMe40EGo7oVRJYG75pFEw.text: Before my family and I left this lovely, hot, humid place, we decided to come here to eat because someone was craving pho.  Like most Thai restaurants, the portions are huge and meant to be family style. Well I mean if you want to embrace 'murica then eat the whole dish by all means. No one is judging. Lol shit I would if I was hungry enough.  THE FOOD:  - Fresh Spring Rolls w/ Peanut Sauce - The sauce was good. I like my food spicy so I put a lot of that red chili sauce in it. The spring rolls were meh. Too much bean spouts so it lacked flavor unless I got some mint or something. I could make better ones at home.  - Chicken Satay - The chicken was juicy and  it was full of flavor. Definitely try it. You can't really go wrong with chicken satay.  - Seafood Rad Na - This is a dish I grew up eating since I was a little chubby fat girl waddling around. This Rad Na definitely did not disappoint and it had more seafood in it than other ones that I have had. It was flavorful, balanced, and oh so yummy! Mix it with some of those pickled jalapenos and you got yourself a winner!  - Basil Fried Rice - This. This made me regret ordering spring rolls. It was soooo good. None of the flavors overpowered one another and they put a lot of basil and bell peppers. We got the medium spice level because some people can't hang but it was still good. There was a little tickle of spice tingling my senses like the Taco Bell Fire hot sauce. So it was like a tease to my taste buds, then the spice was gone. I wish I could eat more right now. But god damn, carb overload.  Overall, food was great and service was on point. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely be coming back to try some more food.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood rad na
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil fries rice
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken satay

4juOHOcVlNBiwvdi2xG0Hg.text: We had an excellent dinner here last night. The best was the Thai dumplings we had as one of our appetizers - off the charts!  Second best was another appetizer Crying Tiger - amazing gift for beef lovers. The third best thing about this restaurant is the wait people - what a sweet group of efficient and kind people!

IWdKrYnQQu3yEHj_QE_2KA.text: 1st time here...  I love thai food!!! Greeted with a smile. Ordered Pad Thai (combination  $4 more), crying tiger,.chicken panang and chicken satay.  All of this.. it came with 2 tiny single serve scoop of rice, we asked for a little more of the pickled.cucumber and they said it's a $1 more.    Hubby and kids love the  crying tiger medium, so we ordered another one.   Here's what earn them a 3 star 1. we finish eating, the 2nd crying tiger order never came 2.  flag down the sweet smiling server following up on the missing crying tiger and to cancel it since it hasn't made its appearance .. she can't understand us and we patiently waiting for  the other server. she invetably spilled the cup she's holding and splattered on thefloor. (this didn't upset me), however she came back  with a wet.mop reeking of the fabuloso. . it was so strong that were gagging, luckily we were done eating or we would have lost it. 3. the spice tray was even offered to us, however saw them deliver to other tables.  Food 1.  Chicken panang - I asked for 8/10 spiciness. it was probably an 5 on my scale. a plus though is the lychee in it 2. chicken satay - good per my son's standard (he's a junior foodie)  3. combination pad Thai - we had better, kids said it tasted weird.  4. peanut sauce with chicken satay- good and warm  so.overall a comedy of errors.  will I come back? maybe not, Vegas has a lot to offer  and may only come back if my boys truly. crave the crying tiger.

iQSOz2irzjSBr9woyhlLAw.text: Somewhat reasonably priced considering you can sit down and get some quality food up until 5:30am. It's a very nice establishment. Nice decor & environment. The BBQ chicken was very tender and full of flavor. The sauces they include are all very tasty. The sample platter was a decent size and enough for three or four ppl to snack on. The service was great. They refilled our waters frequently and came to check on us just the right amount of times. The bathrooms were really clean too.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken. Smells amazeballs!
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Krung Siam Platter

rUMXedK2GXptnI9lU_UYkg.text: This gem is located in China Town; On the corner of Spring Mountain & Valley View.  There is a Starbucks in the same plaza.  Great lunch special! A co-worker took me here last week for lunch.  I ordered: - Thai Iced Tea: first time having this.  It's very sweet but has an interesting flavor that I couldn't put my finger on.  I would definitely order this again.  - Chicken Pad Thai: OMG!  Probably within my top 2 favorite Pad Thai's ever!  Not spicy at all, but great flavor, yummy chicken and I think fried tofu?  Delicious!  The lunch special says its served with soup, egg roll, fried wonton and salad.  We only got the soup.  The soup had some veggies and tofu in it.  Good flavor.  I'm kinda glad it didn't come with the rest, because I was stuffed after the plate of Pad Thai.  The plate is a generous portion, especially for lunch, but I finished it off like a champ, because it was that good.  The restaurant is very clean inside and everyone was very nice.  I can't wait to take my husband here!

0VnU9ItJnC_Dp7Lj131yMw.text: So the "oh crap" feeling hit me the minute we walked into the restaurant & I noticed the majority of the diners were non Asian.  This is not good especially for a restaurant in Chinatown.  To me, that generally means the food is not authentic, that it is watered down for the American palette.  Coincidentally, My friend is white & she believes there is some truth to that.   We ordered the Chicken Larb salad, Garlic and pepper chicken & the drunken noodle, all medium spicy.  The food was okay.  Of the 3 dishes, only the drunken noodle packed a punch in the spicy dept.  The other 2 were barely hot.  The Lard salad & garlic pepper chicken were unremarkable & sort of bland.   The decor was very pleasant.  The servers were very nice, all smiles & stuff.  Excellent customer service was delivered to us.  Our server came over to check on us about 5 times, asking how we liked the food & if she could get us anything else.  We thought this level of customer service would not be found in your average restaurant in Chinatown where the primary clientele was Asians.  There, it is sit down, eat your food and get out lol

erdKMgAXPZrYsqxCrqVqRQ.text: There were two Thai restaurants we visited on our latest trip to Vegas and they were like day and night. Krung Siam is now and has always been one of our favorite lunch spots to go to when we're in town. The Pad Thai is one of the best and I swear I could drink a gallon of the soup served with lunch. Keep up the good work, we'll be back!  Now a place to avoid: Hollywood Thai. Even the owner calls his restaurant a "dummy" (I believe he means "dump" in broken English). Crappy food, bad location and no service (which the owner "apologized" for). Furthermore, if you bring in a groupon the owner admits he will serve you "30% less food" than other customers get.  And, the reason I bring this to your attention, the owner of H-Thai says his mother is good friends with the owner of Krung Siam but goes on to say, "if you knew what happened to Krung Siam a month ago you would never go there". I don't know and I don't care. A True "friend" never back stabs a fellow friend. And, as for Krung Siam, they've been good to us before, they were great on this visit and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

FgrucrT6RNzdNXjVmIf5rg.text: Red Duck Curry. Many times, certain restaurants, have specific dishes that are really incredible, and some that really don't do it for ya. This place has one particular dish, really does it for me - the red duck curry. It is the best curry I have had anywhere. as gross as it may sound, if you decide to try it, make sure to ask for no skin.  the beef salad with cilantro was excellent last night. our server was attentive and very nice. Pad thai was average in the past.  the red curry with duck is the bomb!  if you don't like duck, try it with a different meat. I will continue to visit this place just for that one dish.

F7099f8vFCc9DeKTRIqzqQ.text: The food of Krung Siam is a-ok! The pad thai was very tasty, the portion was generous and I felt my 4/10 spice level was accurate. This was my first visit and what surprised me was that there was live music! Don't get me wrong, he was talented but since I was there on a first date, it made conversation somewhat difficult. My impression is that the entertainment only takes place during the later hours but my advice would be to call ahead to see what the music schedule is if you would like to have a quiet meal. All in all, a good spot but with the full bar and occasional entertainment, it just has more of a restaurant night club feel than I'm used to from a thai restaurant.

DLP4BQ7U7wYbxDRcexlYOA.text: Love the thai food here. Very authentic, spicy and delicious. Live musician is great with a mix of thai and oldies music.

XcWndbuYiqXEmsL8QEO56A.text: Bad service. Taking plates with food off of the table while we were still eating. Sticky rice that wasn't sticky and chicken fried entirely too long. Terrible experience

dpZZkZ_U7Sn8BO5AHFcjkA.text: Cute atmospehere. Jerky app was good. Duck curry wad decent as well. I had the combination soup, which tasted like someone had spilt cinnamon in it. Not worth the drive. Cool that it has a full bar. Bass from the music was too strong.

gTgE_4d85AH3eAi33SM5Vg.text: Our group had  the worst hangover, and we did not have the energy to drive off the strip to get some authentic Asian food. Found this place on yelp and the fact that they delivered was God sent! Food was delicious. With the food being spicy, we definitely sweated out all of our toxins from the night before. Food was on the pricier side but it definitely beats room service and having to leave our hotel. Thank you!!

IykKTYBp1BaV8Yf1Q_3l-Q.text: Chicken in the Satay and the Curry was overcooked and hard...servers were rude.  Average at best.

9zTaw0HoeEcR71BC3vvksg.text: I've given this place numerous tries because the reviews are so good, yet I find that everything I order is just not very good. I can't understand how people are raving about this place so much. There are several really good Thai restaurants and this just isn't one of them. I ate here last night and didn't care for it and felt bad that I had to pay for something that I only took a few bites of and hated.  Of course, the server saw that my food was virtually untouched and no one is going to offer to take it off the bill. I recommend a different place for Thai.

ljHFH8QAl5EbyQfZjfF_HA.text: Nice restaurant and bar, Thai is their specialty. Service was fast and friendly. Booth seating available. Well stocked bar, surprisingly good wine selection in all price ranges. I had the lunch special. Yellow curry chicken. Flavors were great. I enjoyed my meal.  Again my experience was for lunch. So for a tasty lunch, good price, and quick they came thru.

V_YxlSYs1oAGWZnqqwx60w.text: The server barely spoke English but understood about 15%. He could not answer any question right?? ALL OUR DISHES CAME OUT @ the same time:Salad,Soup & main dish!!! Obviously, our soup & entree got cold, no server to be found. When I asked 1 server for a plate to cover my dishes, it never came. Food was good. Fresh spring rolls were just lettuce and thin slice of tofu, no shrimp? Soup BOWL is huge, Tom Kahn Gai. Chicken basil entree was awkward as it was minced? I don't know what was inside???? Is there a band tonight ? He didn't understand the question even though I pointed to the music area??? Weird???

q49rMmh2b3k0Yym5eS9oOA.text: Its good for late night Thai food. Portions not as big as most Restaurants and a little higher priced.  good  because its open late night. Not bad, waitresses are  friendly. Has a nice bar.

9F2hrt-CkvHGrwIgqiijMQ.text: We always come to Krung Siam when in Vegas.  Happy hour specials include $2 beers, so we love it for a late lunch.  Panang Curry is a favorite, rounded out with pad thai and a couple of appetizers, and you have lunch for 4.  Add the eggplant and you'll be full and still take some home.  Vegetarian and vegans both can find plenty of choices.  Impress your guests when it's your turn to buy by taking them to this funky place away from the strip.  You'll look like a local!

2IHNuHlN2XgSneWT33hixA.text: We found this place in a whim.  Wanted something fast but not pho.  We were seated right away, which accounts for that one star.  Then the food came pretty fast, which accounts for another star.  However, the food were cold, didn't seem very "freshly cooked".  The other issue I had was the customer service, my children are 8 and 6, without asking, the server lady immediately gave them plastic spoons and forks and plastic plates. When I asked if they can have metal forks bc those plastic ones aren't very sturdy , she said "No".  I asked her why, she replied "they will break stuff".  I think she meant I wanted plates to be porcelains ----I told her she can keep the plastic plates,but I prefer the metal forks.  She then has to go ask the manager then came back with them.  Seriously?

7DTWlEqA6KfSCuS6wudGlQ.text: Today was my first visit. I had the chicken pad thai lunch special. The soup (which was great) and pad thai were delivered in record time. I asked for it spicy-4. Which is what I like from Archi's Thai Kitchen. However, here I didn't note any heat. It bordered on being too sweet. Now, I know to choose on the higher end of the scale.   The pad thai had a mix of tofu and chicken. It had a heavy amount of red onion. It could've used more peanuts, and I prefer the crunch of fresh bean sprouts these were softened from being mixed into the noodles.  Service was great. Atmosphere is real nice. Lunch was $4.99, plus a buck for an iced tea. While it wasn't the greatest pad thai, but you can't beat the price. I think I'll skip the pad thai next time, but I'll return to try other lunch specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $4.99 Lunch Chicken Pad Thai

m7OCuHSCmiN5d9BGN9fxKw.text: This is the second time I've been here.  My daughter loves the appetizer platter and the basil chicken is good but was not impressed with my noodle dish.  Not my favorite.  I liked the basil shrimp I had last time better.

v6krWHCevXcDTrJl0TApHw.text: Service can be slow, the food is pretty quick but sometimes your server is just nowhere to be found. Sometimes there is live music, he will serenade you and make you blush. Crying tiger dish is so succulent it melts in your mouth. Lunch specials are a really good deal. $15 beer tower and $2 draft beer during happy hour. It's a relaxed kind of vibe so it's a nice little spot to chill with your friends and get your grub on. And the spice levels are pretty accurate. I love my spices and I'm usually at a 5 or 6, if you can get to 10 then you're probably a dragon, and that's fine with me but don't breathe on me  (^_^) The best part about this place is that it's open so late. After a long night sometimes you just want to sit down and eat some good food where it's not so noisy.

dEWfd7eFRbwrDmMcOsorZg.text: Came here with the boyfriend for lunch. Ordered the pad thai which was delish and the basil fried rice. Might have gotten the basil fried rice a little too spicy at around a 5 so I guess this place is really serious when it comes to spicyness!! Both the dishes were superb!  HOWEVER, the service was horrible to non-existent.  I am use to getting low service since I look young but mind you, I am 21 years old and my boyfriend is 22 so I really don't understand why we were ignored! Water was never refilled and since I ordered the spicy fried rice, I had to flag down the waiter three times to get my water refilled! The table only had one place setting when we sat down so we flagged down a waiter for a setting but instead just got a fork!!!! All the waiters seemed to go around the other tables to make sure they were doing fine but skipped ours. This was by far the worst service I have ever had. Maybe it was just a mistake/accident but I will definitely find another thai place that will serve the same quality food with better service.

2G_P4LSW4-W1BWbfDzMg1g.text: Looking for some good authentic Thai food in Las Vegas? Go no further than a couple blocks away from the strip down Spring Mountain Rd and you'll find Krung Siam Thai. Nice place to eat, friend service, and your water cup stays full, perfect for when you're hungover from a night of partying too hard. This isn't watered down Thai food, so when it says spicy, it's going to be pretty spicy. Great food, great service, great decor, and a great 4 star Thai restaurant.

JdVuPqPgxCI0lFwesOkB0w.text: Horrible horrible service. We had reservations there advance of two weeks. We requested that the food be ready by the time we get there (which was 7p.m.). NOTHING was cooked... nothing was ready. We only got to eat 2-3 out of the 7-10 items ordered. Food was ok, but the service was so bad that I will not be returning any time soon.

2MD0Lcq-IROIREYUs3L62Q.text: Great place to get some good food and a nice cold SINGHA BEER!!! Love it!!! Will definitely be going back very soon.

uAX81fUErHmyr7ZNv4KOEA.text: We stopped here for a quick Thai meal before a play on a Saturday early evening in February. There were only 2 or 3 tables filled. I ordered an ice tea, only to be told they were OUT OF TEA! We ordered an appetizer and two pad thais, one with shrimp, the other with seafood. The pad thai was delivered before the appetizer, about which we had to remind them. There was no lime with the pad thai. When I asked for a slice, the waiter returned with a slice of lemon. The pad thai tasted off; the seafood was rubbery rings of calamari.  After struggling to get the waiter's attention, we paid the bill without finishing the meal and left. The next day, my dining companion (the "seafood" orderer) felt sick to his stomach all day and ran a low fever. Never again. Bad food; bad service. And this in s down economy. You'd think they'd treat their patrons better.

SdV0xz8VgPAe1GFw9SxKZg.text: this place is delicious!! my boyfriend ordered the yellow curry with rice while i had the pad see ew. my dish was very flavorful, just the way i like it. i tried my bf's dish and i was crying because i bit into a green chili pepper which i thought was a bell pepper!! i downed a whole glass of thai tea to washed the spiciness out. yikes* eat with caution you thai-food lovers!! the rice was kind of hard and not soft/chewy to my preference. the service was pretty slow for a place thats not so crowded, it was kind of pricey too.

ZDWD1LNCbYKiFd5xo53_aQ.text: I had a very bad experience here while visiting Las Vegas with my family for the holiday.   When we arrive, we waited for about 15 minutes to be seated which is fine. First, they tried to sit us at a table. When we're standing near the table getting ready to sit, another waiter came over and told the hostess not to sit us there so we had to go back and wait again. 5 minutes later we finally sit down.   When getting our drinks, the waiter asks if we are "local". We found this odd because usually people as if we're visiting or not. What does it mattter if we're local? We tell the waiter we're visiting for the holiday. After getting our drinks, we're told to move again because someone just put in a reservation for 12 and they needed room.  While ordering, we specifically tell the waiter to bring out the appetizers first before the entrees. The table we had was small so we didn't want the clutter. My mother's Rad Nah dish comes out first anyways. We tell them to take it back and bring out the dish when we all get our entrees. The appetizers were papaya salad and thai beef salad. They taste ok but I've had alot better. When the entrees come out, we find that all the meat is not cook thoroughly in most our dishes. In my brother's pad thai, the imitation crab meat was not even cooked. It looked they threw the meat in straight from the package. After asking for the dish to be recooked, the pad thai comes back super sweet like someone dumped some high fructose corn syrup on the dish. The dish in inedible. My mother's dish also has meat that is under cooked. She just eat the noodles trying not to cause a fuss. My dish was ok. Crispy pork that was a little salty but at least edible.  Maybe if we told the waiter we were local, we would have been treated better. Since we're visiting and might not come back for a while, the restaurant acted like they didn't care about us.  In the end, we just went to In-N-Out Burger. They never disappoint like this mess of a Thai restaurant did.

KwjKPv4uy9tnKPiPRzPH7Q.text: Food was great, decor is cool, live music which is nice. Service was okay, but good place to go to overall.

LJq_AVyaO8LFnQyfpTthMA.text: I went back there again tonight with my friends. We didnt' like the papaya salad last time so much but this time was ok just not as good as before. Here's a deal, I just really can't handle the lady singer at the restaurant so much. I just couldn't take just to listen to her anymore. Can someone really tell the owner about her that she can't sing. I couldn't breathe after heard her voice. I do like the guy singer tho, he is pretty good! pls pls pls dont' let her sing there again.

j9Beu3nmZgr3NIyGXlRPxw.text: food is decent and great lunch deal bargain.  it's worth it to make the 5 minute drive out of the strip for some cheap thai lunch.

lzXXV9xJFczcY6kbIbxXOA.text: After searching a good amount of time for a place to eat off the strip, my friends and I settled on Krung Siam because of the reviews and proximity.  The place was nice inside as well as clean. Once we entered we were seated almost promptly. The menu appeared extensive and prices were a little too high I think for just Thai food off the strip but for sure cheaper than the Vegas strip food!  I thought perhaps portions would be larger due to the high prices when actually they are only moderate and marginal for family style dining.  We ordered the green curry with tofu, drunken noodles and Tom-kha kai soup dishes.  Price at the end for all three meals and drinks is about $38 (after 10pm is happy hour and it was advertised 15% off the total bill).  Service is very swift and it seems this place is popular since it was filled up but not packed.  At around 10:30pm or so a singer sang 80's music live on stage. Overall the food was good but too pricey, place is clean but seating area was too dim. The music can play a little too loud so I had a difficult time overhearing friends' conversations.

xcDdKiu8ddWnEM7xye4dSw.text: Terrible service. Didn't get water, plates, or utensils til after the first dish came out. We ordered 5 dishes, the first 4 had about a 10 minute gap between serving. We finished the first 4 dishes and the last one still never arrived yet. The food isn't anything fancy either. I do not recommend coming here at all. Oh and to top it off, while I was washing my hands in the restroom I watched a waiter walk out of the only stall and out of the restroom without washing his hands. That pretty much sealed the deal. Never coming back here again.

oLpDDzWqKIscpEyTpEiWEg.text: I thought that the beef panang was a little weak. The soup needed more tamarin. Still the lunch special was ok

0Jtxgpg_0N-I5J1Z6D8dvA.text: Well our experience was really all over the place and, honestly, I almost rated it two stars (**After writing the rest I came back and clicked the two star button, but I was originally going to give it a sympathy 3**).  Let's start by saying it was around 11:30 pm and the atmosphere was pretty cool.  It's a nice dining room with a nice feel (and open late!).  It was a Monday night (we had gone in search of Fuku, forgetting it was closed on Mondays), and Karaoke was happening.  So everything started out positively.  Our server was nice enough, but it was very inattentive service.  After a while, we ordered 3 dishes: Tom Yum Goon, Chicken Satay, and Rad Nar with chicken.  We ordered the Tom Yum "Medium" when he asked us how spicy.  We actually like spicy food, but weren't in the mood to really test our limits.  The "medium" was the spiciest Tom Yum we'd ever had (fine for me though it definitely had my nose running and gulping on my water), but my girlfriend couldn't hang and was disappointed.  Medium should have a good strong kick, and we wouldn't have minded if it was just Hot labeled medium, but this was REALLY hot.  Plus, the water was not getting refilled.  Our waiter disappeared completely during this time; eventually we were done with the soup and completely dry keeping our eyes peeled for him.  He must have been on break, because he eventually showed up with our Chicken Sate, room temperature.  Again, not completely a deal breaker-- It actually tasted pretty good and we are pretty used to Thai delivery/takeout where that's fairly par for the course.  However, one of the best things about actually going out for Thai food is that the Chicken Sate can be served absolutely piping hot.  In this case it was double fail, because not only was it room temperature, we suffered from not getting our water refilled that entire time.  Which brings me to the Rad Nar (flat noodles in gravy).  Again, I don't want to sound like a complainer, but when we order a noodle dish we want noodles.  It was strange, there was a very generous helping of the expensive ingredients beef and Chinese broccoli which I appreciate (for those of you paying attention to what we ordered and what we got, congratulations--again we like beef just fine, but come on, we ordered chicken, and when I mentioned we ordered chicken, the server just smiled and shrugged until my girlfriend said it was OK, we'd take the beef), but it was very skimpy on the noodles.  It made it a hard dish to share as we got like 3 flat noodles each.  So the meal itself was completely botched; that said, it was still pretty decent for late night Thai.  We won't be back if we find someplace better that's open at the hour, but the food itself was pretty decent/good-- even after getting everything completely wrong.    Oh and the epilogue; when we got the check the Tom Yum was marked 4-Star heat.  So that explained that.  I don't know how medium translated to that, but oh well.

J3nmt2m0MaHivfW5V00K8Q.text: spicy = good... Krung siam is spicy so by definition Krung Siam=good. But not in the man it hurts so good but I can't taste anything. Upper scale price for this cheapskate but worth the flavor. And there isnt anything wrong with $1 thai ice tea at happy hour.

aGDhNtm72GFFeNGa16-UVg.text: Really good Thai food.  When we were there for lunch, it was really empty but it was all very good food and definitely would want to go back again.

r70mom_2xqCRVvCmDs_gHg.text: The panang curry is amazing & their weekday lunch specials are great. The only thing bad about this place is the sllllooooooooowww service. Pick it up, people!!!

hBrCrPk5Oni92KqB52JJ0w.text: If you look for authentic Thai food, go else where.  We ordered seafood Tom Yum soup, which came out very bland.  The glass noodle salad also doesn't have enough flavor.  Service is mediocre.  We ordered rice with the tom yum soup which came out pretty quick.  Howeved, no one came to check to see if the rice came out.  We sat there for 25 min and my husband finally had to walk back  to the cashier to ask for the rice.  By that time, the pot got cold because the fire had gone out.  We had to ask for the waiter to add more gas to warm it up.  What a disappointment overall!

y37mhW76z0gKLjpVrY0HrQ.text: First of all, the service was terrible. I am Thai and was trying to ask about the food details in Thai language. I didn't have Thai food for long time and really craved for it. The waiter who was Thai spoke Thai back to me rudely and turned to talk to my husband in English instead! I was shocked. We ordered beef green curry and some stir fried veggie but we got chicken curry instead of beef. The food was way too sweet and 100-mile far away from real Thai food. If you're Thai or want to have a real Thai food experience, DO NOT GO THERE.

LLFWRrJknlxngFRb8KavOA.text: Great authentic food and service!! Nice atmosphere too. And open until 6am every night! (or should I say, morning) ;-)

6c_eDUdoHu0bOJs0KsslFw.text: The wife and I were running errands around town, and our path was going to take us through China Town. We had both been craving Thai food, and because we were without a computer, we had to choose a place the old fashioned way, that is, we looked to see which restaurant had the most cars outside of it. Its hard to tell in China Town because it is just strip mall after strip mall, but there seemed to be many cars in front of Krung Siam and people going inside.  When we got in, we were pleasantly surprised. The decor was very modern, and I felt like we were in an upscale Asian restaurant in Chicago or New York. Additionally, from the looks of the lights and the sound set up on the inside, this place gets hopping after dark.   We were greeted by a very young looking hostess, and actually all the staff we saw were quite young, which was just not what we are used to in this part of town. On to the food! I got the Pad See Uw with Tofu and the wife got pineapple fried rice. We also both got Thai Iced Tea. The tea was not as sweet as I've had other places, which was very nice. The spices were more prominent, and the flavor was bold, but not overpowering. My dish was amazing. I think its probably the best tofu I've had in a while. It w as fried, but not over fried and the black soy sauce filled the pores of the tofu. It was nice and firm, but not too crunchy. The noodles were also cooked perfectly. I could have eaten them by themselves. The veggies were also cooked well, not too stiff and not soggy. The wife's lunch was also very good. All the veggies and fruit was very fresh, and including raw cashews and unsweetened raisins really completed the meal. It was flavorful but not too sweet and not too salty.   The price was very reasonable. Less than at our other Thai haunts. We paid about $22 for the 2 entrees and 2 Thai teas. Not bad at all.   If I could give Krung Siam a 3.5 I would, but I will round up to a 4. I am excited to come back to this place.

6hvJ916_1IZTTcKNjL5g0Q.text: Didn't go here for the food. But to get away from drama from another Resturant. Place was pretty kewl. Just drank two bottles of sojo in the late early morning with my girl friends. Before we all headed home! More crazy karaoke happens at this spot too!!!

2yN1qkGjumXvweO1zsGbcQ.text: I decided to eat here after a night out on the town. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. They had a tiny stage were it looked like they had live bands play. The music was a bit loud but I didn't mind it too much. The service was great and I'm a person who goes through 10 glasses of water before I'm finished eating my meal. They keep coming and keeping up with us. The food was decently priced and tastes excellent. I had the red shrimp curry at a spicy level of 8. Was not spicy at all. The portions were good as well. Over all I liked my experience and will be coming again to see if I can catch a live performer of a local band :)

Sat4N_WqRglIXo4bgIJq9A.text: Great atmosphere, I havent ate anything i didnt like yet =P. Definitely go to try the "thai tea bomb" shot, one of the the best shots i've had!!

Q61DR0fl16iZf5rOYz0MjA.text: This place is a little pricey but food was better than I expected (based on ratings).  I'm asian n I love thai food so I know good Thai food.  So far, this restaurant and Lotus of Siam are my favorites.

lU4A3BKgV-oTlmx3bE-EBw.text: Krung Siam used to be my go to place for Thai food: however, the last three times I have been to this place has been nothing but disappointing!  What happened, I'm not sure but it feels like they change chef or something.   I went there for lunch on MDW ordered Pat Se-ew, my favorite dish and they informed us there is no chow- phun noodles.  WTH, really its 11:45am and you ran out of the noodles for your most popular dish?  So then I proceed to order a beef salad, and it was the saltiest dish they could have made!. Everything was drench in salt, even my tomatoes were salty!  My friend ordered pineapple fried rice and it was wet and clumpy.   My  boyfriend ordered  a bowl of tomyum soup, and that was the only dish that tasted great. Maybe they have a different chef that works during lunch hour and one at night.  When I came to Krung Siam in the past, it had always been at night, where the food tasted out of this world and the live music created such a nice ambiance.

KLD2_IWJ4JQSHDNL1DksRQ.text: Went there for lunch with a girl friend.  Arrived at 12pm, expecting the place to be emptied, but there were actually a good amount of patrons in there!  My friend's Thai, and I'm Taiwanese (yes, we are from different countries).  Anyways, this was the first time for both of us there, so we had the waiter give us some recommendations for what to order.  As soon as he told us the crab fried rice was good, we both glared at him and give him the "oh come on, do you want to just show us where the nearest panda express is?"  So after he embarrassingly apologized, and my friend started to speak Thai, he recommended something, and that was when my friend got very excited, which got me excited (although I really have no clue why).  My friend said they got some kind of squid with spicy dipping sauce, and it's really good.  So we put in the order, along with some kind of specialty beef noodle soup and an order of mixed vegetable.  In all honesty, my friend put in the order, and I was just going along for the ride!  I am the Thai food apprentice =)  When the squid was served, my jaw almost dropped! And the reason was, on the plate were two giant grilled squid.  And why my jaw dropped? Because this is the first place I've ever been to that served grilled squid like the way you find it from street carts in Asia!  The squid were grilled to perfection, slices into rings, tentacles and all!  The dipping sauce was good, and the only way I can describe it is a thick kind of spicy fish sauce. YummmmOOOOO!  The beef noodle was excellent too (after my friend mod it to the spiciness of our preference).  Its a none creamy sweet and spicy dark broth with green veggies, beef meat balls, beef tendons and steaks, and bean thread noodles.  The bowl is huuuuge, enough to serve 2 to 3.  The most mediocre thing we ordered was the stir-friend mix veggies.  Its just your everyday stir-fried mix veggies with chili peppers.  But we gotta get those veggies in somehow =)  The order was kinda small comparing to the other dishes.  For dessert, we ordered Roti (Indian pancake) with condensed milk drizzled all over.  You can never go wrong with that! We also got the fried bananas.  We were expecting it to be egg-roll wrapped then fried.  Instead, its thickly battered and fried.  The batter also had shredded coconut in it, the aroma was nice, and the taste was good, but overall just taste like banana in a giant donut hole.  If you're not into fried food, like we weren't, don't order it.  All in all, we'll definitely come back again, especially for that grilled squid!!   We heart Krung Siam!

xNBEYVIDDWeF2gkd9nNwAw.text: If I would've reviewed this place two year ago, I would've given it at least 4 stars.  I used to love this place because it offered cheap, delicious food near The Strip.  When we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg to dine on The Strip, we'd just hop on over here.  Last year, I even had my Wedding Rehearsal Dinner here because the place is fairly nice, the food is good, and it's a great bang for the buck.  Well, now I drop down to just two stars for this reason alone:  They upped the prices at least $5 per item for the exact same food, atmosphere, quality, service, etc.  Nothing about the restaurant has changed, in my eyes, except for the price.  The portions didn't change...nothing.  It irks me that a place thinks they can up their prices drastically just because they're trying to be slightly more high-end.  I think I paid something like $13 for Yellow Chicken Curry.  Something I can get for $8 at any other Thai restaurant of the same caliber elsewhere.  Service wasn't even good to make up for the increased prices.  The place was empty and I felt like we waited a little long to place our order, for the food, and to pay the check.  For this price, we could've just stayed on The Strip and dined in one of the casinos or malls.  I admit, yes, the food is still good but it doesn't warrant paying the increased prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha Kai Soup
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Chicken Curry

MhTImunIrmujXKZqbpdWgw.text: This little Thai place standing out on the corner in China Town was pretty good. Good food and good service. I'm assuming that we had good service because there was only one other table. However, in this town I have seen only one other table before and received crappy service so who knows. Regardless, our waiter was nice, friendly, and helpful. The food was good, Pad See ew was a solid B+ and the Thai barbecued chicken was good but some pieces were a little dry. We also had the Tom Kha (sp?) which was perfect just the right amount of spice and not too milky. Finally someone got it right when they ask you what kind of spicy level 1-10 and you say 6. I know it's subjective but usually restaurants either have it at a 1 or 10 no matter what number you pick. The decor and bar was nice, looks like it could be a good place for karaoke. (Bathrooms C-)

us3K5B_uJp_X2PHRGqcbgg.text: This review is for the lunch special. Most dishes are $5.99 and the food was decent. But for some reasons they only serve 1/2 of the soup in a small bowl. ( I mean literally they only fill the soup up to 1/2 of the bowl) Plus its not as advertised online...there was no salad, no egg roll that comes with the lunch special. We got half a bowl of the soup, the dish that we order and some steamed rice, that's all. Thai tea was only $1 though. I am hoping I will be getting more soup the next time! lol

KLUCF8DxG2R2BoWgMeLFUA.text: Wanted to go to Lotus of Siam, but we went here instead as a random pick. The food wasn't bad, but not great. Service was slow (I'm writing this review as we're waiting), but atmosphere was alright. Nice guy at the karaoke though.

peBm43nx_E_jvVOTWn83Dg.text: My experience was at late night dinner at midnight.  We arrived there and was immediately surprised that they turned the restaurant almost into a night club atmosphere. Dim lights with party lights, a fog machine and a DJ. The bass was really pumping through your bodies... good or bad depending how you're feeling. We were promptly seated and ordered drinks and received them almost immediately, along with our plates and utensils.  The decor of the place was really nice, actually. It was very modern for a Thai place. But besides from that, you might have to wait a long time for your dishes to come out during the late night hours. Luckily I have a patient boyfriend, so we managed to get our food. I saw another couple walk out though because they couldn't wait any longer. I don't blame them.  We waited probably about 30-45 minutes for our food, and our entrees came before our appetizer! We found this odd, but we were hungry so we just ate. - Beef Satay: This came in the middle of our entrees, but this dish in particular was worth the wait. Beautifully presented, tender with a delicious peanut sauce. My boyfriend took the cucumber to cool his mouth down when he was eating his curry ;) - Pad Thai: It started out good, with the right amount of meat ratio with tofu thrown in. However, at some point near the end (bottom of the plate) it started to taste spoiled?! I don't know how, but it did and I couldn't finish the rest of it. - Yellow Curry (Spice Level 10): My boyfriend asked for this, and don't try this if you do not have a high spice tolerant. My boyfriend wanted to be challenged, and he was sweating profusely and his face was all red. He was clinging onto his Thai Iced Tea and water like it was his best friend. But other than that, he thought it was good. Check was about $30 for the 3 dishes and 2 drinks during Happy hour. Good deal!  Overall: Dishes are kind of hit-and-miss and service is a little bit spotty. If you come during the late night hours, expect a night club atmosphere with long wait times.

5P9eTn-1G5HN0ZL_RqABgQ.text: Food was good. The male singer was good too. Everything was working out well until the female singer started singing. The happy mood we all were having suddenly turned bad. Her singing was OFF key ....  If u just have the male singer there u will have more customers who will come back!

ldsxpIqZnP4g-YCqn1DvnA.text: To finish my review the waitress name is  keety [kitty,couldn't really understand her] i was never checked on during my visit. The cool thing is they are opened till 530am so for those late nights

txPi6ZaxVSz1H0dolV__xw.text: Worst restaurant ever!!!!! Stay away!!! Horrible service!!! People are very rude that work here. Don't speak English and don't know how to run a restaurant in US. I have been to many Thai restaurant and have many friends from Thailand but have never been treated like this at a restaurant never coming back!!!!

B3SJAMAKj02H9q54o1tOQA.text: I've been coming here ever for over 4 years now and they have awesome service at night but in the morning not so much. I love this place because it's reallllly good but the many times I've been here conquer the times I actually had pretty bad service since I've found a worm in my curry and have gotten food poisoning here. Don't get me wrong it's a good place to eat if you're looking for great communication and vibe because they have singers that come in at night so it's a dinner and a show. The friendly service made me come back to be quite honest because the food is good and they way they treat you is spot on. After I found a worm in my food, they kindly offered to re-make the food for me or take it off the check. But which made me happier was that they offered to pay for my next dish free which was nice. The Rad Na was good but I think the meat was undercooked, that's why I got food poisoning.. in the end I will and forever will come back to this place it deserve a 3rd chance. If you want to find a good and a holy grail Thai restaurant I recommend this place.

aUA1yCCij17Mm2o5OUv29Q.text: This spot has been my go-to thai restaurant since I first ate here. Their menu is extensive, you won't be able to find something that you won't like. Their prices are reasonable, and they also offer a lunch special (I'm unsure of when). The Pad See Ew with tofu is my favorite, although I've never had it, my sister raves of their papaya salad. As many other thai restuarants, they offer you to chose a spice level from 1-10, and sometimes they can make something a tad too spicy, so spice with caution. They also give you little condiments to add more spcie if needed.

U4fbbkr0agqWPhboCy6gqg.text: Slow service! It took forever to get seated even if they told me the table is open but I have a to wait for it to be cleaned. Three customers behind me already got seated except for me. So disappointed! Their chicken is so tough (Panang, fried rice, and drunken noodles) It felt like a was eating a squid because of it's toughness. I only go here because of the live music. But the food is just an average Thai cuisine!

4lNBCUzTuXbF0MHhwzKXYw.text: I guess we were just lucky to come on a good day because my party and I received great service when we went.   The food also tasted great. Their yellow curry, the taste, I can still recall to this day. Their Thai iced tea may not have tasted as good as other places but I didn't mind. Our drinks were refilled on a timely manner and our server was very attentive. We didn't need to call out to him because he checked up on us without fail.   So I don't know what made our visit different from those who had a bad experience, but I'm glad we gave Krung Siam a chance.

qZuCHyPXE_bUhY5m5-IDNw.text: Came here a on a Saturday and got there 2 min before opening time. The place is more of a bar style decor. So we were the first customer (a group or 5). The food came out less than 7 minute for 5 dishes. (Sorry! no pics, bf's dad was hungry and dig in) Anyways, here the break down.....  1.) Pad thai = 2/5, about $11 or so, small portion. too sweet. noodle wasn't the right one for pad thai. 2.) Pad see you/ew? idk how to spell it properly : 3/5 (best dish out of all) cost like $10 3.) Seafood fried rice = tasteless......cost like 10 dollars or so. 1/5 4.) Krung Siam platter. I believe it was 15 DOLLARS!!! LET ME TRY TO remember....what it had....2 eggrolls, 3 crab puff, 3 wonton, 2 satay chicken....so expensive, and it didn't even taste good!! Idk, why they order it..... 1.5/6  6.) Beef Salad. Beef taste so hard and dry. Smells strong for some reason. We didn't finish that dish  Thai Tea tastes like bottled ones where u can get at the super market. hot tea is about 2 dollars and iced tea is about 2 dollars.  Wish the people who came with me didn't suggest thai food blah.  Sorry if my typing is messy. I'm typing this around 1:30 am half asleep. HAHA

yrfl98V9RmtMl1V20LF5oQ.text: I had Pad See Ew, it was good but I had frequent chewy bits of beef. Thai Tea doesn't come with free refills. Bathroom is creepy to find (took like 2 hallways to find)  I might come back for the bar and live entertainment.

rk4KSeiMEGjS7Jkzid9fgA.text: Beef salad: too salty and chewy Pineapple fried rice: too sweet Panang curry: sauce is good, but pork is chewy Small portion over all. Not recommended

KgHzoZXAMqi8Py31EznqHQ.text: Basil chicken, Tom Kai soup and spring rolls were great. However, NOBODY helping us spoke enough English to answer our simple questions and they put all of our dishes on the table at the same time so half our food got cold. We asked a waitress to bring us a plate to put over our main dish and she just never came back. Probably didn't even understand what we asked for. Meh.

52iHMHF6Ha-FWleoIlCCLQ.text: As I have never eaten Thai food I wouldn't know authentic from unauthentic, but I still know what tastes good. I order the Thai duck curry which was very good. The soup was a perfect balance of sweet coconut milk and curry flavor. Not too sweet and not too curryish. The duck was good although there was alot of skin included. My father ordered the Thai BBQ which came out fajita style  the bottom of the Cornish hen was slightly burnt due to the hot iron but the flavor was still excellent. Also the raspberry sweet tea is especially good. Overall I'd say that this was a great first Thai experience. The food great and the service excellent.

Uik3EDoFRUS7eldzH__NCg.text: Very delicious, spicy 4 was perfect.  Had veggie delight, tom yum soup and vegetable red curry.  Entertainment was an added bonus.

nsC-SJPdUMxILmzB3ZRPqg.text: My boyfriend and I used to come here from time to time since it was open late and I often crave thai food. The last experience we had would keep us from ever going back.   A few weeks back, my boyfriend and I went to have a late night dinner and a drink. Upon arrival, we waited for a table to be cleaned so that we could be seated. It wasn't at all that busy but the servers were really slow. Once we were seated, we noticed a table beside us that was still waiting to be cleaned, and probably a few others as well. Make a side note of that.   Anyway, we picked our drinks and food and awaited a waiter. We finally snagged one and asked if we could order our drinks. They had told us that someone would be able to get to us shortly. Waiting patiently, a waiter finally came by and took our order. We then waited for about a good 10-15 mins for our drinks until we asked the waiter where they were. He said he would check. Drinks finally came and I didn't particularly like them so I gave them both to my boyfriend. As he was drinking it I noticed something floating in the drink. I then grabbed my phone to use as a flashlight to see what was it was. THERE WERE 3-4 BUGS IN THE DRINK. Still kicking and moving around. DISGUSTING. The fact that we had taken a few sips from the drink itself completely appalled me. We returned BOTH the drinks and asked for a manager. The manager, who had actually made and delivered the drinks, had tried to convince us that they were seeds probably. Uhm, seeds don't have legs and there aren't seeds in the drinks that we ordered.   The manager was very apologetic and paid for one of our meals. Still unforgiving, we wrote a little note on the receipt, didn't tip, and left knowing we would never come back. Oh, and that table beside us that was never cleaned... Never got cleaned up the entire time we were there.

rCw1r71gXzMIAeN_w1VAJA.text: This place was too dark, hard to see the menu in small prints. The waiter got our orders wrong even though she repeated back to me several times. Food was okay, I've had better Thai food. The food portion size was too small for the price they charged. Will not eat here again next time I visit Vegas.

bqv32848J4H4ab86e4nVkg.text: Awesome atmosphere great food. Place is welcoming, live music, attractive staff. In the mood for Thai food in the middle of the night, this place would be it. Could get crowded at times but the wait is not long. Have a beer at the bar at wait! "nOM Nom " !

a4GQ2xkE_27NHEFXGu2veQ.text: Finally check this place out, herd great things. Bad move for lunch today and I am still feeling it. Service was very poor and the food was bad. The only possible was the Crab Rangoon Too bad this is my first review on Yelp. $89 lunch wast of money. The one star was because I had to do it.

IS0kRkDKqhN9g9jEvBwa_g.text: My coworker introduced me to this nice little place while we broke out for lunch one day. they have great lunch specials for $5.99 (sadly my favorite pad see ew is not included) and $1.00 thai iced teas and coffees. I have had the veggie pad thai and the veggie drunken noodles so far. both have been good and great portion sizes to fill me up for the rest of my work day. I get the mixed veggies and tofu, but I do hear their meat is good. they give you a small bowl of the soup of the day as an appetizer. The service has always been good and we have been their at busy lunch times. They have been on point and always eager to fill our glasses and check on us. we have decided to make this a weekly lunch trip and it is something I plan on looking forward too on those dragging work days! great pick me up with some good food.

wSYyrQPBgO_s_ieKqx1pZw.text: Wasnt really all that impressed with the pad thai noodles I ordered not to mention that for some reason they forgot to bring out my main entree and by the time i got my food i was already full on the appetizers. service was really sub par on my experience their...not sure if i will return seeing as their as a plethera of other asian restuarants in the area...

pHbLa7q-dJPIj9z1l_UrPw.text: Great house fried rice - Open 24 hours, perfect for late night - Great lunch specials at $4.99 - YES the restaurant is set up for all of the below listed ambiance - Just a mile west of the Strip at Valley View

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination fried rice Delicious!

uR0awHkBTyzGzORoLq9zKg.text: This is truly one of my favorite late night Thai spots in Vegas. The atmosphere is fantastic. The music, the service, the lighting, the pictures...all of it amazing. The place is incredibly clean too. Their Vegetarian Pad Thai is incredible. The Tom Yum soup is also really good. The prices are a few dollars more then surrounding Thai spots that are open late, but you get what you pay for and I can promise the quality of food and cleanliness of this place make it worth spending a few extra bucks.

zqbcv6AQhW4JJ-ywQDP_DQ.text: This little gem has the right mix to be on my regular rotation. Why? It's only 5 minutes from the strip, it's open super late till 6am ( hello, it's Vegas) it's got an awesome vibe, good food and free live musicians that can really perform on Thursday to Sunday nights! And be sure to tip them. That makes you a good little Yelper. Also, the food was amazing! We needed something spicy after flying in, to clear up a little jet lag, so we ordered up the Tom yum seafood, we requested an 8 on the hotness scale, 10 being the hottest. The soup comes out in an aluminum pot with flames in the middle keeping your broth that's full of fresh seafood pipping hot. We also ordered the yellow chicken curry and sticky mango rice as a dessert! So darn good...

pufkJg3zEM99rRHhE13DIA.text: We keep coming back. Casual but legit Thai and  close to the strip.  Good menu.  Full bar. Easy free parking   Like it a lot   Only thing is the live music is too loud. Sort of kills the conversation at the table .  Maybe u guys can tone it down a bit? It's a small place.

fEwZBH4JsK_J1n3yS0Ud9w.text: Worst food terrible service and was forced to listen to the worst music ever created by a live singer hired to torture our ears I could not wait to get out of here.  If there were negative stars for this review It would be warranted

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh God can the check come any faster

CLDZzRDgvb8zIaacqEAcYA.text: I've been here once the music was really loud I couldn't hear the person talking across the table from me. The food was decent though so I went there again because its the only place to get Thai food late at night we sat there for 15 minutes the lady walked by us a million times and never even acknowledged us being there I should not have to sit somewhere 15 minutes and not even get a water. We ended up walking out because it was bullshit! I won't be going back!!!

M5pa6RvMhbLjC36moYi8gA.text: Our Program was so late and we could go and eat this Thai restaurant so late. this was recommended by our people who work   in the Bar and restaurant. They have so much varieties in Spring Roll - these fresh ones were liked by my entire family. i could bring all the way   from LV to MCO..what an amazing. there was no issues. Some of the Salads they give as a side was awesome- my family loved   it. Sometimes we have to speak their language, which is tough i guess:) Just kidding. otherwise it was so late and this is   the best closest to Fairfield Inn near Mandalay resort or Dean Martin -.. Please check out-. One great thing they are open so late . I dont think anywhere you can find such thing.

nsf7LgA70etXc7gKm3XHvw.text: This place is great!  The food is delicious and good portion size.  The music goes well with the food.  I enjoyed dining here with my husband.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tum yum soup seafood ohh! Is great!
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil beef mmmm yummy!
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai loved it!

kuEMS4piSsZspooeG6xI3Q.text: 3.5 stars rounded up  Their lunch specials (M-Th or F, 11am-3pm) are the best - you can choose chicken, beef, or veggies with an entree and prices are determined by choices of meat - chicken is $5.99 and I forget the rest. Thai Iced Tea is $1.00 during their lunch special too which can't be beat.  My favorite entrees are the Pad Thai or the Drunken Noodle. Yellow curry isn't bad either.  When it's not lunch special time, entrees are pretty pricey. The pad thai and/or pad-see-ew can be at least $9.99 but they open until 4am-6am which means they are always an option to eat at.   Will recommend for lunch specials and be kept in my book

0hfQBOiM9BCJbSnrFO4ldA.text: Asked to leave!  After a nice meal including dessert, as my wife and I were still drinking our tea, not yet ready to leave but almost, our waitress asked us to leave or relocate to the bar area, and make room for a reservation. I thought this was rude and not customer friendly at all.

khMLnnGD84Yd1gm8lRJu0w.text: Pad Z u is excellent! Little bit Vietnamese style than Thai. That's why it was better than other place in Las Vegas. Service was good and pleasant. Live music in night time.

UJNbcOFxBCm7YsfcAwF4dA.text: I've been bringing friends & family alike to krung Siam for a few years now.All I can say is it's always great.The food is traditional thai,spicy,sweet,& delicious.The drink menu is a nice compliment for most of the dishes there,or if you just wanna get that after work happy hour buzz on.The service is good also,sure on Fridays you may have to wait for a while but please do.....you will not be disappointed.Also the karaoke is nice entertainment,this place has always been & always will be one of my favs!

4pKSsh-vxefMjJJauPi6dA.text: The atmosphere reminds of Firefy- dimly lit, loud music, and close seating. It was hard to have a conversation in such close quarters, but the live band kept us entertained and we shortly got our entrees after.  Drunken noodles: pick your choice of meat and spice. We got chicken in medium spice. There were plenty of bell peppers, chicken, and tomatoes...but where's the noodles? I was a little disappointed for not having enough noodles. But it was flavorful and had a perfect amount of spice and plenty of leftover meat and veggies after the noodles were gone!   Thai chicken: when the server brought it out, he poured some liquid over it to make it sizzzzle! Talk about dinner and show! And it came with two dipping sauces, one was a sweet chili sauce and the other had a spicy/fish sauce/lime taste to it. The chicken was juicy and tasty by itself! But the sauces did elevate the flavors and give it that Thai twist!   Spring rolls: I didn't realize they weren't the fresh kind. It was the fried egg rolls filled with noodles and vegetables. It also came with a delicious dipping sauce that was different from the sweet chili sauce given to us with the chicken. It was my favorite of the three sauces we got! They also cut the spring rolls in half, but they're as big as normal sized eggs rolls.   I love how they're open late and not too far from the strip. Great place to grab food after work. And I did see a beer tower advertised for $18 all day! A lot of people ordered pad thai and fried rice when I went, so I'm gonna go back and give that a try!

iN8G48xJeNddSUUY60xUcQ.text: I love this restaurant and it's a vegan/vegetarian heaven!!!! My favorite is fresh spring roll, Tom Kha (coconut milk) soup, any entrees with Tofu (especially spicy eggplant and spicy basil.) I highly recommend anyone who would like to eat healthier to substitute their usual meat options for tofu...it's very satisfying and very much tasty! Oh, and I cannot forget to mention my favorite young coconut drink, which comes in the shell and very fresh, for only $4!!!! The ambience is modern and hip though very comfortable and all their staff are very nice and friendly.  Sometimes, there is live entertainment going on, usually with the guitarist who has a great voice, and every now and then, your server might even go up on the stage and start singing! Lastly, it is just an awesome late night spot for the night owls like myself...and did I mention the food is yummy here?!!

Xe2Z1vG7MmvTjpQEe1CH2g.text: Food is always excellent and the service is very good. We come here very often and always enjoy the ambiance. I probably would have scored this a five star. However, I'm not happy about having only one unisex bathroom is disappointing.  Re-opening the men's restroom would help tremendously.

jE_GmMDp7FWr3e6PuC_hmQ.text: After partying in Vegas, food always sounds good.  Actually, food is always good.  We were craving Thai and one of my good friends from the area suggested this since it's open late and not too far from the strip.  I ordered the Thai BBQ chicken.  My gf got the Panang Curry.  My friend got this pork belly dish sauteed in some Chinese broccoli.  The Thai BBQ chicken comes on a sizzling plate.  The server then adds some liquid to the plate and the plate flames up.  It's a pretty cool sight to see.  And my chicken was piping hot throughout my entire meal, which is always good.  Cold chicken isn't always the tastiest, right?  The Panang Curry with chicken at Level 7 spice was really good.  Spicy food after some drinks hits the spot.  Level 7 can be a bit too spicy for others, but it was bearable.  Would definitely get this.  The Sauteed Pork Belly with Chinese Broccoli was so good.  The pork belly was crispy and flavorful.  The sauce it was in was just right and didn't make the pork belly all soggy.  For some reason, it's dark in here.  One could definitely have trouble eating in the dark.  Okay, not really, but it is pretty dark in here.  There's also karaoke.  And a full bar.  Another table even ordered a whole bottle of liquor to go with their food.  Better than the thousands people drop for a bottle at the clubs in Vegas, right?  Ha.  Good place for some food for sure.

6RsicfsYkHvCmL4SeqY8LA.text: Out late and want something besides steggs?? Tired of waiting in those long lines when all you want to do is grab a nice late night dinner? Okay, lets skip all the ridiculous intros and get into this review  This place was really appealing to me for some odd reason.  A cool mechanical waterfall when you enter the restaurant, dimly lit, neon everywhere, a stage for live music and waitresses walking around with bunny ears? Definitely a place different from where I normally eat at but I do enjoy the charm.   Service: Was absolutely great!  The guy we had was very cordial, made sure our glasses were always full (big plus) and was very pleasant.  Towards the end of our meal, the manager took our leftovers and personally placed them into individual boxes (YES!).   Food: The sauce that accompanies a lot of the dishes I got the spring rolls which were perfectly crunchy and flaky without destroying the contents.  The drunken noodles were a yelp favorite? but really wasn't that great.  It was like a 80:20 ratio of vegetables/meat to noodles and the noodles were more like sheets.  The Thai BBQ chicken gets  flambed which is pretty freaking cool but make sure you move the chicken off the plate and onto your plate or else it'll burn the bottom.  The fried rice and pad thai looked good so i'll definitely will get those next time.   Music: We had a guy playing a guitar while we were eating which was pretty charming.    Overall: Great place to eat whether it be afternoon or late night.

q4Zr8bHspal0oCmcS28hww.text: They deliver. In vegas. to your room. Well practically.  The guy went to the elevators and waited for me to get the piping hot Drunken Noodles and spicy pork basil and angel wings. It was $30 incuding the $2 delivery fee and left my belly nice and full with enough grease to soak up the liquor.  The wings were a little on the sweet side for my liking but the rest of the food was particulary tasty and HOT (temperature and spice - but bc I asked for it to be)

zOZqD2ZJUV1LrM3g0OIUtg.text: This place has some good food. Nothing exceptional. I went for lunch and tried the red curry. It has good flavor, but very watery.  I do like that lunch comes with a small soup and a small salad. Both of those were very fresh and flavorful as well. Service was good, and attentive. Everyone walking by asked how I was doing. Place was't busy, so that probably helps.   The reason I only gave 3 stars and not 4, was the Christmas music was very loud. It just wasn't a pleasant, relaxing environment. When people go out to eat, atmosphere is always a concern.

8hrZa6DVSRz96UZLk3s6Jw.text: One of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas! It's clean, the service is great and the atmosphere is nice! The food was fresh and delicious. My go to place for a great Thai dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh spring roll
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea

ZDftnFcOuTQkHaJMN7-z7g.text: Booked order online for delivery. And I ordered my drunken noodle with chicken and shrimp. However when the food arrives, there is only shrimp.   I think for delivery order the restaurant should always double check with the order.

_uZE92wm10ejyxNA2-oC2Q.text: Talk about a hug disappointment to come here.  I started with young coconut and the coconut was old and the coconut food was yellowish.  The crab fried rice. I could've made some better at home.  I will not be trying anything else from this place.  The only reason I gave it a try was cause I knew a friend that used to work here and it was 1 am in the morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab fried rice.

Uwj25m7094Zj2OM7xfi-Pw.text: I absolutely love this place! The service is always great! Food is it always fresh and delicious. Most restaurants get very crowded on busy nights, but this place is perfect! It has a great open floor plan for my husband who's in a wheelchair and there's plenty of room between tables.   I love the music they play and the atmosphere. If you like Thai food, I definitely recommend this place. By the way the peanut sauce is the best in town and they are open late as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tum Ka

hmxGMKb_9Chmy3OAbCBlPg.text: When craving for a great pad see ew, this is my go-to-place. You actually have the option to choose the meat, I like the ground pork on it. Located in Chinatown Vegas and parking is a breeze. They offer a wide variety of cocktails as well. This restaurant is perfect for big groups and get-togethers.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZsCxON9JIN-o6TgLkxdPw.text: Fantastic place, and I highly recommend the Green Curry w/ Chicken. Extremely tasty, the veggies are fresh, and the curry has just the right taste.  Arroy Dii Thi Sut! (The Most Delicious!)

g0avZRVZzuOvou0xkvnELw.text: For people visiting Las Vegas, please do not eat Asian food (any food for that matter) in the casinos. They are terrible and extremely expensive. You need to eat at the Asian restaurants in Las Vegas China Town (located on Spring Mountain Road on the west side of the 15 freeway). Here, you will find tons of Asian tasty cuisines like this restaurant.   It is located in a strip mall like the other restaurants. The waiters and waitresses are young and hip. The atmosphere is fun. The food is ample and comparatively inexpensive considering that it is in Las Vegas.

zoM38SsA8kBEZgpnMc60dQ.text: Great friendly staffs and latenight party spot, right in the heart of China Town, Food is always fresh and hot!

3jDn64ozjLjilwFRTab5Jw.text: Seems like the last time I was here, they made some renovations ! The restaurant isn't oddly dark anymore and it feels more open.   This recent visit, I got the Red Curry lunch special which came with a small soup, crispy eggroll and a side of rice with my meal. Overall, it was so good. The thai tea was a bit milky for me, so I had to add some water to mine, but everyone makes it differently.   Very happy, this past visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry with rice for the lunch special
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy eggroll and soup that comes with the lunch special

bNF-mtSuPLsyQSShNBExGg.text: The food is good but I live in Connecticut,We have better Thai restaurant here than this one and  our local Thai has much much better service tho.

qsDBVkEEbyobXWA28HNUSw.text: This Thai restaurant is across from a SIMILAR sounding Thai restaurant, Kung Fu Thai and Chinese. Krung and Kung. Only difference? At least there was PLENTY of parking at this plaza.  Super fast and efficient service. LITERALLY 3 waiters helped us in our time there. One seated us down and gave us the menus. One changed the TV channel for us to enjoy a basketball game. And one used BRAIN POWER to MEMORIZE our orders. FYI, we ordered 7 dishes.   If you're a visual person (like me), you came to the right place! They give you an iPad to view the pictures of all of their dishes. Pretty cool, huh?   There's even a bar and mini DJ, but we didn't come on the right day to see a live DJ performance...   Food was GOOD, but EXPENSIVE. The waiter will let you pick your level of spiciness from 1-10 (1 = Not spicy, 10 = SPICY SPICY). Please don't pick level 3 spicy. The spicy-loving people couldn't even handle it. If level 3 was too spicy for my party, wonder how spicy level 10 is...
