fBsJdZaXyTxsDz8BKR3TdQ.text: We came in around close to 2 pm and the Resturant was mostly empty. We ordered chicken satay, mix seafood Tom yum, Penang curry chicken, pad see you, and pad Thai. The chicken was really dry and flavorless. Our server was attentive but the food was mediocre. On top of that, the cashier charged us dinner prices. They corrected it but still. I don't think we will be back.

Qmr_qGh3oTCuTVRAwdo9GQ.text: Now this place makes the best lao papaya for a Thai place that's open super late in china town  They have a $25 thum lao platter and it's pretty bomb!  Their food was pretty good in general a little pricy for this place but it was workth it  The rad na was super bomb  Boat noodle was really good too  The beef jerky was super good  They also have fresh coconut

VfUjoueCCEV8JW_mXe-lSA.text: Good food n nice place. But now they put gratuity to all the tables. we were 3 people n the gratuity was included. Just check so u dont leave extra.

IZaTZZVD7pg7bzPHzRnDUg.text: We love this little place and visit every time we come to Vegas. The food is delicious, the service is great and price is reasonable.

50JT8JE5eCSUmTGAH009pA.text: Came here after a long day at the strip and just wanted something loca and fresh! This place was soo good and the service even better!!! Joe and Lisa took care of us and made us feel right at home. They were very nice and so hospitable. Chill environment and easy parking, clean bathrooms. Great food, better company. Will definitely come back here each time we visit Vegas!! Can't say enough nice things about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Joe and Lisa taking good care of us thank you guys so much for the excellent customer service!! Excellent way to end our visit to Vegas :)

JS2tCM-pqkG6qIDM2fTftg.text: I love this restaurant. Great vegan options. My fav is the basil Thai dish they also do Karaoke which is super fun. Open very late.

lfVbhSYBYDApOPd7_D2w0w.text: I decided to stop by here one night as I was spontaneously craving Thai food, and I must say I really enjoyed my time eating here. My waitress was very kind and made me feel welcome. Also, the ambiance was a relaxing touch; the decor inside is quite modernized.   I ordered the Drunken Noodle with seafood, as well as the Kao Man Kai, which my waitress recommended. The Drunken Noodle was very delicious; it was flavorful, the seafood was juicy and I thoroughly enjoyed every bite. Every ingredient belonged in the dish, and I would gladly eat it again.   The Kao Man Kai, a chicken dish served with rice and a warm broth, was also a very strong dish. My only criticism was that the chicken was maybe a bit too dry, though the broth certainly helped wash it down. The rice, as simple as it was, complimented the chicken and broth very well; I was impressed by the presentation of the plating. Very tasteful all-around.   I highly recommend this restaurant for those who are big fans of Thai food. It is a very worthwhile place to dine out and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Kao Man Kai, a chicken dish served with white rice, red chili sauce and a warm chicken broth. It&#39;s very appetizing and tasteful.

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Drunken Noodle with seafood. As you can see, the noodles are nice and big, which I enjoy. The shrimp was very delish as well.

Uf2OZ_UlsKsIsbjzYknQ3Q.text: I love the papaya salad here so much that i have to order second dish to satisfied my craving....highly recommends

BpIM9I4v6Ojwxsd-FMdnRA.text: While going through Chinatown today we thought we'd stop by for lunch.  Just a stone's throw from The Strip on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View, Krung Siam is a hip and cozy place in bustling Chinatown.   We enjoyed: . Thai Beef Jerky - Deep fried with a spicy chili sauce; . Spring Rolls - Very light and crispy rolls filled with noodles, black mushrooms and assorted vegetables;  . Green Chicken Curry (spice level 5) - A rich and delicious curry of coconut milk, peas and carrots, bamboo shoots, and tender chicken served with jasmine rice.  Cool atmosphere, a polite and attentive staff, and very reasonable prices, Krung Siam is a great place in Las Vegas for authentic Thai food. Locals and tourists, I promise you won't be disappointed!

rcCpkz7Djte2nKPVXC8dvw.text: Good Food.  I had the yellow curry with seafood.  Pretty good.  I want to try some other dishes like the prawn and chicken wings my friend had.  They said it was really good.

L5vTCwsr1CwjhN2irvpLHg.text: I end up in Vegas once a year for a convention...  Star Trek convention, don't judge me! There are a couple of places that I make sure I visit when I'm there and this is at the top of the list.   I love spicy food and on their 1-10 scale you're taking your life in your hands at anything above a 6, but even if you go really spicy you still taste the food. I've never been disappointed in anything I've had here, I can speak only of noodle and beef and chicken dishes but others in my group have spoken well of other dishes. It's not too pricey I think our last bill was around $60 plus tip which is good for 4 people.   One more thing I wanted to point out,  on nights we were there there has been times where a guy that rocks the easy listening tunes with an acoustic guitar entertains the crowd and I love it.

HmdcXg4i1_STQvibqpkCiQ.text: Was not worth what I paid for. Green curry with tofu $10.99. tofu was fried and soggy, I would have preferred fresh and firm. It consisted of tofu, bamboo shoots, diced carrots, peas, rice and and a very light green curry broth. It would not surprise me if the the peas and carrots were canned, it was a simple dish. I would have given a better review if the curry cost a few dollars less. Not much taste and soggy tofu. The mango and sticky rice is a large portion for $7.99, but It definitely didn't need a rotten mint leaf garnish. The mango was good and there was a lot of it. Good points- it has great ambience, entertainment, and is very clean. It just seems that food quality and fresh ingredients are not a top priority at Krung Siam. $20 before tip for green curry and a mango sticky rice dessert.  Strike one for me.

R1TAkFSZq6caAlKyzc_cSA.text: I believe that good food should massage the palate, please the tongue, and warm the soul.  I got all of that in my meal at Krung Siam. Was it the best curry that I've ever had? Almost. Mix Zone Three Color FTW!  I popped in here for a quick lunch, only because I saw a sign that said $4.99 lunch special. I figured, why not.  I took one star off from this review for two reasons (and these can easily be remedied):  1. I was not offered water until several minutes. It's 113 degrees outside. I was jonesin for a glass.  2. The lunch special includes the soup of the day, and they ran out by 2pm (lunch ends at 3).   I ordered the Panang Curry with Shrimp (a dollar more than the special price).  The curry was flavorful, and the portions were appropriate for lunch. The menu is pretty diverse, and you have lots of great options. When I come back, I'll explore.  The ambiance is pretty cool. Dark, nicely air-conditioned, and clean. The place seems fairly new. Flat screen TV's and sparkly christmas lights fall from the ceiling.  There is a stage, where they seem to have karaoke and other forms of live entertainment. Decent Happy Hour. Half off drinks from 3-7 M-F.  One last note...this place is open until 4am. Might be a good spot for late night post-club grub. Just a thought.  In summary? Good spot. Possibly great.

DvA9zGyufnrkYwUzou53wg.text: Great happy hour between 4-6. Great food! I recommend the Penang Curry chicken w/brown rice and peanut sauce. Staff is always friendly. Food always comes out fast. They have a stage set up , although I've never seen anyone perform. Still is always a pleasant experience when I go.

iE-FArCdcZj7rTmXeKNp1g.text: This place is awesome. It has a modern and cultural vibe to it. The food was amazing! I recommend to go for lunch because they always have good deals. Thai tea is only a $1! yummyy

8bOvL3EBzgUaG4_KeORc9A.text: Egg plant with Tofu at lunch hour = DELICIOUS & CHEAP  Mango with Sticky Rice = SWEET, SAVORY AND PRICEY  Servers = NOT VERY GOOD, PERHAPS MORE TRAINING NEEDED OR HAVE SOME PASSION IN THEIR WORK

JfdWnANul-QsrBfCLJhqdw.text: This is a perfectly satisfactory Thai joint, maybe even a cut above. They do up curry, soups, and drunken noodles in a pleasing fashion. Much like many Asian restaurants, their lunch specials are ridiculously affordable (I believe $5.99 for a small soup and entree). Unfortunately, the service is akin to most of its Asian brethren as well. Which is to say, it is very hit, miss, or indifferent. Krung steps up the decor more than most plain jane Asian joints, which is a welcoming edition. Overall, if you want a satisfying Thai experience that is easy on the wallet (especially during lunch), give Krung Siam a whirl. And tell them Judas sent you! (That will probably give you the same indifferent response than if you told them, "Never fake the funk on a nasty dunk.")

uUVlg8UvXCJGH7zV3FBzEg.text: Came here with a friend of mine and her family. There were a few other tables there but all 4 waitstaff was waiting on us. Course there were 9 of us so it took a bit to get situated with seating, water, baby chair, etc. Service was great! They kept coming by for our empty dishes, water was continually refilled. Maybe it helped that everyone spoke Thai?   All if their food was good but I really liked their peanut noodle salad. Next time in I come to Vegas, I'll be sure to return here!

5VvpFSuy-eoORNIzMp9AYw.text: Food was delicious and promptly served. We ordered the sampler, it was delicious. I ordered the pad-see-ew with beef, it was delicious. My girlfriend ordered the yellow curry, it was delicious and packed a real punch of flavor. I have no complaints.

8E8XafMkOBIVm2l63Ux2mA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!  There hasn't been a time I've gone to Vegas in the past two years (and I go a lot) that I haven't eaten here. The food is always so tasty and the service is great. They're always refilling my beverage cups whenever it's getting low and the amount of food is decent. For being near the strip (somewhat) it's not bad for the prices. I love their Pad Thai and their Panang Curry. Both very good and they're not stingy w/ the meats that they put in them. The Beef Jerky is good and flavorful. The Larb is so good, but I've yet to find  a Thai place where its not. I wasn't a fan of their sticky rice, but hey every restaurant has it's downfalls. One thing that I loved about this place and it wasn't on the menu was that I was really craving Duck Noodle Soup and saw they served duck on the menu, they made it for me when I asked for it and that was just the cherry on top! Other than that I like this place and would definitely return.  It has a dark setting on the inside, is open late and sometimes they have live music.

L5hixxryIEkSuENeymOl1A.text: The worst thai food place I've been to. Don't waste your time here! Pad thai was bland and cashew nut chicken was extremely disgusting. It's a very small portion and pretty expensive for it. Servers were rude and they never asked about our food. Spicy hot wings made me want to commit suicide with their mighty garlic chunks and sweet sauce just thrown on top. We asked for extra napkins and they litterally gave us ONE. Had to beg for a refill and to get the check. We should of walked out ... And I wouldn't regret it not one bit. Worst $39 spent !

0loVd2m3rR0x5fXpbOSX_Q.text: This is the ideal place to eat after a night of partying.  The vast selection of mouthwatering asian dishes for very reasonable prices come in large portions.   Their boba drinks are also amazing.  The staff is quick to take your order and you get your food right away.   They are now open 24 hours.

yrNjpOKWOWdDu_GUU-dTiw.text: This place has some of the best Thai food I've ever had in the US. A little dismayed to learn about the roach problem...but the place seemed clean the two times I've been there. I'm very picky about Thai food and the food here just tastes awesome. My favs: Tom yum khai, Panang curry and another dish I can't recall the name.

QzdHtq-v0BxvwSMKxOWsog.text: Okay I never give a bad review but this time I have to due to VERY VERY BAD SERVICE.   So my coworkers and I came down here for our lunch break, walk in, it's a little busy was a nice clean restaurant. While we were standing waiting for someone to seat us, servers just pass us by not saying a word to us. We waited for about 10 minutes and still no one approached us so my coworker goes to the bar and tells them. Then a guy grabs the menus and just starts walking (keep in mind he doesn't even say a damn word to us) so we followed because he must be seating us. 10 minutes pass by and still no one to take our orders (I would of walked right out but we were on lunch and very hungry). So in order for us to order we had to get up and give them our order while not once did they come to get our order or even check up on us. So we asked the person at the bar who is our server and it was a young lady! We were so pissed off because here she goes to the table next to us who just got seated and she already gets their orders, then she looks at us and walks away doesn't even say hi or have you been helped. Anyway, with that being said it took about 40 minutes for our food to come out....our lunch was ruined had to go back to work by the time we got our food.   The food is good and not bad for $4.99 lunch special and $1.00 Thai tea!   Very very bad service and I am probably not the only one that experienced it because there were a bunch of angry people that just walked out. For example: there were two guys having lunch and oh my were they mad because apparently they forgot the other guys order and only brought one order out. They just walked out without paying! Hey I don't blame them because I would have done the same thing!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special beef pad Thai

ROFPiNky-7w9zyYrOy_SDA.text: i was reluctant to try this place because of the reviews, but a friend of mine told me that it's good so i went for it. Green curry with duck. to put it simply, this is THUS FAR, the best green curry i have ever had with duck. SO flavorful. my order was a to go order and they DID give me the things that a to go order needs to have, the ONLY reason why i didn't give them 5 stars is because the rice container wasn't packed in like everyone else does. the order cost $17 but man o man, that was some good stuff. my advice, DON'T pay attention to the bad reviews, this place is good. i'll be back fo shizzle.

-d2DvdpJxVImwnHwi7K-Iw.text: We were hungry and decided to grab some Thai food on the way back from Red Rock Canyon.  It wasn't too crowded but filled up after we got seated.  They had a singer that night and he lent a nice touch to dinner; we declined to be seated next to the stage as it would've been uncomfortably loud.   Can't say it was the best or most authentic Thai I have had - but service was good, portions were fair but I thought prices were high for the the food we got.  They also have a bar area but we didn't imbibe that evening.

2wAQR14-0OYodH8a3EjBzQ.text: Had dinner here the night before. Wasnt really crowded and it looks as if karaoke was on the agenda for the night.  The menu is a bit limited, at least in my opinion, for a thai restaurant. The pricing and limited menu didnt look like it would play well with conventional asian family style communitive dinner.  The beef salad was by far the best tasting item we ordered during this meal. It was nicely seasoned and grilled to order so it had that fresh off the grill smokey, concentrated, burnt taste.   Krung Siam platter is...quite...insulting to be honest. 13 hard earned dollars for two of everything:   Two satays one chicken one beef both lacking the fresh off the grill smokey flavor, seems more like broiled, chicken was overly dry. Sauces were there obviously to cover up this fact.  Spring rolls: more like miniature egg rolls with bland tasteless filling. Another excuse to show off the sauces or serve something deep fried, or both.  Fried Battered Shrimp: tasteless with more deep fried flavor then shrimp flavor. Might as well deep fry presoaked and reshapened cardboard if you have a deep fry fetish be a lot cheaper too  Thai Dumplings: Best thing on the plate but seriously not thai. Not even close unless Dim Sum started in Thailand and the Chinese came, knocked out the Thai, stole their food and the Thai woke up and completely forgot about it.  Crab Ragoons: Again i have a problem with this. Crab implies fresh crab, a little guy with two pinchers, a bunch of claws and sweet sweet meat. Krab is a biproduct of liquefied, reshapened, reseasoned and food colored crap (yes crap not krap). Anyway no surprise here it had a heavily deep fried taste, very little texture from the Krab, lots and lots of cream cheese. Here's an idea why not just bread and deep fry cream cheese?  Okay enough of that lets move on to the main courses: Panang Curry Quite nice. Ordered mild and everything was nice, flavorful, and mellow until i started fishing pieces off the bottom. Diced up chilis were waiting for me leaving my mouth burning and attempting to chill the flames with the coconut/peanut sauce from the sampler.  Beef Fried Rice Yeah we can call epic fail on this one. Your basic very very dry not seasoned very well, wth is wrong with this beef it's colorless and tasteless fried rice.  The last complaint is the insulting price to food ratio. the sampler was 13.99 with only 7.99 worth of food. Both the rice and the curry were a decent size for one person but not filling.  Overall i can only give this place three stars. It's just too much money for too little food. This would be a place to take a date but not a place for serious eating

096h3tsWx-vMNTqWoShGaA.text: It was fine. The food was OK but I've certainly had better and fresher Thai food elsewhere. I would not go back.

bqkXWhb7oKLNCFQTBtsbEA.text: Nice little restaurant- the decor was cute and the lounge music on a Saturday afternoon made for some nice ambiance. The service was friendly and attentive. The fresh spring rolls were tasty. Chicken curry was not all that tasty. The potatoes were still pretty hard and the chicken had a lot of gristle. The beef pad see ew was really salty. I think Archi's is still my favorite Thai place.

lhTrq-1iK3D_big4R0keNw.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE. Open Late night, fast service, friendly staff. BEST Curry in town and great location. Definitely my late night go-to Spot.

o23piLOoZR-Ba0JVcDRhGA.text: Fantastic food, slow service.  Very accommodating to first time thai diners like myself.

WsNfD1PAfPV5FCD7RxmAfA.text: Wanted to try a new Thai place and ended up here with a friend.  The restaurant is in China Town.  It was an afternoon, maybe around 2:00 so not rush hour lunch but there were not a lot of people eating in the restaurant.   I ordered Thai Basil which sounded great to me but when I got it I discovered red peppers in it which I do not like at all. I love Chili's and spicy food but I can't eat red peppers.  I am not sure if that is written in the description on the menu but I didn't notice it and when the food came....I could not eat it do to the red peppers.  I tried to push it off on my friend who told me he's not a fan either of peppers.   So, he got the pad thai and I tasted it and decided to order the same thing.  The server/waitress never asked if anything was wrong with the dish that we weren't eating.  We never mentioned it either.   Personally, it seems the staff probably should have at least noticed that one appetizer and 2 entrees were ordered for 2 ppl and then a 3rd entree ordered with one not ever touched.    Anyway, the food was not bad, pretty tasty. I would not go out of my way to return however...

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Basil.  Has red and green peppers in it

BRIgJlhM_yGNOEswG6bGDw.text: Delicious food. I love coming here. The food is fresh, authentic, and presentation amazing! The service is awesome. Girls are so seeet here.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

whKUkKGpsmOs1L49VduG4w.text: Yo, I just ate here and it fucked my stomach. I have the shits and literally sitting on the shitter as I write this.

uIk5uTfwE5KyZkSVRMs7Pg.text: If you're seeing a theme in my Yelp reviews, I tend to gravitate towards Thai restaurants. The last time we came to Chinatown, we chose a different Thai place, and decided to come back and knock Krung Siam off the list.  Very glad we did.  It was packed but we were seated promptly.  I didn't see my favorite dish (Pad Prik King) on the menu, so I asked them if they had it.  They did!  It hadn't made it to the menu yet, but it was available for order.  So glad I asked.    Food, service, atmosphere, wine list, all 4 stars.  I'm very happy we finally checked this place out, especially given there are a couple other Thai restaurants in town that we already love to frequent.  Now, Krung Siam is in the rotation.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qlmWmiBPCWIKkgb10hcQlw.text: Me and my family were actually planning on going to another Thai restaurant but saw this one on the way and decided to stop by. Let me just say that was the best decision we made. The pad Thai with beef was delicious. The Panang curry is something to try if you like spicy food. The customer service was excellent and the prices were reasonable.

7CmaxlApw_WdFMIvxWp-xQ.text: Thai food off the strip. Where the thai families get their grub on.  Some of the spicy dishes are pretttyyyyyy darn spicy, no joke.  Service is awesome, they're always refilling your water.   Came with my friend's huge family/relative group for dinner. Has to be legit if out of all the Thai restaurants, this is their choice off the strip to eat at. Everything tasted decent, nothing stood out too great except the spiciness of the noodle dish.

fCrHT9_HuFUUf4obXK2PKg.text: This place was just ok. Not amazing, not aweful, but just ok. I came in for a quick lunch with my dad and the sign stated that the week of Christmas and New Years, they didn't have lunch specials, which was the main reason we came. Both of us were freaking starving, so we just decided to stay.  We pretty much got there right when they opened so service was good. They were pretty attentive and kept refilling our drinks. That's a good sign. Now on to the food.  Crab rangoons This is one of my favorite things to order for an appetizer. I was really disappointed. We were the first ones in the restaurant so I expected them to come out hot and fresh. Nope, these were just warm like they were  made 20 mins before and just sitting. When I opened one, you could see how greasy it was.   Chicken panang I enjoyed this dish a lot. Big chunks of chicken and chunks of bell peppers. It was really good, like what panang is supposed to taste like, but the portion was really small for the $10 price. I could have just eaten that myself.   Beef larb I'm not a fan of their version. Instead of using chopped pieces of beef, they used ground beef. They use cabbage instead of lettuce like I'm used to at other places. To me this dish reminded me of another Filipino dish called papaitan (spelling?). For anyone who knows who that is, you know that distinct taste I'm talking about. Not really pleasant in Thai food.   Overall, I had a decent experience here. I'd come here if someone else was paying, but I'll stick to other Thai places around town.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab rangoon
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef larb
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken panang

LExN3q6MFkqMwiyJzDh9-g.text: Hello krung Siam!! What a gem! Shrimp Tom yum is huge and we ordered a small - so good ... Sticky rice , tofu vegetable panang ,crab Rangoon, AND great service!! I'm in heaven ladies and gentlemen - also, they're open till 5 am so it's good late night dining

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu and vegetable panang

1fpZPITtXxLCghuqCLir1A.text: Bomb! My food was too spicy but my fault. If your spice level capacity ends at hot cheetos, level 4 is too spicy. Could not stop eating the food though. Fire!

oD4Uy6qXw4VLZmy3Q5jEKg.text: Very bad service. Natdanai is the worst server ever. He messed up on my order and didn't do anything to try and make it right. He gave me Roast Duck Curry and that's not what I ordered. He should be fired for bad customer service.

Q19z9SlPXhaTcLRNz_NpGQ.text: Really good Thai food! Everything is fresh. My boyfriend and I always come here anytime we come out to Vegas. I love their Pad Thai and Papaya Salad. I ordered it at a spicy level 1 and it was pretty spicy for a 1. Very friendly staff.

-e4PKV3BoL6Wh3NikAmNLA.text: Food is phenomenal!! Atmosphere is perfect and dark lit.  The live music is amazing!       Alex is the singers name and he sounds like someone that should be on the radio.      Service is always impeccable and beverages always stay full.  The Thai beef salad is to die for!!

q0TccdV5QMP0WfwtshJfUA.text: We come here every time we are in Vegas. Not coming back ever again. It wasn't as good from last time. This time is worse. Menu changed and prices increased. Looks like changed owner too.   $15.99 BBQ chicken smell bad, very dry and tasted like cardboard. They must of used old cooking oil to cook it as well.   Beef on the Pad Thai (served in a bowl?!) and drunken noodles was dry and can't even chew the beef.   Chicken on the yellow curry was also dry and bland.   I specifically asked "NOT" to overcook the meat too. Everything turned out opposite.   Spicy eggplant with shrimp (additional $4) was the only thing that was decent.   There were 2 waiters and 3 waitresses but it was tough to get their attention for anything when there were only 3-4 tables with customers during dinner time (6pm). Poor customer service.  My family is very disappointed.

JLeX9N7JaqdwcxIRWG4jdg.text: The food here is excellent and the live music is a nice touch. I come here often and have tried many of the dishes and everything I have tried has been delicious.

q7YqIOgyRwDLvw8youBM6g.text: Yellow Curry with chicken was good. Thai ice coffee delicious. Live solo entertainment which reminded me of Chiang Mai circa 1986. Total cost appx $18.00.  I will be back.

ZRvgCifKwoEsHDcHU_yqtw.text: I got food poisoning from the chicken satay. This was two nights ago and I'm Just now feeling better. I just wanted to make the owners aware that their chicken is spoiled and should be discarded. It cost me to miss the main event of the World Series because of it.

REVEwFTKIjXhGmN4WYPfmg.text: I ordered one of the chef's special, Roasted Duck Curry which was horrible so I had to send it back soon after I took a bite.   Ended up ordering the Green Curry which was good.   I give it a 4.0 for food and 3.0 for ambiance and service.   The atmosphere is very dark. You cannot read the menu or see what you're eating.   Music (hip hop and not Thai) is loud so it's difficult to have a conversation.   Wine menu is limited. Bartender is a Thai girl. Doesn't have a smile or know much about wine.

ujtlKqQc5VHN90zhppnGNw.text: I was visiting Vegas and craved Thai food before my bus ride back home! I wanted to call in to order my food so by the time I arrived the food would be ready since I was on a time crisis! The lady on the phone said the restaurant was busy but said that's not a problem! We arrived and the place only had two tables being occupied so I'm not exactly sure what her definition of busy is! But overall the food was goooood, the service was friendly! Atmosphere is dark and they have a live band! The bathroom is a bit scary! Overall not too bad and the food was good and tasty! This place also opens really late with a bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad Thai and chicken pat see you

jQyooXBbAGKI9iWI2BHUaA.text: We loved this place a lot! Authentic and delicious tai food, live music, very pleasant prices, and friendly personnel. We got thai pod soup and drunken noodle, both were delicious! Special note about their singer (asian man in glasses, didn't get to know the name), he was very good, nice song selection, definitely added to our positive experience. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live music make our dinner very cozy and romantic.

JRZNwsY7a6R8KB43rsFnHA.text: This place has the best tasting food i have had in Vegas.  The only reason i am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because they were recently closed by the health department.  A look to the public health website shows they have bad a rocky past with being able to get A ratings.. even sometimes getting Cs.    It worries me quite a bit about their food safety so I'm not sure if i will be returning.   It's just not worth getting food poisoning.  The food really does taste amazing though.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This shows every time they have been inspected by the Health Department. Public info.

YFjaZhRVDhTlUu31rennpQ.text: My first semi-adventurous food was Thai food (aside from Sushi and Chinese food as a kid) about 10 years ago at a tiny hole in the wall place in the middle of Long Beach. Thai is now one of my favorite go to places, and I always order the same thing: Tom Yum soup, Pat See Eww (can't spell these right), combo fried rice and a Thai tea to wash it all down. Although none of the places I've been to (hundreds) have come close to that first place, this is pretty close.   I've now been coming here religiously since 2012. They've changed it up quite a bit over the years but the food is always on point and the customer service always exceeds expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DcBIGjlZmMRX-Nd_0p2_kg.text: I was visiting my sister in Vegas last nite, and she recommended we come here for dinner. After looking at reviews I was expecting bad service, but the service actually ended up being pretty good. The problem was the food. I ordered the Pad Thai noodles with Tofu and my sister got the Curry Shrimp. We also shared a cucumber salad. The prices were okay and the place looked nice.  But they had very loud customers there that acted as if they owned the place. But the worst part and the reason I am giving it 2 stars is because the food got me sick. I even had some leftovers thinking my upset stomach could have been from something else. But as soon as I touched the leftover, I felt bad immediately so I threw the leftovers away.  Not sure if the food is not fresh or what but I cannot recommend this place, unless you want to get sick. Good service is the only thing keeping this place from receiving a 1 star review.

tgI4VKJemuUtqlXtazjkew.text: I have been eating at Krung Siam for few years now and I like their food, my favorite dish is crispy pork with Chinese broccoli ,red curry with seafood, the coconut soup with chicken and shrimp and also The spicy beef salad is pretty good as well  The stuff  is pretty nice and they serve the food pretty fast , overall I'm very happy with this restaurant and I would highly recommended

TddNhbPn7ClI3D6NZnaWKA.text: One of my buds who really knows good cuisine says this is one of the best Thai food spots in Vegas. The Yelp rating of 3.5 kinda threw me off but everyone has their own opinion. I'm no expert in Thai food but everything Krung Siam threw at me was really good.  Located near Chinatown in Vegas, Krung Siam is kind of low key especially with a sort of saturation of restaurants in the area. Inside, you can tell they're doing some renovations. The seating consists of one long booth with two chairs on the other side of the table. Interesting. But hey, enough about asthetics.  We started with spring rolls and the crispy fried pork belly. Both were served piping hot. The rolls were great (especially with mild sweet & sour sauce) I could have just ate the pork belly. Man, it was phenomenal. And whatever chili sauce was included. Ooh wee! For entrees we shared Chicken Pad Thai, Shrimp fried rice, Pad Z-U & Beef Basil. Everything was outstanding. One complaint. All that food and they give you one small bowl of rice for all of it ($2 for additional small bowls). C'mon man. Service was excellent. I drink a lot of water and they kept my glass filled. And the water glasses are small so they were probably tired of seeing me lol.  Krung Siam is a place I'd definitely return to. The food and service were excellent and the inside will no doubt look amazing when it's done. One thing I forgot to mention is they are open from 11:30am-6am. Great for late night/early morning eats. Definitely recommended.

GwpAsnTMRyvziEO8m3yvOA.text: Nice location off the strip for some Thai food. Trouble is the food and service was a bit of a disappointment.  Every Thai restaurant that I have ever eaten asks one important question. "How many Stars" or hot would you like it. I guess he assumed that myself and my guests couldn't handle the heat even after I asked for a chili. We had their drunken noodles, lard gai, and their "must have" crab fried rice, which should read must pass. They had some entertainment a soloist that was playing music to their iPad. Not bad stuff except the volume was insane. Hey some people might like that as it helps take their mind of the food and service. You can do better!

1KqUh51xffeR9Yl9KSP4rw.text: The exact reason why I gave it a 3 stars: terrible terrible service. We waited ten minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant with maybe 4 tables and another 10 for someone to come by and get our drink order. Then I watched our food come up and sit at the window for another 10 (I knew it was ours since we were the only people without food in the restaurant). The saving factor: the food was amazing. Like 10/10 sooo good I could lick the bowl clean. We got the Tom Ka soup, spring rolls, pad Thai and green curry and I would recommend all of that all over again. So will I go back? Probably not, I'll just call in and get take out.  *also notice the giant flame coming out of the soup sitting on the top small plate. Definitely a fire hazard so no small children if you're going to order this!

6Db5FQd5dv0KEVF8FCv_xg.text: Hey! This place is central, the food is decent, and it's open late! Alright alright alright!  The decor here is really cool, modern, and hip. The hallway on the long journey through the maze to get to the bathroom is cool too! I liked the shiplap walls and ceiling in that hallway the most.   But who care about how the place looks! How does the food taste?!? Well we started with the beef jerky, which was pretty good, but surprisingly did not come with sticky rice... It is available at extra cost. The crazy wings were really good. They were just the right amount of crispy and juicy. The shrimp sashimi is really good and the raw garlic on it takes it to the next level, so long as you aren't trying to kiss someone afterwards.  Moving on to the main course, the pad Thai here is very good, it was perfectly cooked so the noodles we're long and didn't break into tiny pieces. The crab fried rice had generous chunks of lump crab in it, and the basil chicken with egg was great, except it would have been much better if the egg was over easy instead of over hard.   The only issue I really had was that nothing came with rice. There is a surcharge for rice here. So dishes like the Tom yum, basil chicken, and the beef jerky that come with rice at every other Thai place, come with nothing here. And rice is charged here at 2 bucks per person per serving.   All in all, krung siam is an above average Thai restaurant. Great service, amazing decor, very clean, but we were a bit turned off for the rice charges.

1SZxXBAkWXpyhOCtb3n08A.text: Place is honestly so bomb ! I wouldn't even hesitate coming here and trying if you haven't yet !   Have been to a few Thai places and this one is by far the best in Vegas ! And the ambiance and remodeled inside the restaurant makes the entire dinner better !

ougLJeE6asx5OY-wxuUMNw.text: Beer + Music and Thai food - a happy me.   Krung Siam is my favorite late night Thai spot in Vegas. The environment is relaxed, the vibe is all around thai and the food is pretty solid. Plus service is good.   We had drunken noodles and lettuce wraps.   The lettuce wraps were juicy, tasty and just all around solid.   The pad ke mao (drunken noodle) was not bad. More tomato that I prefer but pretty solid. The beer was bottled and good as beer should be.   Bathrooms are in back through a hallway and the whole place is relaxed. Nothing about it feels upscale just good food, beer and music every night.

0PHZIyX3qDrs1vDGOL8IPg.text: Atmosphere is wonderful after renovation. But the food is totally downgrade compared to my last visits. Service is not friendly either. the waiter is really rushy. We were waiting on a friend to arrive so we decide to order drinks first but informed by the waiter we should order due to food might take a while to come out and tell us phone our friend to order thru phone so he can put in his order too. Lol! But of course we didn't do so cause he know nothing about Thai food.   Drunken noodle was good. Avoid padseew cause noodle was falling apart like its better eat it with a spoon.  There's this weird smell in the beef fried rice I think due to either not so fresh beef or old scrambled egg.  Jumbo grilled squid is bomb. Perfectly grilled love the texture and the sauce comes with it. Egg rolls was decent just typical deep fried veg rolls. They also have some really good cocktails and great deals on beer too. Would come back to try out the rest of the menu hopefully a better positive outcome.

VElHg-EC5SNzdrDflP7HqQ.text: I think this is the best Thai food in town. All the flavors are Thai .
