Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crying Tiger Beef
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Yum Soup

gnhieT5_Do5pSrA3tlmtZA.text: Back 3 times since then, still loving it! The Thai musician played classics like Sweet Caroline and we danced and sang! The food was better than ever and we can't seem to order enough to get a big bill! Open very late I hear and I need to try that scene! Our go to spot in Vegas!

bESCpdg2nLNw3fXq6qiYnw.text: The service was not ok and the suroundings was good. Problem was the damn food was too fuckin expensive. I mean $21 for a $5 dinner. C'mon. What the f**k? Then the other waitress that wasn't serving me came to refill my drink and didn't ask what I was drinking and ended up putting COKE in my raspberry tea.   I will never go there again nor will I recomend it as a Taxi driver.

ozSpShS102RKYJv-8FLMcQ.text: over priced for the portion... So small. For 8.99 , the sweet n sour beef lunch special I had 7 small bite size pieces.. The flavor wasn't in the meat at all. There was only one other customer sitting at the bar. Got here around two pm on a Thursday. Quick to bring the food... But I will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special. Sweey n sour beef.

IdJ-Xo8xu3t9Gk5lAivC9Q.text: So me and my colleagues were here at like 1am in the morning and were were famished after a long day at work and this was one of the few places that were opened in chinatown so we decided to pop in and take a look.  At first look, this place looked more like a pub than anything else so i was feeling quite shady about the food. I ordered a Thai Red Curry to-go and the waitress/bartender took my order to the kitchen. We waited for about 15minutes for our food to be ready, quite fast considering its 1am in the morning and in between, th waitress even served us iced water! The place was playing thai music videos off youtube on a tv screen and it just kind of creates a very relaxing atmosphere.  Well back to the food, back at the hotel, when i opened my container of Thai Red Curry, i was immediately overwhelmed by the smell of red curry and i knew i hadn't made a wrong choice coming. The curry was thick and rich, and the serving was generous, there were lots of meat and potatoes inside the curry, enough to fill my famished stomach. The jasmine rice they used for the steamed rice was of a good quality the portion was also large. My stomach was very happy after that:)

0-5VfrbvTFQ1wb2nT5C3vw.text: Food is delicious try the yellow curry and the cashew chicken vegetable dish go through amazing watch out for the Spice we did 3 out of 10 and it was definitely medium. Just like in the other reviews the service is pretty weak but I'll still be going back

Yhtrdymigiihkzf8vkPv_Q.text: As with most places in Chinatown this restaurant is open late, which makes it a great late night stop as well as day time stop. The inside is clean and wide open with plenty of seating. If you can snag one of the big booths, it makes for a private and intimate meal.   The service is attentive and good, and your drinks will never be empty. They have occasional live music that can be very loud, making it difficult to have conversations without yelling. The entertainment has always been of mediocre quality.    The food is great quality and the spicy levels seem to be what you expect. I personally get the drunken noodles, pad kee mao, and they are some of the best I have had in the city. I also enjoy the basil fried rice.   Overall, good ambience and quality food.

9XdcM10wGzhD-k-oK8naTg.text: Excellent food and service!!! I love the fact that their pad Thai is not super oily and the portion was just right.

wHsLvwejKxqNsEL3gG-eDQ.text: Our first time here...it was delicious. This will be our new Thai spot when we travel to Las Vegas. We order the Coconut Chicken Soup and the Soft Shell Seafood salad...I had to ask my husband to slow down on the salad because we were sharing and I was busy enjoying my Soup..Lol Thank you guys.  Byrd our server was so nice and kind.

j_uDoU-4NJQhvUHIIK-lyQ.text: Wonderful food and service. The drinks are poured on the heavy side.  I have been twice and found both meals wonderful.

vYPUFsZFGao4X-1-8evtSg.text: Came here on a whim last night and it easily became one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas. The food is cheap but the quality and presentation is great! Violet was our server and our bartender and we were impressed!

NDw4jrgKdaGCKLBth768ow.text: In my lifetime I've probably ordered Chinese/thai food over 200 times, never until tonight have received my dinner with out rice. Shocked, i called and they told  me "oh you needed to order separate for rice"... wow..

jkeLuKtBNJRGoNTg-WDKRw.text: My favorite Thai place in Vegas. The place is cozy and clean! The ambiance is very relaxing. From what I understand, they have live bands during dinner. I came in lunch and music is very mellow. You can actually talk to the person you're with.   You hqve seating option: bar, booth, table.  The staff are extra extra helpful. With extra, I mean you can feel that they really take care of you. We are not assigned to any servers. 5 of them helped us during hour dinner. Thank you guys!   Food is great. Presentation is fantastic. I wish I took a picture before my husband and I went for it. Lol. I love ordering combination Panang and Thai Fried Chicken!   Must visit place in Vegas whether you're a tourist or a local.

4OOO8ZWmatEaekwYOT6YIg.text: So... honestly I just placed a pretty good sized order with this place. The 1 star is only because that's the minimum. My Togo order was very half assed. I told them what I want and how I want it. Out of the 8 things I ordered ... they were all unpleasant.

ClYiiUwmlhG9Pj5XxvSaLg.text: Pretty good stuff here! All that ramble about lotus of Siam, yeah their good but come to Krung and no wait for 20 hours and great flavors in each plate coming out in such perfect timing. You don't have to wait long and staff is great here

lc2em3AXvIZRapaZW6Y42g.text: This was my favorite place for quick and high quality thai. But as of Jan 2018 the boss jacked up the prices and its no longer worth going to.    I've been coming here since they opened and this is the worst I've seen.   At 7:30 the place was empty because of the jacked up prices.  See pix.   Food is great all around.   Greedy boss is not. Shame on you!

BoiC-F2neF36CpGN6yEjhQ.text: Was there at 12 noon for lunch on Saturday, not very crowded.  Pad Thai was very good.  Ordered the beef salad, with spicy level 2 (out of 10) ... was way too hot!  Sent it back, second time it came out way too salty, could not finish.  It has a young bar type atmosphere, but the music was way too loud.

PKPjzDB_YXxges6ma-icqQ.text: I've been going to Krung ever since I moved from Hawaii. And I've worked for a Thai restaurant nearly 7 years. It's as good as it can get!!  Love the service here. Always a blast when coming here. It definitely is my favorite Thai spot in Las Vegas. Food is pretty close to being authentic.  A must try is the tom yum soup with shrimp if you like a sour flavor with some spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cu10HjGlAjgKxafil7qE6A.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.  This is a solid Thai spot but hardly the best in Vegas.  Pretty big restaurant with open space makes it a nice venue for a full table and even for live music some nights.  They have a pretty good wine menu and some good menu options, but everything is priced a few dollars higher than the quality.  Dishes are large as the spicy eggplant and beef salad filled up 2 people.  Throw in the appetizer platter and you have lunch for tomorrow.  I ordered a 10 spicy level and it was hot but more of a late burn.  There are definitely hotter options in town.  Fine food but there are better options (some literally right down Spring Mountain) for better Thai.  But still should be on the short list for Vegas Thai food in China Town.

u5hzuZ5C3uUmUsYJ0uVT3w.text: The Pad Z U and spicy fried basil chicken is do delicious. This is my go to spot for a late night dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ty7x2RAY0Gri32sTbUUNsA.text: This place was very delicious and the service was amazing! Really recommend getting the pad see ew and beef salad

dFz00lzaV2ZtfLVEPpEnng.text: Currently my mother and I have food poisoning after having dinner here last night. We ordered the chicken drunken noodles and pork basil. Flavor wise it was decent.

6WoIA2250d3efXt6TX-RQw.text: Normally I am not a big fan of Thai Food because I haven't been to any Thai restaurants that has really great quality food but This thai restaurant really does exceed my expectations.  We had the tom yum soup which really good.  We had the crabmeat fried rice which was the "BOMB" it has really good flavor and they arent cheap about the crab either. There was some big chunks of crabmeat which really surprised me.  Then had the pad thai noodle which was the best i have had at any thai place.  The servers were very friendly and they live music .  We enjoyed this place so much that we came back the second night again for dinner! If you're ever in Vegas definitely visit this place in Chinatown

t-GUalOkB_iAjBnrJip7Fg.text: As usual, their food and services were on point. I ordered Pad Thai to go, but I've been here a few times while living in Vegas and am usually please with my order. This time was no exception. They are able to hit all the tasty sweet, sour, spicy notes Thai food is typically using a mix of spices, seasoning, and mints. Their portions of protein and carbohydrates are well balanced as well. I never feel like I'm left at the end with too much meat and no noodle or vice versa.   I did order my food too spicy this time and was unable to finish my food, but I feel that was my fault more than their. I wish there was a more consistent way for people to order their food spiciness across all restaurant or at least Thai restaurant. I ordered a 7 and could not finish my food because each bite felt like eating fire, so watch the spiciness!

2nPRTQzIbEgTQRXGGNmsVA.text: KS is a casual Thai spot. People come for the food but stay for the live music/ Elton John impersonator. The food is all pretty good and on the spicy side so don't go too bold unless you can take it!

pKqPac8CCURoXw3MKKHlgw.text: Service is spotty took a while to get our food and they brought my food and 15 minutes later my husbands. The Tom yum is good and hence the 3 stars the yellow curry was not good. Once you have good thai curry you can definetly tell this is mediocre. Very loud though I don't mind music but this is excessive

YVlsFl6Oh0rEOwqyB41aUw.text: I had wonderful time here. Good food and great customer service. They are open late till 4am unlike any other Thai place you know of. Ambience of the place is lot improved. They do have live karaoke. Also liked their warm sake. They're serious about hotness of food. If you re not a spicy eater try to stay low. Overall great reasonable place to dine In or take out ..

Is74_IXg01jtKLYK-8G9AQ.text: Finally choose to dine in after ordering take-out the first 2 times. Food was great, as always maybe even better without the awkward encounter from postmates. Pad Thai spicy lvl 7 (definitely going with 5 next time)  with chicken is my go to. I've had this classic Thai dish prepared at many restaurants before  and none of them made my palette go "WOW" like this one.  Interestingly it comes with tofu at no extra charge, I did ask the waiter if I could do without but the language barrier was just that.   Obviously the first step in eating Pad Thai is getting a spoon full of your peanuts to scatter over the noodles. The first word that came to my mouth was JUICY although it wasn't soupy in anyway. So much flavor in my mouth I think to myself  " Is this what real Pad Thai taste like" mind you the food just came out piping hot but I couldn't resist . Take in consideration I got spicy lvl 7 which I normally get at other places but it's not as spicy. That being said the Pad Thai here compares to no other, apperantly the spicy system does too.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Py7MOsI7Yuw9IYOmIwNbEg.text: Love Thai food! Could literally eat it every day! We ordered the papaya salad, raw shrimp, rad na and drunken noodles. Everything came out fresh and super flavorful! I'd definitely recommend Krung Siam if you're in the area. The servers were super nice and very attentive...I like that! So if you're craving some Thai food and in the Chinatown area, definitely stop by!! They're open late too if you crave a late night bite! Thai food always hits the spot!!

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Rad Na
Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw Shrimp with Spicy Garlic Lime Sauce

5hi5yJCz5DoYU3wqrVlZgg.text: Fantastic.   Some of the best pad Thai I've had.   The tofu cooked perfect.   Will return.

M60FOqOLTzsFLWiaZKwUhg.text: We got a chance to go through a good bit of the menu here with a large group of friends while eating our way through Las Vegas. There was a large bottle of whiskey involved, and lots of interesting, very Thai dishes.   Krung is one of the best places in the Vegas area to get excellent Thai food, and not have to rush to get there before they close. After having approximately half of the menu, I can say (from what I can remember) I'm pretty sure you'll love just about anything here, especially if you go beyond the basic tom yum / pad thai / curry something / basil chicken routine.   I really loved the Pad See Ew here. It had the characteristic smoky wok fragrance, rich, fat rice noodles and a balance of sweet and savory that makes all the calories worth it. A common problem with this dish is that it is too oily and/or it was not cooked over super high heat using proper wok technique. This one is perfect though, in every way. It's nice to add a bit of pepper vinegar and roasted pepper flakes to taste - and many Thai do this. Condiments are available for this purpose.  Lao style papaya salad! Juicy, sweet, sour, palette cleansing, stomach settling vibrance of green papaya and spicy - the kind of spicy you need to work up to. I maintain a pretty high tolerance to this heat level, as I eat this dish pretty often. I ended up destroying most of the first serving. I seemed to have forgotten we were sharing and so we ended up getting another one lol. I really get a taste for this when I've had some whiskey, which leads me to another thing I like with whiskey:   Naem. I do remember some sort of naem platter, and I do love naem - especially with whiskey. Problem is, by then I was past the point of woodford and into the Johnny Walker level. So, I know little more beyond this point. We don't often eat dessert, and I'm not sure if we did or not. After that we were in a lyft back to the strip and all that follows is a blur.   A thought: to expand beyond the farang basics in Thai food, one must realize first that Thailand is a whole universe of food that will never be fully represented by curries and heaps of basil stir fried meats+veg. So. Try something with noodles, try something with fish, and ask your waiter for recommendations. Krung is a great place to do this.   Krung was a high point in a trip where I learned Bouchon is not as good as it used to be, and the Russian burger bar I've been wanting to try is gone. I'm glad I got a chance to come out here, and I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas. : )

7S0Ay1q1s8BQAevW1GQlJA.text: We came here when we couldn't get into Lotus of Siam on our vacation. Couldn't be happier that this happened. The food and service were both amazing. It's a little loud, but other than that, it was great. We'll be back. Had the papaya salad, roasted duck curry, and kana moo krob. So delicious.

_obQ7dUh5xxUh-YU4_8XNQ.text: Walked in after a long day at work. Several tables full of people eating also several people sitting at the bar. Was told they would only offer to go food. It was over an hour before the posted closing time. Basically they just didn't want to wait on me. I am in the industry and totally understand what it feels like to have people come in as you are trying to close, but this was totally unacceptable. If you want to close early change your hours. I will never be back.

yZlrmHEi5XPVnWOh9CVxhA.text: Yes it is on the outskirts of the strip, but personally I thought the food was really good and worth the drive. In fact, my friends and I hit this place up two times during our trip this weekend.   Food:  1. Day One: Tom Yum Noodle Soup I ordered this dish with flat rice noodles and it definitely hit the spot after a crazy night of drinking. The soup tasted super authentic and was not too tart.  As for the meat and fishballs, there was plenty of that so no need to worry about the portions here!   2. Day Two: Spicy Basil Fried Rice  I had a taste of my friend's order the day before and I was hooked instantly. The rice had a strong garlicky taste so this is a great dish for a garlic lover. The beef that came with this dish actually surprisingly tender and not chewy at all.  Final Verdict:  Thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum noodle soup

owFrOPIlJA0UnjI5OCv3nQ.text: The food was very good ! We enjoyed everything, the only down side to the whole experience was with the waitress that took our order. When we were ordering a dish from the menu, we said the wrong name of the dish so she said that it's not on the menu. So then we asked if she was sure (because we've been here many times before) and she replied "no its not on the menu" which was okay but the part that wasn't okay was when she gave us an attitude and brought up the fact that she has been working here for 4 years just to prove that we were wrong. **** ( obviously her 4 years experience didnt teach her much about how to be a good server ) ****   We were asking nicely and didn't deserve the disrespect.     Ps. The other waiters were super nice and friendly, we will definitely come back because the foods was very good

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZUq524B-HZrMT1beTg6BvQ.text: Really disappointed with this restaurant. We ordered the lettuce wraps, the basil entre (chicken) and the pad Thai (chicken). Basically, there was no difference between the flavors of the lettuce wraps and the basil entre, both plates were cooked with the same ground chicken base.   The pad Thai is one of my go to noodles when eating Thai, this one was tasteless.  The servers are really friendly and accommodating but it took forever to be seated and served.

VXUNJlWtjXhSC2Y9teHg7w.text: Service was excellent and food even better!  I recommend trying the crispy pork which is NOT on the menu. It's sooooo good!  We came in on a Friday night and was seated right away. they had someone on stage singing. It reminded me of an Asian kareoke bar but overall very good vibes.  Staff was attentive but a little slow when we needed the check.  Otherwise very good and will be back soon.

4jNm4GQ1yEafJEosV1uvpw.text: This place is very yummy for Thai food. They have the best Thai fried rice and papaya salad. I usually have a lemon drop as well can't go wrong

xVlZEyKKOaCELVvWXFURMw.text: I do like food here it's very good and I got chicken with rice that make me miss Thailand. I do recommend for People if's you really like to try Thai food near by Las Vegas Strip.

aDuGXUkfoIlJ5u3XobUDcQ.text: Highly recommend Thai fried rice, spicy beef salad, papaya salad, massaman beef short rib. The red curry was good too!

CvSSoQ82xRHCFf8cta2eXw.text: The truth visited this place continuously with friends and colleagues, but last Sunday July 29 we went and the waitress who treated us gave us a terrible service and bad attitude, in addition to giving us a bad service he forgot food that we had ordered. It is understandable at a certain point, but the restaurant is not really busy and they also added the tip, which is understandable since we are also a waiter and you know that we live on tips. To which I told the waitress to change her attitude and to which she replied that if she did not like the next time she could meet another waiter. If I, as a waiter, say this to a client in the restaurant where I work, they dismiss me! Very good food and atmosphere everything !! Hopefully next time I will not touch the same waitress or change her attitude.

lComow7h4fSH7SxOTRz1Vg.text: The food here use to be amazing back in 2012-13 but now its okay.. maybe new management.. Service is okay.. We have better thai opinions now available in vegas..

IAahZh_QhdnDedN6udP29w.text: Came highly recommended by my fellow Asian friends (all we talk about is food) , hadn't gone anywhere since. Best Thai in town by my opinion. Everything on the menu is very good not to mention the service also

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pad Thai (all proteins are killer)

xLjNeSJ8iR5IrZ7pMr-pew.text: Awesome Thai food! I've been coming here for several years and it's always a nice ambiance and I love their Red Pork Curry! I love coming here for late night Thai food/date night.  Do yourself a favor and try their Lychee Martini!

RVOf3W16ni03Ipl3JsP9Ug.text: This is Thai food heaven.  OMG.  I have eaten Thai food everywhere in the country and cook it myself and even my persnickity mother in law had nothing to say.  I dare say...we visited twice on our trip off strip to eat here.  Must try the raw shrimp with chilli and crying tiger.  You haven't lived until you have experienced this beautiful meld of flavors and spices.  I can't quite explain it.  Really.  The papaya salad is perfectly balanced too...my goodness.  I have never been so happily sedated with food.  The ambience is soft and quiet and dimly lit.  They have a Thai singer crooning soft rock some evenings and the restaurant is beautifully decorated though simple.  The service is fair but oh boy the food...any Thai food connoisseur's taste buds will dance here.  This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas now.  I shall travel to eat here when in Vegas.  I've never seen the look in my husband's eyes since the very first time we met.  Nirvana.  Lol.  Just go try it for yourself.

6kKVwgdEtclQKEu2GjPzew.text: Best Thai in Vegas for the price, atmosphere and location. I LOVE Krung and crave it often.  We get a tofu dish, never thought it would do the job...but did it ever, I actually go here at least once a month.  Very friendly staff. Wide open atmosphere, and live music sometimes.  I lived Thailand once...Krung was just as good, if not better. It's not as good as Night Market In West Hollywood, nothing has been yet, but it's as good as you can get otherwise.  Also, I think they are open until 3 or 4am.  Enjoy!

4Sfq5IlfP4ps1cwHreSOaw.text: Delish.  Dark, dim interior - and open 24 hours.  Prices for entrees/main courses are pricier than other Thai eateries, but I liked the ambiance - so I didn't mind!  Ordered the Drunken Noodles, on a '8' spice scale - for me that was nothing, I should have ordered a 10 spice dish to actually feel a kick!  Noodles are flavorful, with plenty of veggies - and service was quick. Our food came out in just a few minutes!  They also have a bar at the side,  as well as a "karaoke/live band" stage in the center.   Bathrooms are located at the far back, through a lengthy hallway!

dX_UZsf8QqtlckBDB0Vklg.text: Had the Chicken Pad Thai and it was so delicious! I will definitely be back! I am not usually a fan of Thai food but this was really good!

-KqI_ve7NkoXPebf5lfiTA.text: Safe, reliable Thai food.  Chicken Pad Thai is above average.  Atmosphere is cool and hip.  They have karaoke (which I understand is a staple of many asian restaurants), but it can be unbearably loud at times.  I have been there a handful of times and will return.  This, by the way, is what my reviews look like when I write them in a hurry.  Lol.

_MIwWdQIXC9c3OEIcv6pEA.text: My review is short and not so sweet:  Mediocre food and poor service where the highlight of the meal was the bill- the lunch was inexpensive but sometimes you pay for what you get... They messed up on our order and we didn't even receive an acknowledgement.  I will not return.

QBhKOC3ztxbySjHHCDxRlg.text: Always outstanding service. Music is mixed but alway something swanky! The food is delicious but portions aren't as large as I'd like them to be.   The Thai ice coffee is so delicious and I tend to stop in and get it to go throughout the week. Funny fact I'm a Starbucks addict which is right next door. Almost feel guilty.

rfbRjNlKf0fCChtAcyMj3w.text: Being half thai myself I have high standards when trying new thai places. This place was suprisily really good! For an appetizer I had the wings which i loved I would pretty much go back just for an order of them bad boys. But for my main meal had the drunken noodle and told them to make it super spicy, and got damn! It was hot!  But so so tasty! My mouth was on fire! My girlfriend had the pad kra pow  and it was delicious as well :) the portions were perfect I was just the right amount of full after my meal. I'll definatley come back the next time I visit las vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles at level 10 on the spicy scale!

gN4W4yT0GE_eAy76YwLP7Q.text: Probably the best Thai place in Chinatown. Has that upscale aesthetic to it, but with great prices and large portions. I recommend their Pad See Ew Chicken or Pad Thai Chicken. A nice chill spot, and it is a little dark in there, but that just helps the vibe. Really good customer service too.

X2ZHmfObsAIUsbmEffIQIA.text: I only go there for the tom yum soup and chicken fried rice...everything else didnot surprise me... i liked the chicken wings, and the spicy shrimp salad. Although we also ordered the spicy drunken noodles, bbq chicken, salmon and chicken satay..nothing stood out special..the chicken was horrible...it was dry and chewy...still the soup is really really really good...also the drinks are good if you like it strong...

ocY_WkeUO58ULhD7OI3lng.text: The food is amazing! Every dish we ordered was delsih. We had chicken curry, chicken drunken noodle, Tom yum soup, spring rolls, fried tofu, beef salad, pho, chicken wings and another thai soup but I can't recall the name. I would definitely eat here again on my next vegas trip.

_jbtNRPHArgx393Y9-Qe5w.text: I've been here twice. They always have some really, really loud singer perform on stage. They should really tone that down so someone could have a conversation. Hard to relax. The first time I came here, I was very excited to hear from our server that they offer everything vegan by omitting fish sauce and whatnot. The food was pretty good and I was satisfied.  Second time, a server told me the complete opposite, that their curry is already pre-made, and cannot be made vegan. The inconsistency is very off-putting.  The best characteristic about this place (and the reason I've gone here twice) is that it's open very late, when no other Thai restaurant is open.

bK8zHqNcnSySCe56kAeAHQ.text: Im gonna keep this  short since im so full and need a nap. Very good Thai food...with a party of 20 including kids we got seated very quickly. Nice, friendly, and patient staff. The fresh coconut was perfect since it was so warm outside and needed hydration. Almost everything thing we ordered was very good...except the bbq chicken and garlic shrimp was just okay. It's also great to find out they are open till 5am!! Not sure if food and service is ad good when we came during lunch, but I'll wait till next time to find out knowing they open late.

x45-uC9sJjJuKFlbMrplag.text: One of my favorite places to go. I love their curries and cashew nut chicken. The staff is very friendly and it's a nice place for a date. They have their own musician who will sing and play the keyboard and he's pretty good also. Their alcoholic drinks are pretty good too.

R-Z02Vv1EX3uryy2QLmirQ.text: This place probably has the worst service I've ever experienced. Our server, Alex (tall guy with a man bun) was inattentive throughout our entire meal. It took us 20 minutes to finally place our order because Alex was nowhere to be found after giving us our menus. We also asked for a refill about 5 times before he finally refilled our water...and even then, he only managed to refill one cup and walked away. The food was mediocre...definitely on the pricey side. The combination noodle soup was $13.50 (for a small) where as other places you could find it for $8.00 (and have it taste better too). Overall, I would NOT recommend.

ipE-aiUsZA39hQE7wzzAOA.text: Wow. . Used to live this place.  Their sign days open, there are people eating inside, but they have signs in the doors saying they are closed for remodel.   Guess we didn't match the skin color of the people eating.  Oh,  and the "remodel" is a kitchen cleaning. Guess the health department came again to close  the place.  AGAIN.    This place owes me stars

sWVFFU-tjPNOdcp1286Kwg.text: Krung Siam is typical of many Thai restaurants I've been to.  Upscale ambience, tasty food, but nothing so out of the ordinary to make it a stand-out in my book.  Our table ordered a variety of items but what we liked the best was the yellow curry with pork, and the beef larb salad with spicy dressing.  Give the place a go if you're looking for a decent meal.

RAy9wGZLTv7i3iXcxSIZyQ.text: Who doesn't love Thai food that's open till 5 am in Vegas? Sometimes live music. They actually make the food spicy. I usually order papaya salad, basil, and cashew chicken. Quite tasty. Service is usually solid and quick. Good atmosphere. Wish they'd build one in Henderson. Probably my fav Thai spot in Vegas.

tsOQujEYbzCxYCki8Qx71g.text: Tom kha gai soup was really good. Pad Thai was pretty good, chicken basil stuff was tasty and cooked well too. The restaurant itself is very open, spacious, and clean. The restrooms could be a lot better, but there aren't any puddles on the ground so it's good enough for functionality. Atmosphere of the main dining area is nice, lots of pretty deep reds. There's also a stage to the front of the restaurant where they have live music on certain nights. Overall, pretty satisfied.

Oybrx5Hqpg9Xj1aSOrQPcA.text: Meh...not bad, but not good. The panang curry dish was more like a soup base...not really creamy. It wasn't bad, but I was expecting it to look and taste like other panang curry dishes I'm used to. The Tom kha dish was definitely a disappointment.

CbrxIEyKyQZnkuzRTgFBTw.text: Good service and great music.  As far as food that when I rated 1 star  Famiky of 4. Ordered 4 items. Ate 1 item fried rice.  The others is way tooooo salty.  Like salt on sale.    Service lady took my foods to fixed but still salty if not even more saltier.  Never recommend this place unless they have a new chef.   So basically we paid $80 for 4 items and not eating much of it.

AacwweIiRu-k-5z1QKP25w.text: Very good taste.  If you want to enjoy a real thai food.  This is the nest one around vegas.  I should spend money on this restaunrant.  Also they open late.

9n2UdD0Ue5YyepNRF9EIPw.text: 3.8  If I ever want Thai in Vegas, this would be the place I'd go.   They are open until 6am!!   Food is pretty good. I really like the curry. The salads are a bit salty. I'd recommend asking for the dressing on the side. Service sometimes can be slow even when it's not so busy, but it wasn't a big deal.   I'm not sure if it's every night, but they would have entertainment. Someone will be serenading us while we dine. That's usually a treat,.   Enjoy.

kwzxqL7ZrDMeoa8pJhNV9g.text: We always come here for lunch. Always get the tofu pah tai and my husband always gets the curry with rice. Never had a bad experience, always delicious!!

7_bFFRHhTJzQWUsn1JZKUg.text: Came here with my husband yesterday and the food was good. We ordered a chicken pad thai and a pineapple fried rice. We went at an odd time around 5:30 so a bit early for dinner, but there was no music playing, though I could see the set up. It was quiet and we got seated at a big booth right away. We were able to enjoy our time eating while chatting. The waiters were attentive and refilled my water without being asked. That's always a plus for me because I drink a lot of water. I think the price is a little more than usual thai food restaurant, but I wouldn't say it is pricey. I think entrees start at about 11 dollars.

3n745cNuMxJv7K2QmsFhjQ.text: This place just doesn't it for me.  As a restaurant, it just is a mess to me.  One of my best friend's dad is actually a chef here, so definitely no favoritism.. Sorry Alex!  My main reason for the mediocre rating is #1 The prices and #2 I just don't like the place.  I think having a stage is so cheesy for a Thai restaurant. Thai's know how to get down on karaoke and I'm sure everyone's family has a machine at home, but unfortunately the talent they choose at this restaurant for the entertainment is definitely just like at home.  The Thai videos playing are also just cheesy.  And please turn some lights on at night, most the diners are drunk and can't see.  I've been here a couple times. The first time was when my friend was visiting from out of state (he's the chef's son). We got a bit of a discount, and even a free entree, but the price was up there for Thai food.   It is a nice establishment as far as the decor, and that it isn't a little hole in the wall, but add the mediocre service to the equation and it just doesn't do it for me. Maybe that's the voice of my Thai mom who left it instilled in my head that her food will always be better than any restaurant and cheaper. Krung Siam doesn't prove my mom wrong.  I've had their grilled beef salad, their version of combination pho, and pad se ew, and the yellow chicken curry.  Pho was definitely mediocre, beef salad was really good quality, the side of sticky rice was microwaved too much, pad se ew was good, and the yellow chicken curry had a lot of filler.  Their Thai tea sucks too.  Overall i'm just not convinced there's anything special about this place in any category. The food is decent, the prices are understandable, the service is medicore.  I'd only go back for a late night craving as most Thai places are closed late at night.

sTYI47DnfbhgNVfC8EsAdA.text: This is a go to lunch spot for us! For $6.99 you get a cup of soup and a decent lunch sized entree. The dining room always has plenty if tables filled, good sign. The music is this weird mix of current hits but jazzed up like, if that's the best way to describe it. The soup is usually some veggie soup Thai style. I typically like it, only once was it a little funky even for my taste. The Boyfriend doesn't usually eat it because he thinks mushrooms are poison and will kill him if he eats them so I get two cups which fill me and then I tend to have leftovers of my entree for my lunch the next day. The entrees are good. I usually get the Pad Thai but sometimes switch it up. Today I got Yellow Curry and it was delish as was the particular soup they had today. Their iced tea is also good it's very floraly if you like that kinda stuff!   I gave it 4 stars because sometimes the service is ify, mostly because they don't always keep drinks filled and that is a huge peeve of mine while dining out. I could honestly care less if they never asked me how things were because I'm not that picky but I just want my drink to be kept full.

Ci9xwfVhNLg44KgXZcV0ag.text: This is the place that served thai food after midnight.    Good food. I love BBQ squid  and gravy noodle.   Chang is my favorite thai beer.   Service is excellent. Especially. Bank he did good job.

3IUvKfCrPQ7msrz7RG4Uiw.text: Waited almost an hour for our food, they got one order wrong, and one order of food did not come through until last when it was ordered first... Service wasn't good whatsoever, had to go up and ask for such as in refills. Definitely not coming back!

BfqCb93gt3v7E11IKCVH1A.text: Order delivery from here during my stay at Planet Hollywood. Deliver was on time and food is excellent. Will recommend this place to any friend traveling to Las Vegas

R_5Rp2mv65k3wLUCO3dYAA.text: I've been here two times for lunch and both times the service was snail slow...but pleasantly surprised by the speed dishes came out for the dinner service.  The ambiance is nice inside and there was live music towards the end of dinner (on Friday).    Review of the dishes: 1. Beef salad: refreshing starter with tender beef slices 2. Papaya salad: will light your mouth on fire...so be careful when selecting the spice level 3. Yellow curry: a little too sweet for my taste...too much coconut milk and not enough spices 4. Garlic shrimp: while good with a crispy shell that you can eat, it lacks the flavor and crunch factor of the version at Lotus of Siam 5. Basil Fried Rice and Pad Thai: hard to make these dishes exceptional...since they are typical Thai fare.... 6. Pork Larb (ground pork): extremely salty, lacking any other distinct flavor 7. Spicy Wings: tastes like sweet and sour to me.....  Overall, decent Thai place, but nothing exceptional....my preference would be for Lotus of Siam or Archi's before this place.

aU6jkOS0AqzoU-gnzlTcJw.text: Okay when to dinner  last week I felt like I was in Bangkok love the music the pad thai with shrimp it's definitely a five-star place for sure

R7aT5ZOTyduuifvTGRszXw.text: Service was really bad, we sat down for about 20 mins and no one came to ask for drinks, no refill of water, the bath room had a really bad odor of sewer, tom yum soup was so salty, server did not even care to pack the sauces that came with the order for my left over.

Xjqgr4Ajot0NzO1M4YcKiw.text: This is really a 3.5-star rating; the bump has to go in some direction, and I feel like Krung SIam has 4-star potential. (Also, my husband's review will be three stars, so together it works out. Yelp math!)  We hit Krung last night after doing an "Open Now" search on Yelp at 2 a.m.. After eliminating all of the usual casino coffeeshops (with their limited late-night menus) and deciding against a drive to Jean to try the all-night buffet (summer break = Teachers Eating Wild!),Krung it was.  "Wait, didn't this building used to be Satay?" My husband had been bugging me to go to Satay ever since trying their chicken sticks at the International Food Fair. (Translation: 2007.) Well, look honey, you finally got your wish.  I was rubbing my hands in anticipation because my love affair with Marnee Thai, also in "Chinatown" and also open in the very wee hours, was cut short on the second visit when we found the menu, ownership, and seemingly the chef had all changed. Noooo! We were supposed to be the Brangelina of late-night Thai. Shari + Marnee =... Sharnee! A portmanteau for the foodie ages! But now I had a second chance at finding late-night Thai love. (Shari + Krung =... Shrung? Hm.)  Right away I was struck by the pleasant, spacious decor. (Space is a big deal with me. It's an only-child thing.) We were seated in a long, cushy booth by the little stage where bouncy remixes were blasting. A customer soon came over to turn it up even louder. Eeek. The cushions in the booth were shaking like we were playing the Top Gun slot and just got the bonus game. Then a waiter hurried back to turn it down; we gave him an appreciative nod. Then he came back to turn it up again, asking us if it was okay. Awkward. At this point we were the only people sitting by the stage, and the few other patrons across the room didn't appear to be the partying type. We shrugged it off as Krung's "thing" and got used to it. If the restaurant had been busier, though, the overall noise may have been too much.  Several reviews of Krung complain about the promptness of the service. Our two servers were polite and swift with refills. Absolutely no problems there.  We ordered large. We're never too proud to get to-go boxes for tomorrow's lunch. Fried tofu, chicken satay sticks, fresh (not fried, although that's available) spring rolls, pad thai with tofu, and basil with chicken. Although I'm disappointed every time I go to a Thai restaurant and they don't have summer rolls like Panna Thai does, the menu was nicely varied and much on par with Archi's in that regard.  Fried Tofu: The best I've had in Las Vegas. Definitely crispy, pieces not so large that the center is gooey, and I really liked the usual sourish sauce with a heavy layer of peanuts on top.   Chicken Satay Sticks: And these were, according to my husband, the worst in Las Vegas. Ever. Bland. Kind of cold. "Tasted like they'd been microwaved, and not very well." The satay sauce was not unlike unsalted peanut butter.  Fresh Spring Rolls: Huge! Imagine a double-fistful of salad wrapped in lettuce, and the salad is deliciously aromatic with a spicy crunch. Fun to try, but hard to eat, and we definitely didn't need four of these giant things. (Came with the same satay sauce in quasi-shot glasses with peanuts on top. We eventually started dipping them in the bowl of sauce that came with the fried tofu instead - much easier to manage.)  Basil: I'll let my husband review that one on his own, but he liked it.  Pad Thai with Tofu: I know, not very adventurous, but I just love pad thai. The tofu seemed to be fried first then cut up, making for some unfried sides, which is not how I prefer it, but it was still good, especially since the tofu pieces were small.   I asked for the heat to be "7, maybe 6-7," and I feel they nailed that perfectly. That said, on a few occasions I crunched into a tiny pepper-pocket that must've still had seeds, as my tongue nearly blistered right off. I don't seem to get that problem elsewhere.  Overall, the flavours mixed well to suffuse the entire dish, and I can honestly say this is the only pad thai I've had in a long time where I didn't seek out all of the tofu bits to eat first.  As good as the service was, we did have a timing problem after all. Our two main dishes came out within a few minutes of our appetizers, so we had almost no time to linger and enjoy the "courses." Instead it was like a tableside buffet. Luckily we'd realized at this point that we'd prefer a quick meal, but if it had been a more normal hour and we'd not been on the tired side, this would've been disappointing.  Overall, Krung is a place I will delight in visiting after-hours, but when the sun is up, it's still going to be Panna Thai, Archi's, and maybe Pin Kaow II for me.

T9vJhgSwU0d5bOk7W2-ZhQ.text: This is the place that served thai food after midnight,,Great atmosphere inside.. we enjoy coming here at nights and will definitely be back for sure & Service is excellent!!!

-F90iX2q2k9VSaOOXLdolw.text: The food here is really good, but it's a little bit pricey. It's always a gamble when I decide to come here because they do this weird live music that is always too loud. If they have the live music going on when I walk in the door I usually leave, because it's too loud and to me is not very good. The restaurant would do better without it.

Y2iIi4dNOB5B_XLeqckXgg.text: I had one of the best experiences ever in a restaurant. Not only was the food incredibly tasty, the service was equally as good as the food and the atmosphere.

Photo of Krung Siam Thai Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai with shrimp and beef salad

1DWlCyz7ok1poOx78O6lfg.text: I have been here 3 times for lunch special.  The lunch special consists of a menu of different curry and entree that one can chose.  Next is the protein to go into that respective entree (such as chicken, pork, beef, tofu, shrimp, etc).  It also comes with a small bowl of soup.  1st time - tofu panang.  It was alright, not memorable at all. 2nd time - beef panag.  The beef was quite tasteless when taken out of the curry.  It's as if though they just quickly dump the beef into the bowl and added curry over it.  Not very good. 3td time - chicken panang.  Yay, this tasted decent.  The thin slices of chicken worked really well in this panang curry.  All three times, I got thai iced tea, which was only $1...what a steal.  So my lunch bill totaled up to $7.55 (entree + thai tea +tax), without tip.  Not a bad place for lunch.  The service has been fine for me all three times.

oHedA2PHTz3-vm_HZ7WbPQ.text: Delicious food, lots of options for vegan entrees. Portions are huge for me and I always wind up taking some home. Parking is the only pain.

yiUrDgIJeSrSTQ6nLLMAOg.text: Spicy ass thai food Not careful of heat level Ends with spicy ass

r03P3IspGLjTfF0Yl7pS5A.text: I've been eating here for years. Best veggie fried rice ever. Delivery usually takes about 45 minutes, but always hot and correct order! If you're going to sit down, the atmosphere is great. Light and fun, not too noisy. Staff is always nice, but sometimes you do have to hunt a server down. Overall, one of my favorite thai restaurants.

qH1vdPE8Kw0hBD_14K964w.text: Have been a returning customer since I moved to Vegas. Since the first time I came here, I was treated with awesome hospitality and lots of respect. I was attended to as soon as I sat at the bar and scanned the menu. I ordered myself a New Castle on tap and proceeded to order a 'Moo Yang' (BBQ'd pork served atop a bed of greens and spicy dipping sauce). It was delicious. I've ate this same dish in many Thai restaurants and it's cool to know that there are many types of ways to make this. Throughout my whole visit, they catered to my every need and checked up on me in a decent manner. I will definitely keep going back to experience the same satisfaction I always leave with.
